wYIfm9-H5ppWtCm81R2O1g.text: I absolutely love Bottiglia Cucina & Enoteca! I am in love with aesthetically pleasing environments and not only is this restaurant beautifully decorated, but the atmosphere is swanky and up-beat with good music.  Now for the food: The food is SO GOOD... I have eaten at this restaurant more than I care to admit and the food is great every time. I highly recommend brunch on Saturdays, the French Toast is amazing! On Tuesdays they have super fresh $1 oysters on the half shell and often times if you check in here on Yelp, you get a free glass of wine. Try all of the dishes. They are each excellent.

VZuNVffj1160GtRnVdhpjw.text: Amazing food and great ambiance! Super cute place for really any occasion, happy hour is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach lasagne!
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib pappardelle!
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini appetizer!

VmIRRJyT9A8qrkBIcUZgaw.text: Service was excellent. Food and wine were delicious. The sea bass was one of the best prepared ever. It was a nice night and a relaxing dinner on the patio was just perfect.

5NUCmVCWi6IxeCQ0l5U5_A.text: This restaurant opens at 5 p.m. and we arrived at 5 p.m. By 5:15 there were probably 10 other customers in the entire restaurant. We ordered the meatballs, Caesar salad and the Caprese salad and we both had water to drink. Once the food arrived nobody came to check on us. I tried in vain to make eye contact with anybody walking around but as they walk they just kept their eyes to themselves and never looked around to see if anybody needed anything. I eventually got up and got my own refill of water. Service matters to me in my review because it is all a part of the experience. Now on to the food. The food was good but there was nothing about anything that was great. Even the desert we ordered which was the chocolate mousse cake was good but again nothing spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs were good and big. I would have preferred more sauce but that is a personal preference.
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese salad

_lRgABDRsyk0HBiiDOHu1w.text: Had an amazing dinner here, from the hostess being very pleasant to the waitress being knowledgeable , the food being fantastic.   Venue was beautiful and I had a nice date night. Highly recommend.

gFYHucm5Sp2s-z-0-7srCw.text: Came here on a Wednesday night with family with a reservation at 745. We were seated promptly by the kind hostess. I had been here once before but not in a while.  The food was amazing! I do think for $15 however you should get at least 3 meatball sliders.. but the flavor was great!! I wanted more of the garlic knots.  Kobee got me a free glass of wine with my yelp check in. Thanks for the recommendations and good service .

Qd_GyKJpBeLdjHuDi924kw.text: Wonderful experience from start to finish. Highly recommend. Hostess was friendly and prompt. Bussers were attentive. Server was perfect. (Ask for Kelly.) Food was top notch. Must dine. Cheers!

ms-DAYdTaAI9LVjqKUFkQA.text: This is last time I will go to this Restaurant.  Everything I ate was cold. We went right after it opened for the evening and maybe that had some thing to do with it. Happy hour.... meatball, great flavor but cold. Rice balls good flavor but cold. Sauce was cold on both dishes.   We told the bartender to let some one know.  Short ribs for dinner,COLD. My husband's chicken picatta was hot because you have to make it fresh.  $10 for a side of Asparagus and it was like the redwood trees in San Francisco.  They were hot as well because they had to make it fresh. Spaghetti squash $9 dollars and cold. My recommendation is that you wait until they are open a few hours then you may have hot food. Bartender was nice but should offer bread at the beginning of the meal not at the end. FOODIE upset  Not the only time this has happened.

htTns9ZEj-zEfTt3MF8Tbg.text: This is my new favorite Italian restaurant. Food was very tasty and delicious. My cocktail drink on point  our server Michelle did an amazing job telling us about the menu and recommending popular items as well. She is a great server and will definitely come back to this restaurant.

ZvKCV6pl26SNGwIaaw0RMw.text: We went here for Valentine's Day and had a lovely time. Great service and excellent food. We will definitely be dining here again.

xzWRu1L_rFe3gyAhmusdTQ.text: I've been here three times already. First time, it was good. Delicious food, somewhat good service.. Second time, the server was just alright.. The food, the same food I ordered the first time (brosciutto eggs benedict)Benedict was way too salty. It tasted like whoever made those just duped salt all over the entire dish. The third time, I actually took my sister here for her birthday brunch.. Worst brunch I have had... The service was sub par,  it took us forever to get waited on. Everybody's food came out alright. This time, I ordered the French Toast. TheThe sides of the toasts came out burnt, it was eating a slice of a rock. It was so hard to chew down on the bread, I felt as if I was going to break my teeth. I called the server over to let him know that my French Toast was burnt and overcooked. He explained to me that the sides and edges of the toast is supposed to be crunchy and extra toasted... Okay.... But I'm sure they're not supposed to be burnt.. There's a different between extra toasted and burnt.  Probably will not go back to this place after trying for the third time. I'm sure I can find better brunch places in Las Vegas.

IQjnFPlOLgSlHlN3tHtsTQ.text: 5 stars for putting my the kids in a food coma! Great patio seating, great music! Thanks Michelle, Matt and Doug! Food was awesome...I had the California Benedict was perfect! We also ordered the Salmon Lox, French Toast, Eggs & Toast and Pancakes...Started with the Rosso Sangria pitcher and the Cinnamon Bread Pudding...all was delish. Never did we need to ask for anything and when we had a joiner, they were very accommodating and patient.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Rosso Sangria
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Bread Pudding

XbZSIEVPc_NOONiD0P-IBw.text: 5 star service, food, & atmosphere! Our servers name was Christine and she exceeded all expectations! She was so kind, attentive, and knowledgeable! Definitely will be back!

CIvgkgvBxelyEUHysFMZAA.text: Birthday dinner with the folks and I wanted to try Bottiglia in GVR at the District. Pretty casual & bright atmosphere with televisions (great for those who don't want to miss the playoffs). Decent selection of cocktails and wine by the glass. I tried a Fresca Fizz - it was refreshing but a bit watered down with very little fizz. I think the Prosecco might have gotten a bit watered down by the ice or the Prosecco might've been open too long.  We started with a bit of salumi and cheese - the bresaola was really nice, as was the burrata and tasty toast. Don't forget to try the mustardo that's served with the meat & cheese - it's really good! The arancini were cooked perfectly - crispy on the outside with a warm creamy center.  We received a complimentary Caesar salad.  Our waiter Bryan said it was because he noticed there would be a lull in between courses (he got slammed with tables but it didn't deter from his very good service at all).  For my entree I chose the pappardelle bolognese - anything with pancetta has GOT to be good! Pasta was cooked nicely and not overdressed.   Overall I would give the drinks and meal 3.5 stars and with Bryan's service bump it to 4 stars.  BTW, Chef Ben, formerly with Bachi Burger, recently started at Bottiglia (like two days before), so it might be worth it to go back again and see if he's done anything fun with the menu or preparation.

Z1ApfaByPKBY_jl8BB4fqA.text: Wow!  What a gem this is!  Hand-made pasta, hand-made ultra fresh sauce and ingredients!   I didn't expect fine dining experience in the comfort of casual environment but that's what I get every time.   Michelle, Isaiah and Raul took care of my high-maintenance order and helped expertly with wine selections that hit all the right spots!  I have now made a point to go every week since!  I always feel like I get much more bang for the buck.   So far my favorite is chicken piccata but have had pork chop, ricotta ravioli, house marinara, halibut and every single time it's been awesome.  Risotto is amazing too  Although I've never had room for dessert,  the cocktails to go while I spun some slots are never watered down!

HT6zXLU_ILgLXV6gy6OVkg.text: Sunday brunch was really good! We decided to get the bottle of champagne and a bit of OJ for coloring. Great service and very surprised how nice the interior was. Did not expect that. We decided to make a reservation for Thanksgiving and let them do their thing!

WQU7-jz2fr7Gbo9c_28mSg.text: The two stars was for service. Excellent service. No stars for food. Rigatoni was hard not al dente just not cooked enough. Chicken Marsala was sugary. I think they used beef stock and sugar not Marsala wine. Took it home and tried to improve it but couldn't get rid of that really sweet taste. We don't think we'll be back. First time wasn't great either.

gWN1U0nf0pqw6W0LzHjq7Q.text: Dinner was AMAZING. Our server Ryan took great care of my wife and I. He made us feel as though we were his only guests.  We look forward to our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari  Eggplant parmigiana  Awesome Tossed Salad &#34;The Octopus&#34;

YxXaE45r9cyFZtN6JqcLfw.text: Kevin is GREAT! Came in tonight for dinner with my family and was blown away once again. My dad fell in love with the halibut and would not stop talking about it the whoooole night. Everything was more than phenomenal, thank you for another great evening Bottiglia!!!

ZVDas6PwREqBX3_5u6FSzQ.text: Came here for the 2nd time over the weekend with last minute reservation for a party of 10. Thankfully they were able to get us in because they are very busy most especially for Sunday Brunch.   The Ambiance is one of the best in Las Vegas (top 3!) mostly locals would know because the restaurant is inside Green Valley Ranch Station Casino, away from the strip! Thank goodness. The feeling you get when you first walk in is so refreshing. It feels so welcoming, bright, happy, chic, and very classy!   The food is phenomenal. Brunch items are great and not so overwhelming. It's fresh, it's trendy, it's relatable! The French Toast to die for, the hint of citrus makes it different than most. The omelet is delicious and you can create your own, the potatoes that came with it is crispy and taste great. I ordered the panini with fresh mozzarella and eggplant, very good mix and very Italian. Do order the White Sangria, it's on the sweet side if you like that (I do), and their Mimosa! If you have a big group, it is suggested to get the bottle and share it! Cost effective that way I think. The bread pudding is addicting, can't stop eating it. Love their Bagel Lox as well.   Staff is outstanding, very professional, friendly, and attentive. Great job! I wish I remembered our servers name because he is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding for my birthday!
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood tower
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3SH4Ai5uFnu927yjH27tUA.text: Phenomenal ambiance in this restaurant. Add on a great  happy hour with a fantastic staff, it's guaranteed to be an amazing experience. The deals on wine are outstanding and the food is to die for!! Make sure you try the Caprese no matter what you do... It's out of this world!  There's no doubt in my mind that I will be returning here.... Very soon...

7pcLM_FCst2PwyJtdx0Fqw.text: Great girls night out at this restaurant! The ambiance is great for groups and the seating was comfortable and inviting. Most of our group had pasta dishes which were fresh, delicious and large portions. We were given a variety of breads for the table, accompanied by a sweet butter. The pricing for the dishes were reasonable and everyone left feeling full and satisfied. We will be back for sure...

80ychoixExkXVabwJnlkXw.text: Definitely one of my favorite spots! Such a great atmosphere. Shay was such an awesome server. He recommended the Halibut and it was one of the best fish dishes I have ever had

HTwKj8Bss84FiYZQdlDkVw.text: We were so excited to try out this new spot at Green Valley Ranch.  The photos of food and interior looked amazing.  We went on a weeknight a bit late and sat at the bar.  The room is really pretty and the bartenders were nice.  The food was a bit of a let down.  It was good, but nothing special.  It basically tasted like it was typical hotel restaurant quality.  We were hoping for some really interesting flavors or creativity.  We split a chicken picatta which was swimming in butter and a caesar salad, done nice in a big wooden bowl, but not real flavorful.  I'll give it another shot, maybe next time try their pastas.

p3vIj0QtHkaeXCJkMmtNXw.text: This review is purely on service. Sat down with my son, was not given menus. 10 min later, I stood up to get someone's attention.  They brought menu. I knew it was 10+ mins as happy hour ended at 7 pm and hostess sat us with about 13 mins to 7 p.m.  waiter never came. Never said "I will be right with you" no acknowledgement, nothing. Left 8 mins later. Not even seeing Brian or whatever or waiters name was?

T_7K_YxhASJ3KPxfwFaUtw.text: Excellent! Food quality. Preparation and presentation - just phenomenal! I had the braised beef short ribs and asked if I could substitute the dumplings for risotto, they were very accommodating and the food was exquisite. Beautiful restaurant and lovely ambience and I truly enjoyed one of their signature drinks with sorbet! Just to die for delicious! Whole heartedly recommend this restaurant! Be sure to make a reservation!

uxkNRNdz0GOTO80N6yfxLQ.text: We stopped here for dinner last night. We were promptly seated on the lovely outdoor patio. They had a great happy hour food and drink selections. The appetizers came out right away. We spoke to Javier who recommended the broccoli rabe and the lobster fra diavlo. Both dishes came out quickly and were delicious! The service was excellent, the restaurant had great ambiance and the dishes were reasonably priced. Thank you to our server and Javier for the complimentary dessert and wine as well. We will certainly be back!!

y5sHd7ZrFYFq88SMK8XqHw.text: If I could give this place zero stars, I would. A friend and I got a ticket for a free glass of wine from the place next door. We sat down at the bar and before we even ordered one bartender said to the other "They are low tippers". For one, we have never been here and there is nothing that would warrant this. When has it ever been acceptable to talk about a customer like this, IN FRONT OF THEM? I was so shocked and disgusted. Please rethink the awful people that you have behind the bar

JyY96_Gc0r9kf0Y-VP9Skg.text: A-MAZE-ZA-ZING!!!  If you come here get the pork chop--it is to die for!  Best. Pork. Chop. Ever.  The ambience, the decor, and the service are all top shelf.  My colleague got the sirloin and said it was one of the best he's ever had and that is saying something coming from Texas.  Our server said the place has only been open 2 months but certainly didn't feel like that from the moment we walked up to the hostess stand to sitting down to eating and drinking some tasty beers to the top notch service to the moment we left.    The menu selection is great and the prices are ideal for what you get.  If you are looking for a fun and enjoyable dining experience--this is the place for you.  I will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

dfGmHqI-Tecn5B1eCF6RPQ.text: Frequent Bottiglia as well as Borracha often.  Had a not so pleasant experience one day for brunch.  Spoke to the management afterwards-Diane and Mary, both of who were more than pleasant to deal with and took care of us in return for a hiccup in the experience.  The food is always great, and the management made up for the mishap.  It's good to have such a great place close by, and the waiter, Doug, was by far the best waiter we have dealt with in the restaurant.  We went with a good friend, one who is an excellent chef, and not only did he know what he was talking about with the halibut special, but his recommendation was more than "on par" with our friend's taste buds.  Bottiglia is a great place, with great staff.  Thumbs up!!

PTSbfUykxNbYUcdChF5Tbw.text: I ate here a few days ago with a bachelorette party and it was by far everyone's favorite restaurant for the weekend. Our service was great and I definitely suggest trying the sangria. The white was my favorite but the red was yummy too. And the meatballs on the happy hour menu are incredible! Beautiful room and the staff was really friendly. Definitely returning soon!!

Mxi0LPLv96G7Bd-f-59Y8g.text: Had an event here for our company. Joy Villanueva is amazing! She is so helpful and will meet all your needs. I had many partners and supervisors wanting details changed at times and Joy was so accommodating and never made me feel that it was a burden. She is very professional and will go out of her way to make sure your experience there is nothing but perfect. Every one loved the food and the service. It was a hit! Will absolutely be coming here when he have events in Las Vegas and I highly recommend Bottiglia.

Q6sIc2IgZqQxAs2EmPLD3Q.text: Wow!  What a great place!  The octopus, short ribs, lasagna and parpadelle were ALL awesome.  Service was great but the kitchen was very slow... We were just a party of four, but it took almost two hours for dinner and one dessert.  The server was very kind and apologetic and got the manager to comp one of the meals.  I can't wait to come back.  The place is beautiful!  Happy hour looks fun too- the sangria is served with round ice cubes made of you guessed it.. Sangria.  Then adorned with edible flowers and fruits.  Looked yummy!    I love that you can see the manager / owner walking around checking on things.    Definitely will be on the top of my next girl night, family celebration ... And don't have my birthday coming soon?  Hmmm ideas

lIiqywTK3ooMnmOcZ7CU1g.text: Beautiful decor gets the stars... Food was average at best and over priced... Service gets one star... Had to ask for bread at an Italian place... Not a good sign. Great for happy hour but falls way short on being a great Italian dining restaurant...  seems par for the usual sub standard service that GVR prides themselves on.

xu7j-yaQcGIC3ZbpfXHOyw.text: Atmosphere is terrific - food for me was so so - pricing was OK -

UrZJeLRaGAuWb3TeJ5t1Hg.text: This was my first dinner experience at this restaurant, and it could not have gone any better! Our server this evening, Zack Franco, kept a positive attitude all night even though the restaurant was busy. Zack gave us excellent recommendations and we loved the pappardelle. He was friendly, attentive, and checked on us multiple times. Overall very happy with the service and food!!

1q4qKSOqwJ1tnE2hDuNRWw.text: Trying something new!  What a great restaurant! Very warm and welcoming. Hostess sat us right away and was very kind. Welcomed at our table by Kobee who was very nice. Our server Gerald's was great as well as his knowledge of the menu and great recommendations. Gerald gave us time to browse the menu and order. The carbonara mac & cheese was delicious, the chicken picatta was sooo good and the red sangria was fantastic. Great addition to GVR. Can't wait to go back!!!!

Yz7tjab4iaiOdfoDbPfNPA.text: Love love love this place! The decor is super cute. Such a great place for date night or girls night out. I think it's pretty random to have it located at green valley ranch but totally worth the drive. Very spacious and tons of different areas to sit. My friends and I decided to sit at the couches for happy hour. We ordered every single thing on the list which was about 6 choices. We also order 2 pitchers of the sangria. For 4 people, u can get 2 glasses each out of it which is nice. But it was so yummy we had to order another. We has the sangria Rosso. They even have a ball of ice soaked in the wine in your cup for decor. Oysters were yummy. The eggplant spread was okay. The bread basket they give u is good and cute presentation. The arancino were the best out of the menu. It's like a fried cheese ball. The meatballs were tasty. And the Caesar salad was typical. I adore the atmosphere and environment the most. I definitely plan on coming back for a real dinner date and trying out their pastas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushroom risotto

tDWYMgfqDTwnwH9rSPPQfw.text: Great service and food! Halibut was prepared well and the farro risotto it came with was delicious

qyI5iHOlVHvgAN4gi9ZRPg.text: New favorite restaurant. Our server Raul was amazing, had a great deal of knowledge about the food and wine. Will definitely come back to see him.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VMYVazc6eqtr8SES63ysrA.text: We've been to Bottiglia for both dinner and brunch quite a few times.  We really like to come on Tuesday for dollar oysters.    The design is very beautiful and its so nice to look around especially during the day with the beautiful outdoor area.   I think the quality for the price is actually pretty reasonable.   Sure do we always get the best and most top notch quality?   No.   But for the most part we do.  Keep this in mind for oyster Tuesday.  You won't get huge oysters for this special but they're not bad either.  I've also never had bad service here.   Everyone that I've experienced had been friendly and knowledgeable.  Overall, a great night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert sampler
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib cavatelli

sQQwhfQV6DUu_yGH6vztQw.text: Love their 1/2 price bottle Thursday's and happy hour menu! Such an affordable night out and the food is exceptional! The ambiance is wonderful and I certainly look forward to visiting again. $1 oyster night has been on my list!

uI0KIIi4H3JqrUycvRXoBQ.text: Had a great experience with our server Eric, he really made our trip here. Everything was so amazing! Good food but especially the service

4yGFua4AyYyy115iZSsQHg.text: Decided to have my birthday dinner here since we were in the district and wanted to try something different. I remembered seeing some photos of their dishes and made the right decision. A very nicely decorated restaurant with a dim lighted tone it was very clean. We were seated right away and our server came to our table very promptly.  I shared the following dishes: Arancini: Six risotto filled balls fried with w bolognese sauce with fontina cheese. Risotto was nice and creamy and the bolognese was a nice touch to the dish.   Papparedelle Bolognese: Thick cut pasta with an overabundant amount of bolognese sauce. I like bolognese and theirs is tasty but the ratio was way off. I could have made more pasta at home to have another portion  Short Rib Cavatelli: another excellent dish with the same issue as above. Way too much sauce for the amount of cavatelli in the dish. I did enjoy the flavors but having pasta over sauced can ruin the dish. I would order this again and tell them lite on the sauce.  Service was excellent. Our server was at our table making sure we were content throughout the dinner. I will definitely be back here to try some of the other menu options. I even received a free dessert for it being my birthday.

HVAUGHJT-FLmBkB_ZfNv_A.text: I wish my experience was better! I wanted to love the place, the food was amazing and drinks were just as great. However when we walked up to the host stand the "gracious" host was a bii**h from the start. We were polite and she had the worst attitude. Once she got us to our table in a corner of the restaurant away from all the other guests she proceeded to give us our menus and handed them in disgust and it made the experience awful from the start. We had one server approach us and offered drinks but we were still too shocked at the hosts awful service and contemplating leaving that we hadn't taken a look at the menu. He gave us a few minutes but were given a new server. One a little more "ethnic". Possibly to fit our "exotic" look. We decided to stay since friends of ours recommended the place and were not disappointed by the food! The new server was incredible however. Get a new HOST!

mTM2msU7jU1oRGG1y4gy0w.text: Very nice atmosphere but found the food over-flavored and much too salty. Had calamari and chicken Picatta with risotto -- all overwhelmingly salty while tasty. Food could use more nuance and subtlety. Good portions, however. And very good wine and drink list.

DDBDnFr1Xj5NzJWb2Oc4Qw.text: Best Sunday brunch spot the place is beautiful the bartenders are awesome!  Managers Diane & Craig are so professional and nice.  The eggs Benedict is the best thing on the menu btw.  Highly recommend

jmUOnZgud30sCocgJxMi0A.text: Love the decor in this place.  It's light and airy.  Food has always been super quality.  The menu is robust with lots of lighter options if you don't want to fill up with heavy pastas.  They have an amazing patio that is fun to sit out on when the weather cooperates. Bar is also really nice.

89kegrK0Nw7PQVfzADr5qw.text: I have eaten here twice in the last month. The first time I ordered the baked ziti with meatballs, and the second time I ordered the linguini in clam sauce. Both dishes were very good. I also had the antipasto, which is excellent (the small antipasto is more than enough for two people). The decor is elegant but comfortable and, if weather permits, you can eat outside on their patio. Prices are fairly reasonable (and for senior citizens, they have buy 1 entree and get 1 free, every Sunday between 5:00-7:00). Overall, this is a very good resturuant.

FMkcjpkyx5XLHsxq6tByaA.text: Delicious and very well done dishes. The stuffed zucchini blossoms were divine, and the salmon plate was equally delightful. My husband had a seafood platter, a friend dining with us had steak, salad, and a side of pasta.  Everything was fantastic, service was attentive and friendly, and dining al fresco at night is a great atmosphere for relaxing.  Will return.

C8ntVus_NE0BiqYHugtFyQ.text: Great atmosphere and staff. Our server Mackensie made sure our group of 20 was well taken care of.

Tuxvv68VnhjzVgm18nPWBA.text: Exquisite restaurant ambience with classic Italian dishes alongside modern twists. Live music was playing this Friday evening and the bar was full. Their speciality cocktails menu has everything from sangria to refreshing citrus hiball.  The mixed variety of complimentary bread is encouraging to try from olive bread, parm crisps, and herb Italian bread sticks accompanied by house-churned Meyer lemon butter. Our dishes came out timely and service was spot on. Delightful experience.

onNMYy42syH7nMjyflVm4Q.text: Never been there, I mean inside but looks nice. Would love to try and sample the food

AOGgtWxzyYBeFDeSP3bmXA.text: Mackenzie was our server and she was amazing ! Very attentive and super sweet. I would definitely recommend her!

n7Mn40ddBu2ontFKOpztog.text: Place is great. Tommy provided awesome service. Nice interior, delicious food. Definitely come hete

kafIIbVjlTA--9vUXF_Z3w.text: Super yummy fresh brunch! Bottomless mimosas were on point!! I highly recommend doing the rose upgrade. Beautiful ambiance and friendly staff.

7Y-fmvGFwPZsRKNp5GETVQ.text: I came here purely based off of Adam T's recommendation, and my homie did me right.   When I hear that there's a great restaurant inside of local casino I tend to call, "bullshit," but Bottiglia Cucina is the real deal. The vibe of this place is bustling, fun and feels "young" not old and stuffy, which is where most local spots tend to falter.   Bottigula offers a full open kitchen/dining room, a large outdoor patio, and decent sized bar and lounge area if you're just looking for a few drinks. We showed up early for our reservations stopped at the bar for a quick drink and light bite before the main meal event. The bar is great, and I could have easily eaten dinner here and been happy. We sampled the charred octopus, and a few martinis and both were perfect. The octopus was very tender and just a touch chewy. Once we sat down, we started with Meatballs and Carbonara Mac n Cheese and shared the Braised Short Rib. I don't have one bad thing to say about any of the food, everything came out fast and hot, which is great because they were busy on this night.   Out of everything we ate, I highly recommend the Charred octopus and Braised Short Rib, order these, and you'll walk out a happy camper. I also keep hearing that this place has an excellent Sunday brunch. Time to brunch so hard.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Short Rib
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great bar!
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZxpKFzW5weyNMZ1Sd0slZg.text: One of my absolute favorite restaurants! I have yet to try something here that I did not enjoy, and I always try to order something new. One staple, however, is the Brussels Sprouts. I order that every time we go. They are my favorite, hands down. They also have the most delicious peach Bellini.

ghWQQrBcYcYPa-UxHQCyKQ.text: Food was excellent. Meal was a bit pricey but that was to be expected. I like the overall "vibe" in the restaurant- very good ambiance.   The service was excellent even though they were extremely busy. I knocked this down one star because of the live music. I enjoy live music, but the guy playing that night was so loud, it was hard to have a conversation at the table.

JHRKSX7oiLkVkhJZncJM4g.text: Greetings Management team,   I decided to have a Birthday Brunch at your beautiful restaurant Bottiglia inside Green Valley Ranch this past Sunday, September 23rd at 11am. Our server was phenomenal (I wish I would have taken his name). The food was great and I loved the environment however I did leave your restaurant with a bad perception of your hostess.   As I was celebrating my birthday, my guests took a couple of gifts. I forgot my gift inside your restaurants and return to retrieve them 10 minutes after my departure.   When I returned to ask for my gift your two hostess (dark and blond hair) stated there were no gifts, please check your cameras on the right side of our table by the entrance. I asked them one more time to please check with the server, the busser was walking by the table and the hosted asked for the gift in which the busser stated "I gave them to you". The dark hair hosted then went to the back (I assume the kitchen area) and brought my two gift bags and stated this is what they found but nothing was inside (that is unbelievable!). The dark hair host then pulled my three gift cards from the hostess stand drawer and said "oh are these yours?" two gift cards where from Sephora and one from TJ Maxx with  a value of $150.   I am very disappointed with the way your hostess tried to deny the fact I left my gift on accident and the way they acted seemed as they were STEALING my gifts! Please feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions. There was a camera next to our table which I am sure you can check footage on the occurrence mentioned above.

WMk-7X8UR7BLLWV26V4H_w.text: Ordered bottomless mimosas and my cup was never empty! Very happy with all the different flavors that they have. You will enjoy having brunch here.

uDf_iZdJtvjos4gzgAqdQA.text: Not often go in GVR casino. Actually been years forgot the restaurants they had too offer inside. Lot has changed since then because for the most part every one is new to me. Meet up with visitors and mutual friends that suggest check this place out. I was really happy they did because it solid italian food reasonable price not cheap or high end expensive. The Happy Hour is DA BOMB!! Not often do HH but the HH menu not that long but the things they do have are some of the popular items at half the price. I ended up getting the meatballs and the formaggi and salumi. The meatball only get two but expected since HH. The meatballs was cooked perfect, moist, the tomato sauce was tasty, and the cheese brought it all together.  It left me wanting more meatballs that for sure. The formaggi and salumi board had three different meats, diced feta cheese, nice crispy crostini, and apricot fresh jam on the side I think. I thought it was interesting they even had basically charcuterie board on HH menu. All the HH menu compare too full menu is half price. Really no item on the HH menu list that not winner.  For the price its steal of deal. Friend she ordered the caesar salad off HH menu nice side salad size. The HH drink menu not sure because I was not drinking that night but they do have few options.   My entree went with the linguini vongole. It was solid dish. Nothing mind blowing but great traditional white wine butter sauce. Decent amount of fresh clams and nice size portion of pasta. Beverage went with the pomegranate basil limeade. It was refreshing. Nice summer time drink with the caffeine. The presentations of all the food was really good. I like the fact they used different plates or even cutting boards (the formaggi and saumi dish, the meatball was in oven baked dish on top of cutting board also same with friend ordered the lasagna). It definitely gave the food more upscale high end restaurant. It could also be said for the interior decor. The separate private dining rooms they offer, think might only be friday nights but have live band (two people) playing great relax cover music in the bar area, and bar really nice. I like fact got this summer outdoor feel in the tropics inside. We ended up sitting outside on the patio area. They were busy we had no reservation. The patio actually a spot on perfect weather would recommend. They have booths that more like kicking back on couch in one living room with lot of pillows. The view nothing much faces the parking lot. Still feel separate area all by itself for me. The great thing about patio is the band playing not as loud can still have conversations with chill/smoothing music in the background.   The staff was fabulous. Our waitress did great job explaining everything since we were all first timers.  It very rare go into GVR casino but this is one spot would come back too! The HH not only steal of deal, the atmosphere is great, and food  no doubt fan.

gcd-CMdjkW4U5Kn_a5fA6w.text: Absolutely horrible, disgusting, and disappointing.  I sat at the bar on a Saturday night.  The place was not busy at all.  The decor was beautiful, that's what my star is for.  The bartender was snooty, rude, and didn't seem to care about us since we first ordered water.  A big no no I suppose.  I started  (and stopped) with side pasta with marinara.  When she brought is out, it looked ok.  I tasted it, and that was the end.  It tasted like someone dumped sauce from chef boyardee over spaghetti.  I mean really.  No one came back to check forever.  When I told her I didn't like the sauce, she grabbed it away and didn't ask why, what she could get instead, offer to bring me a menu---nothing.  Rude rude rude. So needless to say I didn't even get my entree.  I can't begin to describe how pathetic their customer service was.  I would never recommend this place to anyone.  Gross.

PsTjeyesr52yEXTymYFCdw.text: This place is gorgeous on the inside! One of my favorite spots! The food is delicious, service is great. We have tried several things on the menu and they are all delicious!

_CO0EdN1O8hlzTSbR_Qy7A.text: We've been here for brunch and dinner and can't complain! The design is very modern, and the restaurant has a great atmosphere. We tried several items on the menu and loved them all! I also really enjoyed the presentation of the cocktails from the bar. The manager, Diane, stopped by and personally made sure that we were being taken care of. She was very attentive and had the waiter bring us an amazing dessert sampler for our anniversary dinner. The wait staff was on point and made sure to check back in on us frequently to see if we needed anything. On Friday night, there is a live singer who is extremely impressive as well! Definitely recommend stopping in when he is in.

_X2I-ON2ArVsjCbgDsu9Ng.text: The ambiance was nice. I ordered the tagliatelle I could tell it was made fresh. My friend had the carbonara and stated it was very bland. The hostess was very nice as was the manager our server was not that great. She did not offer us bread like the other servers and we had to ask her for the dessert menu. She seem really preoccupied. I'm not sure if I would go back.

1s_PXNVQxEIi0sybsRuBdw.text: Came in on a Thursday for their happy hour and half priced wine bottles! Amazing selection of wine and such a steal. I had a merlot and riesling and both were delicious! Happy hour food is $6 which is awesome! I had the arancini (these were awful, bland, no idea what the hell it was and honestly so embarasssinggggggg to have cause these were the WORST arancini's I've EVER had ), caesar salad was really small but delicious, cheese & meat board was delicious but I recommend getting the full size, meatballs were delicious but only 2?, and lastly the carpaccio was perfect.  The interior was super cute. It reminded me of a boho chic/ pier 1 aesthetic. The booths were ugly but the flower chairs were an absolute dream! Our service was great. Our server was extremely attentive, and helpful! I wish I got to try the other foods on the menu but nothing was less than $25.... I think this place should be "$$$" instead of 2 because theres no way anyone can afford to eat here on the regular.  I will be back for their oyster happy hour and to check out the patio area!

uxJu4WJ1osKp2kUXT4qB0w.text: Every time I've been here it's been busy but we've never had to wait for a table. We always sit at the bar. The food is delicous and the staff is always great. Javier treats us like family. Tonight we had the beet salad which is something I would never order but I absolutely love it. We also had the charred octopus and potatoes and it was incredible. I've had octopus numerous times before at sushi places and it's been somewhat chewy. Here at Bottiglia it melted in my mouth. We finished with the veal parm which is also great. I'm not sure what the decor is supposed to b modeled after but it reminds me of the hamptons.

mZ75LL1R7kheclLOEqT0OQ.text: Wonderful looking place. The menu looked amazing. But we were totally trolled the food was awful. It was over priced and bland. The presentation was nice, but it did not taste good at all. And the service was bad. It was just plain awkward. They didn't care, nor were they friendly. We tried smiling and being nice, and even complementing them. Nothing worked.

LhLxHWiwBXCATAwsJj4aSQ.text: From the owner to the hostess everyone is friendly! Food is outstanding! Love this place

emV0krBmFnyMjw3Wah9apw.text: My parents come here quiet often so when visiting we decided to grab dinner here. We sat at the bar which was pretty open and the restaurant was quieter than it usually was according to my parents.  For anyone with a gluten allergy, be careful. I had heard either from me calling the restaurant or one of my parents that they could accommodate gluten allergies, and also that they could do a number of items gluten free.  When talking to the bar tender about menu disclosures that wasn't the case. They only had three items listed as gluten free and they were all salads. I had asked if they could do the halibut gluten free and it is usually breaded he had said. They were able to accommodate me after all but I did feel sick the next day. I am probably extra sensitive though, mind you.  Most of the menu had items that you would assume would be gluten free especially some of the sides considering they were just vegetables. The ingredients weren't all listed on the menu even though it says what's in the salads, appetizers, and entrees. This happened with something else that said it didn't have dairy but contained milk, it may have been one of the soups or something.   Not the biggest deal ever but definitely look out for it if you eat gluten free, and especially if you have to because of an allergy or intolerance.   I would come here again for drinks hands down because the bar tender was quick with that and the drinks were good. Mine wasn't as strong as I am used to but really not by much. The atmosphere is very bright and summer + spring vibes. That is the whole reason I would come again because with the food the service was slow, but again I have heard it usually isn't that slow. Overall the ambiance is great and sports was on at the bar so it was appealing to both men and women.

Qv5kLNB4Kl9N6qr7ze6u6A.text: The perfect spot for any occasion. Awesome atmosphere with live music and great food. I would ask for Nick Lightman to be your server as he is exceptional! Took great care of our party of 16!

KJgOmlCo4CbKSDpMDUFanQ.text: Wonderful place to eat after my boyfriends graduation!! For a party of 10 and for being by herself Chelsea did great! Although she was busy she still made sure that her customer service was to perfection but persistent and quick but not rude ! I appreciate that! Will be back to try brunch

mtb21geO8sBTV0Fi7Pc-MQ.text: If you stay at Green Valley Ranch Resort, go eat here.  You'd be crazy to pass up the food, environment and experience.    The people here are so great.  Hostesses are absolutely beautiful, friendly, and carry themselves well.  Emphasis on the friendly.  They take a Disney attitude:   No matter how stupid your question or comment might be, they respond with total courtesy.    The decor really makes you feel comfortable and in the most idealized version of a country Italian place.  If you're into the European country thing, you can look around here for ideas to incorporate into your home.   Ordered a bottle of Cabernet to start, along with water and lemon.   And as for the food... extremely well done in every way.  We started off with the tomato and mozzarella burrata, a dozen oysters (half Kumamoto and half mid-Atlantic something or other).   For entrees we ended up with the mushroom risotto, short rib cavatelli and rotisserie chicken.   All outstanding.     Finished off with coffee and tiramisu.   If you don't go here, you're simply missing out.  I would eat here regularly.

ykR2jjJ4HHQBKJ969O99Kw.text: Had the best dinner this evening, the service and food were amazing! Definitely would like to return with a group again. Great place to have conversations and great food.

VcTFRAm-h9Az5vwYJiNNsw.text: Drinks were great.  Food was even better, homemade pastas and risotto were all delicious.

kecC4Y3uyEbSQSCv2v5Z8g.text: Service was god awful. Took 45 minutes to get the check, only got 2 refills for "bottomless mimosas" and not once did they check up on our table of 7. Only reason it gets 1 star is because the food was surprisingly good. Not coming back.

CeSCDWEPSPuTXKso_ZG7oA.text: Everything is on-point here at Bottiglia! You walk in an the ambience is warm and welcoming, the variety of breads served at your table are fresh, the calamari appetizer is fantastic and served in a unique wooden bowl, and both entrees I have gave tried were deep in flavor: 1) Bucatini (king crab, spiraled zucchini,roasted tomatoes and Meyer lemon cream with a bed of perfect pasta), and 2) by far the BEST chicken piccata I ever experienced which was beautifully plated!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CtChHGw9PLJTEVAJZi5EYg.text: Really good italian food! Beautiful decor! Great service! Boyfriend got the halibut it was delicious and I got them lemon pasta with imitation crab?? Can't remember what it was called though and it was so bomb!!! We also got meatball app & the cooked oysters. Meatballs were ehh.. but the cooked oysters were BOMBBBB! And we got the trio dessert plater.. it was really good besides the tiramisu but we personally didnt like it because we don't like coffee flavor anything.   Free glass of wine with check in.  Will we be back!? Heck yes!

RdJizlx92BQs_5JTsPw6pw.text: This place is beautiful, and great for groups. I love the patio outside, especially for happy hour. Their happy hour isn't that extensive IMO, but the selection suffices when you're meeting up with friends.   I also love that they have live music here. The atmosphere is nice for couples, friends or groups. The only thing is that I have only been here for happy hour - I'm dying to try an actual meal!

V95L-PGhpHUBNNnI4aeMUw.text: Coming from LA it takes a lot to empress me. This place empresses me!  Save room for the lemon poppy seed donuts. So yummy. I felt like I was a million miles away relaxing and enjoying every minute!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salute!

aPoRVM7ShPFB7hIi394NNw.text: Not only is the food amazing, but the service is too. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We had the chopped salad, the arancini, and the halibut. We would come back for those three items alone. Our server coursed out our salad, appetizer, and entree just as we asked. They also have one of my favorite beers so that was a plus. Would definitely come back!

63o6vuKjf8SeD2sb18lIkg.text: Amazing food, absolutely loved this place. Definitely coming back to try dinner here. Brian our waiter was the best, made our party feel so welcome and our group had such a good time in the private room.

hlyU_3oVPMBHo8dew_wo-A.text: Went to this beautiful restaurant Friday night, was seated right away to a table near the kitchen. The wait staff was very attentive. It was fun to watch an efficient kitchen staff handle such a large crowd. We had oysters, calamari and hanger steak, all perfectly done and delicious. The tiramisu was a treat, nice finishing touch!  As Henderson residents, Bottiglia will be a regular stop.

oAt-3niEZcUK8_ThA6hiFA.text: Had brunch at this lovely spot last Sunday. It was our first time ever dining and we heard great things. Christina our server was extremely hospitable, kind and gracious. My girlfriend and I agreed it was THE best service we had in a long long time. Debbie the manager stopped by to check on us and the food was dynamite. Cannot wait to come back, we will definitely ask for Christina when we do!!! See you next time!

YfTntXc6KnmI8gdHFhzy9w.text: First an extra star FO the tiramisu. Very good. The rest OK. The hostesses were indifferent upon our arrival and didn't even acknowledge us let alone thank us for coming in and dropping $100 for 2 people as we departed. Only a couple glasses of wine at HH prices. HH appetizers were VERY small portions. 3 fishy oysters $6. $2 a piece for good oysters is on the high side at normal price. The sausage broccoli rabe was tasty and well prepared. Again a little $$$ for a pasta dish. We had to ask a few times to get some bread to go with it. The rest of the staff and our waitress were friendly and did a descent job. Lots of good Italian Restaurants in Henderson with good food and less expensive with friendly and appreciative staff. Probably won't go back unless to just have a tiramisu.

OkOWWqjcDU4SgOr_E5Qcag.text: Great service and staff. Will definitely be back. Beautiful room with a nice atmosphere. The pork chop was out of this world!

3KzFKGRcCUNrZ-LXxYL8cA.text: I was so excited to go to this restaurant! The hostess was such an angel and sat us quickly out on the patio. We looked at the menu and ordered wine. My cab was very good, but should have been for the price$$. They were out of bread for the evening. Really? The beet salad was soggy and the chicken piccata overpriced and mediocre. The best part of the evening was the table of ladies to the left-very entertaining and the lady to the right-hilarious. Not going back any time soon

WsmpBhtHnMQe9h4aU6GY6g.text: Great night we had yesterday at Bottiglia Italian restaurant at green valley ranch. The service was great especially Doug the bar render, he was very nice and knowledgable of the menu. We had meat ball, and zucchini flower for appetizer they were the best I ever had, and the pasta bolognese and the short ribs cavatelli out of this world. Definitely I'll come back.

lI9r-iAYL0RTTPYTqY1hFg.text: Enjoyed dinner here with some friends last week and the food was amazing!  Menu options were great and everything was delicious! I would highly recommend this to any Italian food lovers like me!

6ZFbzyDNCTaDj3KnLrdM0w.text: This is definitely my new favorite restaurant. The decor and lighting is spectacular, number one, but number two, EVERYTHING is delicious. I had a party of six and everyone was pleasantly surprised by the generous portions and superb taste! I highly recommend the Halibut, absolutely delicious and light. You should try and save room for dessert, as you can't go wrong with a single selection from that menu either. Further, the waiters and staff are incredibly friendly and helpful - especially our waiter, Ryan. Overall, a great experience, wonderful menu with excellent selections at an even better price. I'm going to have to go back for brunch!!

PJElQc_LqDYDTAEhjvcC2w.text: First time visit. While the food and drinks for happy hour were good, the service was fantastic!  It seems that outside of $$$$ restaurants, great service is rare.  It was definitely a team effort of the staff.  Look forward to a complete meal. Thanks!

B_XfbXi-2wpgKGzeV6PMiw.text: Had dinner here on a Saturday night for a birthday. We had a party of 10 and the service was amazing. The food was amazing. The menu didn't disappoint. This is our second time dining here. Everything we've tried has been spot on! Ryan was our server, he made the dinner so special and awesome. Definitely will be spreading the word about this gem! Always ask for Ryan, he'll deliver amazing service!

8qA1YOg6mAu9K6XT1Bnplw.text: I always enjoy an evening at this restaurant.  Great atmosphere, outstanding food, and premier service.  I am already planning my next visit.

I8GWaru1lpHNDJb_uSNq3A.text: What a lovely coastal feel... Brunch was fantastic & Zacks customer service was on point! Thank you so much! Great time with the best friends and amazing atmosphere. We'll be back!

msQLc7yEw6p34cg-Ftd-gQ.text: Was very impressed with the variety of the menu selection. They have great pasta options as well as well as Seafood. We had the Oysters and Zucchini Flowers as our appetizers and they were both delicious. I had the beet salad which I recommend to anyone, then tried the Lobster Bucatini pasta which was very delicious but not to heavy. By this time I had no room for Veal Marsala I ordered so I went straight to the Tiramisu! It was a great choice!  The service was great our server was Raul, he had some great suggestions and we were in and out in an hour and half!

odFIfskKvUBLVE7CFAQsqQ.text: Had brunch today. First time here. The place is beautiful, atmosphere wonderful and food delicious. Our server was Ryan and he rocked. Super friendly and very accommodating. Will definitely be going back to try their dinner. Would highly recommend. Be sure to try their blood orange mimosa. Unbelievable!

g7u8n3Ml7tXntBpUhZs4HA.text: Gerald was an informative and attentive server. His level of service was commendable. He has great ability to create relationships. Keeper!

RIyUY6SAjMdO2bkm7Pe5YA.text: Gerald is the best!! Great advice about food and wine, prompt service and personality to boot! Lovely!

tyUROsPJgi2_C6jvuwRu9w.text: Love the atmosphere and the delicious food! The patio is amazing! Gerald was fantastic and took great care of us with wine recommendations and wonderful service ! We will be back soon!

tHEUlLGhNEBjfkS5Vsk36A.text: Our server Adrian was accommodating at first but when it came time to ordering drinks, my friend wasn't sure what she wanted and asked for recommendations. Adrian didn't seem confident in recommending drinks. And my friend asked if she could change her drink if she didn't like what she ordered.   In the past when we ate at Bottiglia our servers were always nice enough to stress that we can change our dishes if we don't like them but we never have because the food was always good so we always come back. However Adrian was defensive and stated, "Um that hasn't happened to me before where a guest sends back a drink and i'm not sure if my manager can do that. Usually guests don't order something they don't like." We felt uncomfortable but we ordered drinks anyway.  When I asked for the check, she seemed upset and gave us an attitude as she walked away. We paid for the drinks even though my friend didn't like the drink she ordered and we didn't ask Adrian to take it off the check.   We spoke to the manager, and he was kind enough to remedy the situation however they should really think about retraining her because she seems inexperienced with the items on the menu and how to deliver good service.  We came to Esther's Kitchen in downtown instead. :)

J-KFF7mSN7gw-qnMiM2dHQ.text: Very cool date night spot at GVR! They have vegetarian and vegan options which is nice. The decor is beautiful and they have outdoor seating as well. Make sure to check-in for a free glass of wine!

xkgRBtXdbRS-dm9tPKFd8w.text: Bottiglia is one of my favorite spots! Every time I come i request Kenzie and she is the best! she always has the best recommendations, and always provides a great experience. the food is so yummy!

tvJ3yfeyq_c2NBGmIKQ4bw.text: This has to be my go to Italian restaurant :). Super cute spot. Everyone is so friendly and very attentive. I went on National Oyster Day which was on a Monday so they had $1 oysters. On Mondays they do 50% off all pastas. When I called to make a reservation, I asked if it was ok to combine both, and the person who answered said yes. When I got there our server told us no. It was fine because the food is always good and consistent. I would recommend the grilled octopus and the king crab bucatini.

U5NL7ehYBFl5SGD4YzG5Jw.text: It was a Saturday night, my son and I wanted to enjoy some Italian cuisine...  We decided to go to Bottiglia Enoteca for dinner...Beautiful decor as you walk-in and the table/booth arrangement was very spacious...  Food portions and presentation were great...Taste was superb...We both finished most of our dishes and didn't have room for desert ...The staff were friendly and courteous...  Only cons about this establishment is that our appetizer took awhile and our water was not refilled that often until we asked...  Other than those few issues, the location and staff were nice...The portion, taste, and presentation of the food were amazing...  Will definitely make a visit here again in the near future...

RtxnJiYmZv5OG893oODLYg.text: Great Happy Hour! Got to try almost everything on the Happy Hour menu. Everything was very tasty. Beautiful atmosphere. Love the open kitchen plan. Our favorite Italian restaurant in all of Vegas!

uR4NQH52qvXl9GKk16xnSw.text: Best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas!! I would recommend everyone to come and dine in at Bottiglia. Staff and servers are amazing. Fun atmosphere. My friends loved this restaurant. They always want to come back.

dEG88Lg74Ej6JBzt3jSANQ.text: I love this place!!!  I live on this opposite end of Las Vegas and finally made it!  The food is amazing.  We came during happy hour and were given great recommendations for food and drinks.  The atmosphere and service was wonderful. So worth the drive!!

ZZUGjgAOc0uuiMHr1molqQ.text: This is really an addendum to my previous review as I haven't been back to Bottiglia. It's interesting to see similar recent reviews that reflect the poor service from the young kids working the place. But I very recently was speaking to a co-worker about my terrible experience and I wasn't 10 seconds into my story when they began to explain how just weeks ago they also had a bad experience at Bottiglia. However, being much smarter than I they left before spending any money. My coworker told me that the kids at the reception were texting and engaged with each other and almost put out to have to show guests to a table. Once seated no one came to welcome them or take their order. After waiting a while they just left the restaurant which is certainly the option I should have chosen.

C3OwWxnAra_q7vKWja3uTw.text: Hidden gem inside GVR. This place has a great atmosphere. You dont even feel like your inside of a casino. They had live music with a pretty good singer.  Light & airy open space. Top notch service for sure. The waiter took his time to ho over the menu and made awesome recommendations.  I had a negroni cocktail that was just as tasty as aromatic. The sphere of ice kept it the perfect temp throughout the meal. The pasta dish with chunks of crab was amazing. It was tossed in the most delicate lemony sauce!  The filet was cooked perfectly and creamy flavorful spinach.  The dessert was really good. A creamy panna cotta with sweet strawberry puree and crunchy pieces of pound cake! -A must try. I will definitely be back to try more menu items!

wi63xXAaWowekVTec1I2Hw.text: I eat here often (comps) and the food is between 3 and 4 stars.  Service pretty good.  Wine list is my issue.  Pretty damn awful. Station casinos ought to get rid of whoever is responsible.  Hanks   About 100 feet away has an excellent list. But the red wines at Bottiglia are poorly chosen. Even the expensive stuff is mediocre.

4_cEwq_apIzzJiPagK2i7A.text: Definitely one of my favorite places off the strip.  The manager Matt always makes my girlfriend, mom, and I feel at home. The staff's attention to detail and checking up on guests is a big plus.  Try the lobster fra (pasta haha) or the octopus. My favorites!

Plf45rSWRSBCqyVqd4D-vw.text: Went back to brunch on a Sunday for bottomless bubbles and a nice Sunday morning/afternoon meal.  Really great experience all around.  Corned beef hash was heavy and thick and cooked through.  Poached egg a little thick (not runny) but still a nice addition.  The potatoes were some of the best breakfast potatoes I'e had, hands down.  Additionally, the chicken sausage was steep for $8, but came with about 2 medium-sized, sliced and plated, sausages.  Crispy skin and thick meat made this a great add-on.  Bottomless mimosas were incredibly affordable at $15 and were definitely bottomless until close at 3pm.  Only downside is it's only orange juice as a mixer, but can't really hate on that.   We had a few issues with some orders at the table, but both were immediately updated and a new dish was provided in full to remediate. Really good customer service to bring an entirely new dish rather than just the missing ingredient.  The waiter additionally comped a pecan sticky bun for dessert and removed the wrong item from our check.  The dessert was exceptional and a must order if I knew how rich and tasty it was.    Brunch game is fantastic here.  Really nice patio as well if the weather is right.  Bottiglia is the real deal if you're in the Henderson area and looking to drink and chow down on a Sunday.

I8HWfAxRBrC145tC60DSgQ.text: Dined at the bar alone on a Friday evening. Be forewarned, there are many regulars and the very young bartenders will give preference to those regulars. When someone finally took my food and drink order I found the Italian wedding soup very tasty. I also ordered the Cacio e Pepe which was served to me on a cracked dish. Real nice for a $22 entree.  It was good, not great.  Swimming in oil. The restaurant itself is beautiful but there are too many young people running this place. I would have spent way more money had I received  better service.

KjR2gcnQ_32MLZQSycq3nQ.text: Great food! Pasta was amazing and fresh. I suggest the truffle mushroom. Great please for a birthday. The food and service was amazing. Kelly our server was very helpful!

aNWp-ejR_9i0pNGd_5H6YA.text: Amazing restaurant and Kelly, our waiter, was amazing!!!!!! He really took his time to make this experience amazing and enjoyable.

OsPlb8uFA42-mwJR1wTD_w.text: I'd have to agree with other reviewers regarding poor service. Waited a long time for entrees after apps and our server was no where in sight. The chefs were just standing around. Atmosphere was very noisy! Their food was average but way overpriced for what you can get elsewhere.

TaAdgkFCv4g1c4O6gA7j4A.text: I came here on a Sunday for a friend's birthday brunch and the service was impeccable. Our server Mackenzie was always attentive, being on top of everything making sure our big party was taken care of.   If you're here for brunch, bottomless mimosas is the way to go no doubt. Food wise, I'd definitely say go with the Prosciutto Eggs Benedict for brunch but I'm sure everything is amazing here.   Overall, the relaxed ambience combined with great food makes this place a must try if you're in the area.

YkJpje4G8FD9gV-_Q5LIrQ.text: Beautiful place . The food was great ! The Chef Tony did a great job! The waitress Michelle , was very helpful . I will definitely go back again . This place did not disappoint and the ambiance was great ! Have fun !

pn3pQOep1f_5A8zFmvZHtw.text: We've grabbed drinks and an appetizer at the bar twice in the past few months and really enjoy it. The food is good and they have Peroni on tap. My only gripe is that it's a beautiful open and airy restaurant with floral accents and a nice lay out... yet they have their bartenders wearing a sleeveless, skin tight, low cut denim shirt that looks more like an outfit for PT's or a a pizza/BBQ place- it makes no sense. The male bartenders where the same as the waiters. It just seems really out of place and no reason for it in an upscale restaurant.

zkb4RDh58gJnCQPjc13M2w.text: Love this place the food, service and happy hour!!! Recommend this to couples! Did I mention the food I loved the gnocchi and the dessert selection, yum! The atmosphere was gorgeous to.

nf2aDmRtYtvuHqnl2OYTiA.text: Had a little Christmas dinner here with close friends and it was perfect! The food was great, drinks were yummy, and the service was awesome like always. Thank you Diane!

P9Usr928v5CtbVjMmKxQOw.text: This place is awesome. The ambience is very shabby chic. The color palette is so pretty. The food is awesome. I had their risotto with wild mushroom with seared scallops for my bday, tho pricey, it was very good.

utTXYOE9BYTTbsM0JA1aBg.text: Stopped in because a friend had texted me to meet her there for a quick business meeting and drink. What a great looking place! So clean, so fresh, I love the decor. We only had a quick drink but I will be back soon to check out the menu it looked GREAT. Everyone was so friendly and the atmosphere, wow - very chic, classy, cool, fancy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers!

a2eG7w9a8gK-TDWmsLWiEw.text: My husband and I came here tonight to eat dinner together. It was a perfect night to eat out on the patio which has a wonderful ambiance. It very romantic . The restaurant is full of beautiful decor and it's very open with bright colors . I'm especially fond of the Vespa with a side car in the front of the restaurant.  I have a gluten allergy and I have a hard time eating out and this restaurant provides gluten free options. I took a salad to go . I'm always weary with foods cooked in the same area as food with gluten. Always be careful if you are gluten intolerant.  My husband had the veal Marsala and ordered a calamari which arrived in an artistic wooden bowl . The tableware and serving bowls were beautiful . The sangria was excellent as was the service and meals . Ask for Nick next time you visit. He's a wonderful and attentive server . Thanks for the great meal !

8pI04Hhdb4DsuqV6AMoDqw.text: We had a Bridal Shower party in the private room and it was perfect. The food and service were top notch. I wasn't sure that what we ordered family style was going to be enough but everyone was stuffed and very happy! It was the perfect setting for a party like a bridal shower or a baby shower. Everyone in my group could not stop taking about how much fun we had and how beautiful the restaurant was. Well done.

SXcvAk-9xpd50NoOQzEWTw.text: Came for brunch with my family.Tony, our server was very friendly and recommended a lot of good choices for us. We ordered A LOT of food and it all came out fast. Tony made sure to check on us if we needed anything else before the kitchen closed to prepare for dinner. I would definitely recommend the king crab bucatini, oysters, salmon and shrimp cocktail (the shrimp was huge!) Will definitely be coming back again!

k4MIuRrgFiWya--VFjeVBw.text: I had a birthday party here for one of my friends and it was one of the best experiences I've had. Sometimes restaurants don't handle big parties well, but Matt the manger made sure we were all happy. He checked in on us many times and even brought out champagne when we were running low. Mackenzie our server was amazing as well. She handled the big party well. Food was even better! I'd highly recommend

yraYCbEwrRn7EVJGnnfm5A.text: Best pasta in Henderson. Love the service and the outside sitting is so nice . Bucatini and lobster fri Diablo is the best . Molto Bene

PbTOwWDMzzXAp218kqHLvg.text: Went here for my birthday, loved the decor of the restaurant, had a drink during happy hour prior to being seated for dinner, the bartender was very busy and got our drink order wrong. Once seated for dinner the server was  very informative when it came to the menu and his recommendations for the best dishes. I loved my dinner it was excellent

xx4WY2uz9w2EVM-AwbPEtw.text: Walked up to the Host stand and did not expect such a eleglant, classy environment. My wife & I were blown away. We both ordered a Ceaser Salad to start off with  [nothing crazy about it]...but the main reason we were there was the $1 Oyster Tuesday special! You cannot beat that! Kelly was our server, which was very polite & professional. We have no complains and are definitely coming back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful, elegant enviorment.

n3oVzNAD1z8LcapFyB4Lcg.text: I'm regular customer this place, every time was available seats. But today, they want show self importantly and send me to wait list 35-45 min. I'm just double check inside, was available inside and outside 35% seats. To much good restaurants in Vegas for do shit service.

RwfqaiOBo41yQEBzg8k77A.text: WOW! This place is beautiful in the inside and out! Perfect place for brunch. We have yet to try dinner but the portions are great (come hungry)  We were immediately greeted by the beautiful hostesses, they were so friendly and polite. The assistant manager Diane ensured that we were welcomed and greeted properly! It was VIP service from the get-go! Our server Ryan was extremely quick and efficient. He was very friendly and made us feel right at home. We had a few kids with us and he made sure to get crayons to entertain them and also placed their orders so they were not waiting long. However, the wait for our entrees were not very long either.  The eggs Benedict was delicious! We split it, to make plenty of room for mimosas, but the prosciutto was so yummy!   I would def recommend this place and also make reservations since it is pretty busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FUN atmosphere and cute decor!

f7z3QmKXXsMSUseiNawQSA.text: Definitely the best Italian restaurant in town! The food is amazing and the service is outstanding. Also the designing and decor of this place is beautiful!

KCKJhKfR8ouGh2TZBvJjBA.text: Nice atmosphere, service was friendly and attentive.  This was previously an Il Fornaio restaurant and unfortunately, the food offerings do not have the depth and breadth of its previous predecesor. We had the rigatoni and side order of meatballs. Both dishes had sauces that were too sweet.  The calamari was done well.

e4irzMAG5-wQ6nLOeTh13w.text: This is a great spot for happy hour or date night. Their drinks are delicious as well as everything we ordered for appetizers and mains.

aSSJrbyazQDUeefkUflmHw.text: If you're looking for great food, great service, and a great atmosphere this is the place.   I took my mom out for her birthday.  Our server was Adrianna and she made our experience exceptional! Mary the manager was very attentive and very friendly.  The food was awesome!  Give it a try you won't be sorry.

evpRwA7U0KJGkS4fXus2Pw.text: Happy Hour on Patio with the girls. Great atmosphere, Sangria and Appetizers!  The service was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CpU3f0M6Arpw_W7da-bGMg.text: My new favorite restaurant in Henderson. This place does not disappoint. It is in the Green Valley Resort, and it is AMAZING. Nothing short of AMAZING. What I love is that it's more of a local spot, so they have a lot of specials that they run during the week. Check out the website for the most current specials.   The wine is good. The pasta is fresh. The ambiance is BEAUTIFUL. The service is great. They also have a private room, so if you want to celebrate something thats a great place to have it. The staff is so helpful too.

ZEFlZoMuPQfRiUxYBMt0Kw.text: Went on a pretty busy night but was sat in about 10 minutes. Service was on point and food was delicious. The only downside was that the bread was cold and hard (maybe that's how it's supposed to be? Lol) Also had a couple glasses of champagne and a sangria. Will definitely be back.
