X8KcTTuSsjc4N-bL7J9DrA.text: Our server Kobee was excellent!! He was very attentive, personable, and sweet. He gave awesome suggestions in regards to wine and food. We enjoyed every minute of our visit!! The 50% wine choices on Thursday's is AWESOME paired with happy hour is amazing!! Loved this place. And loved our waiter more!!

iZlZUtNfZtQGH8Ykr3ndCA.text: Came in for happy hour at the bar and was quickly greeted by the bartender Doug.  He Gave me a detailed explanation of the different menus they had to offer. He was very knowledgable and answered every question that I had. Started with the arancini and the meatballs and they were amazing. And for only $6 on happy hour, even better. Finally he sold me on their butternut squash gnocchi and it was probably one of the best dishes I've had in awhile. Definitely coming back here for dinner.

4-gyZWudsmubQInYK1HuyA.text: If your looking for Great Italian food, stay far away from this place. Ordered the beet salad, and appetizer. Husband ordered chicken parmesan, which tasted like a frozen dinner. I had the Halibut which did not impress me at all for a 35 dollar plate. I gave 2 stars 1 for decor, and 1 for my cocktail which they didn't skimp out on the vodka. The 2 hostesses were snooty, and our waitress Heidi was attentive at first but disappeared until we were all done with our food, then she apologized repeatedly, we decided to have dessert elsewhere.

WUA0E2gFS-mZp7Y28oDAYw.text: Bottiglia is a beautifully decorated, airy restaurant in the Green Valley Ranch Casino. We chose this restaurant for our "girls night out"!! Food was good, and fresh but I think they are still trying to get their act together. Items were put on our bill that we didn't order, it took 45 minutes for our appetizers to come, another 30 minutes to get our bill so we were there for 3 hours just to have one drink and a few appetizers. The biggest complaint I had was the bill!! I had a Dewars and it was $15. I normally pay $6 anywhere else. There were 4 choices of appetizers for happy hour, non of which I liked so ordered from the menu and payed $14 for caprese salad. Way too expensive and way too slow. Might try again in a year if they are still there. Waiter very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2O3mTPvC7bn4W-u_OEgSBg.text: Doug was awesome. Looked like he had 9 tables and was still as attentive as possible. As a proprietor maybe you should read all the complaints and staff more. Hostess was awesome the food was A+ and the Rose was refilled as much as possible. Thank god we had a good server or I'm guessing the service would have been very slow.

l0JubfCmcLd4aTv_7GWR1Q.text: Great place for happy hour and dinner.  Everything I've had here is amazing! The decor is very cute too!

EFRcHnLNqy3C3LImp3F-RQ.text: Our new favorite place! The service, food and specialty cocktails were amazing. The grilled octopus is the best in town. Our pasta dishes were also cooked to perfection. We can't wait to go back and try some other things we saw on the menu. Ohhhh!! And the dessert sampler!! A must have!!

FC_zqyeDTw4lK9hpZ9Q7jw.text: Wonderful!! My family and I enjoyed the food, atmosphere and amazing staff. Heidi was our server. She was great & very helpful with our indecisiveness on food and drinks. If you have the pleasure of having her as your server, take her up on her knowledge of the menu.  We had the braised short ribs which was out of this world delicious. The ricotta dumplings were exceptional!! We also had the wood fire NY steak. It was absolutely amazing. Melts in the mouth.  I started with a drink recommend by Heidi. It had a sorbet ice cream in it. Lovely, light and refreshing drink especially for a hot summer Vegas night. I finished with a chocolate and coffee drink which was just as tasty.  We were full but managed to squeeze in a slice of their NY cheesecake. Wow, we finished it. Another great recommendation of Heidi's. So good and worth every calorie.  If your in the neighborhood and hungry, I highly recommend this place. You won't be disappointed!!

gJDD7jdoN8BSQsYkQBijhA.text: Just finished dinner at Bottiglia, when ever I come here I enjoy it every time! Kobee was our server for the evening and he really made it a memorable experience. He recommended a great rose and we ended up buying the bottle which entered us into there wine club! The chicken parmesan was my fave!! I love this restaurant!

4JN4KmLDd_KPMiKluUSocQ.text: The food was outstanding, I had the calamari, sea food tower, cauliflower and squash all top notch, it was my first time here and he service at best was slow, I asked for bread 3 times and it was 39 min after the last time I asked. I will try one more time as they are new and may be having growing pains

os7wp-LZHaO6QyuJm238Eg.text: Hello and welcome to Bottiglia Cucina & Enoteca. This excellent restaurant is nestled into Green Valley Ranch on the south side of the hotel next to the parking lot. This is a Brian Massie, Click Hospitality venture so we had high hopes. (not disappointed) It was quite busy and we were seated promptly. Seated back by the kitchen area we had a great view of the kitchen and the expedite pass. The head chef was at the pass the whole time and it was nice to see kitchen in action. They offer bar seating overlooking the kitchen and we were told that when you do this there is a special chef service.  We arrived toward end of happy hour where beer and appetizers where discounted. I will say that service was prompt once seated and drink orders were taken. Appetizers we ordered the Wood Roasted Eggplant Spread and the Cheese and Salami Board. he spread had a sweat smoky taste and with the toasted garlic bread added extra zest to the overall bite. The cheese and salami spread was quite nice however at this moment I can't recall the names of the meat or cheeses, but they were good.  Dinner, josie had the Pappardelle Bolognese. This was at suggestion of our waitress who was quite informed on the menu and taste profile of our dishes. The bolognese was very meaty and the Pappardelle is the only pasta that is hand made there at the restaurant. I had the Wood Roasted Pork Chop. Very tender and cooked perfectly medium as requested. Chop sat on a bed of Tuscan Kale with apples and pickled mustard seeds. We got a side of the Carbonara, Mac & Cheese. This Mac n Cheese was pretty amazing, and I am hard to please with Mac n Cheese. Peas, Parm and guanciale. Guancialle; an Italian cured meat taken from the pork jowl or cheek. This added so much to the profile of the Mac. Think using pancetta but better. Great dinner course and the whole time the wait staff was attentive. Of coarse we had dessert. This jar of Tar Tiramisu layered in a jar topped with chocolate shavings. I had custard filled Doughnut holes with a red wine jam. Both were an excellent end to a delicious meal. Thank you for dining at Bottiglia Cucina & Enoteca. We will most definitely go here again. The staff was great food amazing. overall a great dining experience.  If you are in GVR and looking for a great meal please check this place out.

DQTdaX77JQ4mqSB3_wTspg.text: We had the best brunch experience!  Food was amazing and Ambiance was superb!!  We had the corn beef and hash and a build your own amazing omelet.  The potatoes were the best I've ever had.  Our server Brian was attentive and explained the dishes and offered great suggestions.

92DBO1Mu4E_CG9Wn0ZnxKw.text: Best Italian food in Henderson! I had heard rave reviews about this place & finally got to check it out. Great wine list. Nice to see a cheese & salumi selection on a menu. I feel like Vegas lacks that often. My boyfriend had the halibut, but I can't review it because he didn't share. I had the pasta with meat sauce. Absolutely excellent. Would recommend this place to anyone in Vegas or Henderson looking for great Italian food!

mjia2x9-hZBIPM9ZoedNuA.text: beautiful venue! great service and even better food! the cheesecake is amazing! love the family style portions as well. can't go wrong with some good italian!

AOFxgcjWzKkJYsRdeIHL5Q.text: Really good happy hour!! Ambience checked! Food checked!!! Service... amazing and fast! Over all will definitely come back.

UwXH_hanwgXpVONSo8ZDdQ.text: The food and service is great. I went here for my birthday and thoroughly enjoyed. Great atmosphere. The patio is nice and their bar is cool, too.

uhfwA9B-0S4LADzo_nPjew.text: We are a family owned business that visits GVR regularly and we went to Bottiglia on Mother's Day. Christina was our server and she was the best. Great service and personality, we had a great time for brunch!

_NyVVGzQL_tR3EX6GmKAgA.text: This by far exceeded my expectations! What a fabulous place To enjoy the most amazing dishes Such creations as carpaccio with poached egg (who would have thought?!) & mushroom risotto and cauliflower toasted in a wood oven with pinenuts and herbs that just melt in your mouth ! I have found a new place A MUST TRY for anyone reading this review !! Refreshing enthusiastic  beautiful servers and. EXEC CHEF & GM who are so friendly! Loved it! pS Javier & Raul you're amazing too, But the girls you guys are the best!! Thx  Mary! You guys rock all rock!

Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing place SCRUMPTIOUS

9WK15_CQaTw2Dtpafd56zA.text: ..when in town we visit this restaurant at least once, sometimes twice, a week.. it really is one of the best in the area.. and so when they have only one red and one white house wine and neither are of good quality it's a disappointment... bulk wine can be exceptionally profitable.. but it's a total fallacy that it has to be of lesser quality.. this restaurant can and should do better in this offering..

Mo4KffDmE1Sm1yjsGA7hsw.text: Went here the other night, pretty cool set up, kinda weird but I like that. Had an amazing server, I think his name was Zack? I initially thought he was the manager but embarrassingly found out he wasn't. Although not the manager (yet) he was very helpful, knew the menu well and was super friendly. He kept giving me drinks and before you know it I was feeling great, had to leave him a solid tip after all the drinks but he was worth it. I'd go back to experience his service. Ordered a king crab bucatini, that shit was good, side note my server recommended it and I'm glad he did. I can see me spending money there again, hopefully that Zack guy is working again, he made the experience worth it.

R0INusy6-HHkvDQpeYfZ9g.text: Fair. Nothing to get excited about. Chicken Marsala was a bit dry. Caesar salad had too much pepper.

ZufAJF7qG8ZngD6Ukr2erQ.text: Came here for brunch and it was delicious! Between the 7 of us we ordered a combination of the french toast, prosciutto eggs benedict, oysters, and built our own omelettes, & mimosas and bloody mary's of course. I'm super critical of brunch because it is my favorite meal and I can honestly say that the breakfast potatoes are the best I've ever had. The ambience is beautiful. Felt like we were brunching in the Hamptons. So glad we found a brunch spot that isn't on the strip. We heard dinner is excellent too so we'll definitely be back.

ebW78ajhzF1fbeDNP-L6oA.text: Great restaurant inside the casino. Exceptionally gorgeous interior with a classy kitchen and dining rooms! Stellar service from Michelle... be even kinder to yourself when you dine there, and ask for her to be your server! I love their rustic attire and hip style.  I had the halibut which was cooked perfectly wth an incredible carrot puree with peas and farro risotto! Yuuuuuuuuuummmy! My husband was born and raised in Rome, Italy and has only been in the  states now for about 8 years and he really enjoyed his pork belly pasta dish! We will return definitely !

pcsQ3uD8v_11ofIA0dfQoQ.text: I was with my beau, and his elderly father we always go out for Sunday dinner since my guy's mother passed away. Anyway we pops made reservations for 6 PM but we were early. We opted to sit on the patio- the weather was beautiful and the football game was on. Ok so what we all like was the ambiance, the outdoor furniture was very comfortable. What we all thought needed a complete turnaround- Service- we had to ask for silverware, napkins. After the waitress walked about to other tables we finally got them. We had to ask for refills on our water and iced teas got those about 10 minutes later and it wasn't just our table the other tables in our outdoor section had to repeatedly ask for things that SHOULD have already been on the table. We finally put our order in( remember reservations were for 6 & we were early) we waited an entire hour and 15 minutes before our food came!!!! And the lady could not even make sure the the bread we chowed down of while waiting was refilled. We had to ask another waitress in passing for bread who looked like she couldn't be bothered because "we weren't her table" When the food finally arrived my braised short ribs were so TOUGH  I could not eat them all there were 4 on the plate I could eat 1. My guy's father order the Veal Marsala which came as just a plate of meat, Being that was our first time neither of us knew that the meat entree came with no veg. but for the prices that the charge you should well have at least 2 vegetable choices. We seem to have struck up a little friendship with the people in our section and all were not happy with the service. We will never go back even if they offer free meals.

rA-HObjIRuPTUvlrYz3GVA.text: To start, the restaurant is beautiful! Not only did the general manager mary show us into the restaurant but the bartender tony was so helpful! He was very  busy but promptly explained that he would be right with us.. the happy hour wine was a perfect pairing with our food choices ! I couldnt be happier! I highly reccomend this restaurant !

0EU9lJaeFmAUUfQP7cvQHg.text: The restaurant is very cute. Makes me think of California. We enjoyed everything we ordered. Service was on spot. The only thing I didn't care for was the large tvs in the dining room. It's not a sports bar. It could be very romantic if it wasn't for the tvs. Hostesses super sweet and gracious. We want to come back and have happy hour.

-bpyRzNdH0KfWF1iLBJK7g.text: We ordered the 'hits' from our first visit and again, excellent. Service was more attentive, as we felt as though we were being waited on by a team or an army of staff. Still, there were some more lengthy waits, like for the check. Our waitress still didn't seem particularly sincere but she was friendly enough. My husband's water went unfilled for most of the meal. And no one ever asked if we wanted fresh pepper on our salads, cheese on our pasta, or more bread so we had to ask. I think it's in the details that things are getting lost here.  I think the atmosphere is beautiful, minus the TVs. Convenient location too.  Update: We returned last night after being away for a few months. Service was great, still missed a few details, but the food was bland and unremarkable. No seasoning, heavy on the flour for the calamari, and salads were bland. This seals the deal...been there about six times now and it's completely inconsistent. Likely won't return.

3IcbIRRndxo92v8D7kzWXw.text: Cobee is the best! He has great recommendations and I will definitely be back very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My new favorite place! Cobee is the best, very knowledgeable for recommendations!

QJKVZzG-_ZhdSYgSiaXivw.text: Came here on a rare date night with my wife. Ambiance is nice and decor is very Home and Garden looking. Food was very good. A lot of pasta dishes, makes sense as it's an Italian place. Menu seems to be basic dishes made a little fancier. Don't expect alfredo, pesto, etc... wine and red meat sauces here only it appears. Wine selection seems good. They had a sangria drink that my wife got that was pretty tasty. Oh, and of note: they do not have gelato which was a bit surprising and a little bit of a bummer...

5zxEN4QQtFaTlDUnjUYhnA.text: It was one of the worst meals we have ever had.  The pasta tasted like gum.  Doughy and spongey.  What was supposed to be bolognese sauce had little meat.  Waitress was good but service not so much.  Appetizers for us were not served at the same time.  One diner finished his before the rest of us got served.  Would NEVER go back.  I am of Italian descent and this was NOT an Italian meal.

Jokd6FOuyvjLUH7aV8IU1A.text: I have been to Bottiglia numerous times.  The bar service is stellar, however, each time I have sat in the dining room area it has been less than great.  This restaurant's main issue is service.  It took us about 10 minutes for our server, Gerald, to greet us, and he seemed like he was rushed each time he spoke with us.  He also oddly kept giving us items 'on him' such as two bottles of Evian water and coffees at the end of our meal.  I think maybe he thought it would change our impression of him if he added in free items, but it certainly did not.  All we wanted was great service and an overall great dining experience--which was not the case.   I will ONLY be visiting this restaurant again if I sit at the bar.

Ev6IUnq3qGdxDTyi9_otkA.text: The food was amazing with fantastic service our waiter Nick was enthusiastic and charming, all of his recommendation helped us chose a delicious meal. Top of the line with food and service I will for sure come back and bring all my friends!

zTFI6cfy9sKiVl-1yr2-5A.text: I can't do Italian food unless it made by my mother, grandmother, or grandfather. All who descend from Sicily. However, this place silences even the most difficult critics. Each dish made with care, the kitchen obviously has a deep respect for this cuisine. And the employees treat you like family. Overall an authentic Italian experience.

qT1cRh_dMOKDFLGjz0QXgA.text: Amazing experience from the beginning starting with the atmosphere,Brain was awesome and took great care of us. Must try the carpaccio!!

_9ByKmtbJGBdJYrm4bE6pQ.text: Our server Noelani was amazing and everything we ordered was delicious! Definitely get the chicken Parmesan.

g34-YjCUiwJ0sHZIA0Bi6w.text: This place is unbelievable! You can bring your own wine or buy theirs! Michelle was our waitress and she was great! Javier is the manager and he brought us calamari on the house and it was delicious! This is a must stop in Vegas!

CBBCk1aqKsGm5vF2oV-AIA.text: Always good food! Been here many times and we always request Kobe.  We were a little hesitant of the menu changes but they have been great.  We just tried brunch lately and it was good as well, our server told us they put OJ in the pancakes ! Yummy

cQYglqD2dBr1z6lfha-E_g.text: Celebrated my 21st birthday at Bottiglia. I am still in shock at how special they made my day! Our server was Raul and he was very attentive to our needs, always making sure our drinks were filled and table was cleared for the next round of apps/entrees. Raul was very knowledgeable about the menu and was very helpful in helping me to pick out some yummy drinks like the Bellini (one of my favs). We started with several appetizers that were sent out ((Thanks Mary & Chef Josh))!! The calamari was sooo good & crisp I am going to order every time! For entrees I split the bucatini (I recommend adding shrimp!) with one of my friends and it was perfect size for us since we filled up on the apps. My friends bought a nothing bundt cake for me & Raul had it cut & brought it out to me with candles and sang! Thank you Bottiglia for celebrating with me!!! Can't wait to do it again!

SkBKEgpqDpiBrNe_xBQUKA.text: The food was excellent as well as the service! Kobe was our server and he amazed us by how assertive he was and on top of it. Great experience all together!

gOYIfB8pWxoGMEPwk5q3zw.text: Went for a girls night out, though we had a reservation the hostess couldn't tell me where they seated mh friend. The waitress seemed fairly new but service was decent. I ordered the chicken piccata with a side of pasta, since the chicken doesn't come with any thing, which was odd. Pasta was cooked perfectly but the entire meal was extremely salty.

a-9_WoBNf-WiYtM7W1h_Zw.text: What a cool place! Great Mimosas and appetizers ! Great indoor out door options for dining !

ajDxdx6M2TPQ9pmMOfkeNw.text: We absolutely loved our dining experience at Bottiglia! The service was quick and super friendly. The cocktails were unique and delicious! I loved the red sangria! The family size salads were more than enough for the five of us. The main courses were authentic, original, and very delicious! The dessert sampler and cappuccinos were the perfect ending to a well done dining experience. I highly recommend it for a family or date night. They have an awesome bar at the entry. Beautiful, fresh decor everywhere, and a wonderful outdoor dining patio. Can't wait to go back!

Vp0Vrr1UiK2fJzcYI4Su9Q.text: The food is quite good- but the noise level, especially when they have live music is horrendous. Additionally we had to ask the manager three  times to turn the music down so we could have a normal conversation with our dinner companions.I also did not appreciate having to share the bathroom with male guests. I don't care if that is customary in Europe- it was very uncomfortable. The coffee with dessert was cold and when we asked the waiter about getting hot coffee, he was not very agreeable about it and we never did get fresh, hot coffee. They also seem very disorganized, even though the wait staff seem helpful, it appears no one is in control of the chaos there.

b4RmPqGqlXH39jA6QeDkeA.text: Their Brussel sprouts is THE BEST. Their bread and butter is quite good as well. The rest of the meals we tried were ok at best.

uMrxGA48mLnuWE_T88lQHg.text: The food was great. Our waiter was also very helpful and really nice. I didn't like my lemonade and he had no problem changing it for us. There was also live music while we were there that was really good.  Roasted beet salad- I felt like this dish could of used more cheese. I generally like beet salads with goat cheese and they used blue cheese which is still good but it needed a little more to me. The salad was a little to sweet.   Short rib cavatelli - this dish was excellent. It was recommend from our waiter. The ricotta on the sides made it even better.   King crab bucatini - was very good. It is more lemons tasting so you don't have to much cream here in the sauce. Full pieces of crab inside the pasta.   It was our anniversary and so they gave us a free tiramisu which was good. Wasn't the best I ever had but it was very good. Very chocolately tasting.   On in all I loved this place and I will be back.

_o4nX6Pf5nKlKPjte0Q_XQ.text: Horrible experience. My daughter and husband has diarrhea from the night til all day next day. We don't know if it was the $1 OYESTER OR VEAL. I'm assuming the oyesters were bad. They both said there were few which tasted bad. SO IN CASE IT IS, BEWARE EATING $1 OYESTERS!!! It could've also been the Veal too. My husband ordered a pasta with clams. OMG, it was literately dunk in SALT. He couldn't too much because it was WAY TOO SALTY!!!  So, he ate 1/2 of my daughter's dinner which was veal. I only had a small bite of it. (I only had skin rash on my leg).  We paid over $150 just on dinner, no desert nor drinks, but what a horrible experience!!!  Pasta that's was so SALTY that we couldn't eat and to suffer all night and next day running to bathroom!!!  We're so disappointed. IT WAS A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!

b_OSobCPfxM2Z-DIbqulVw.text: Love the experience I go here often for wine tasting and their amazing calamari! There is also a free glass of wine with an entree once you check in.

XQUdO0aGZiKMeY3TDGzEFA.text: Bottiglia has been on my radar for a while so I was very excited to try it! We went on a Monday at 5p as soon as they opened and with happy hour. We got on the happy hour menu, the beef carpaccio, tomato soup with grilled cheese and prosciutto and a charcuterie board. The plates were smaller than I thought they would be and what the pictures show. The beef carpaccio was delicious and a little sour once you mix the lemon and arugula. Tomato soup was not bad a little on the cold side but the grilled cheese was different, the bread had a sweet taste to It. The cheese board was phenomenal I love prosciutto and salami, I also think they had truffle cheese and they all mixed well together. For the main dish I opted for a linguine with clam and king crab pasta. The dishes were smaller than a normal dinner size but they were hot and tasted as I thought they would. It wasn't spectacular but wasn't bad, I might come back for happy hour and their cheese board! They have also been advertising 1/2 off all pastas in November and have the same pasta on every billboard BUT they don't offer the pasta they are advertising. Disappointing.

KS0dou2DlP4mQcww9VVKPg.text: I've visited Bottiglia many many times and havent gotten around to writing a review. I've tried a lot of things on the menu. My favorites are hands down the grilled octopus appetizer with black garlic yogurt sauce. Has great flavor of the grill and the tender octopus with the crispy potatoes underneath and that amazing sauce is really something. Even non octopus lovers can't help but enjoy it. Then my next favorite is their tiramisu. I used to believe it wasn't possible to find top shelf tiramisu outside NYC but Bottiglia's might be better than any I've ever had even in New York. Just really unique, flavorful with great textural complexity that you don't typically find in a run of the mill tiramisu.   Other favorites include their hangar steak. Delicious. The brunch menu has an amazing granola dish that is really tasty and enjoyable. Followed by their amazing corned beef hash with tomatillo sauce (incredibly good). Pair that with some of the best tasting coffee you will find in Las Vegas and you'll have a winner brunch. The staff is always great (although they've had a lot of turnover I've noticed in their first year). Jeremy has become the new guy at brunch on weekends and does a great job taking care of me.   Lastly, I would be remiss if I didnt mention that it's one of the most beautifully appointed restaurants in all of Las Vegas. Off the strip, it has no real competition in that category. There is almost no where in Henderson that has outdoor seating in a classy upscale environment with top shelf food and service. It's a unique place and hopefully the first of many more like it in Henderson, where the culinary scene is badly lagging behind for a city that size.

QJCb86AAkQ6iaLFxdJfqHw.text: We came here on a Saturday night to celebrate a birthday. The decor is beautiful and the dim lighting had just the right ambiance. We got the free glass of wine with the Yelp check in, which the food server quickly brought to the table.   Food: Antipasti: Arancini - creamy inside, crispy outside and served with a delicious bolognese. Calamari - nothing spectacular. Sides: Macaroni and cheese - amazing! I could've eaten only that and been absolutely in love. Entree: Braised Short Ribs - beautifully plated, fork tender. Not super flavorful,  but not bland either. The spinach ricotta dumplings were bite sized (comes with two) and not really memorable.  And as random as this sounds, I do not know what was in the butter that comes with the bread basket,  but I need more of that in my life.   Food service: Great! Attentive server. I think his name was Kobi (sp?) Our water and wine glasses were never empty. Finished plates were cleared promptly. New silverware brought out with each course.   I would definitely try this place again if ever in Henderson again. If for nothing else on the menu, but the macaroni and cheese.

RXAnWB5vEZMrihZ54QQ3WA.text: As we walked in, we were greeted by 2 very friendly hostesses who were familiar with our reservation.  Heading over to our table, we noticed the ambiance! Amazing! It's SO fresh and welcoming. Our sever was amazing and the manager, Mary, personally came over to greet us and check on us throughout our dinner. The "endless summer" and "peach mule" are delicious cocktails! Every single dish we ordered did not disappoint. Chef Massie's signature was all over every bite! Definitely will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts, entrees and cocktails

MXGLOKSrH2A7O4p2Ff6fUw.text: Went here for happy hour based on a friends recommendation, service was a little out to lunch as we waited a few minutes when it wasn't very busy.  The food however was good, 4/5 overall. Arancini were good and crispy, the lasagna was very standard nothing special however. The dessert sampler was pretty good also donuts were excellent. The service was not that great - at the end of the meal the server ended up running my card on the wrong check, then did not take off a free drink i had from my yelp check in- despite the server telling me he did exactly that. Overall - eh it was alright- 3.5/5

MsrzMSuF06SNo9scFwzf4g.text: Loved this place!  My girlfriend took brought me out to this restaurant for my birthday. I had been dying to try this place.  The decor and feel of the restaurant definitely a place to come hang out and drink lots of wine and food.   The kitchen gets down with the food!!  We were there Tuesday so we took advantage of the dollar oysters.  Had the beef carpaccio the egg, hearts of palm the aioli and freso all make your tastebuds dance! I ate mine with the parm crisp it was delicious.   Definite highlight of the night was the bolo! That pasta and the texture it had was great! Has a nice chew to it always something I look for in fresh pasta.   Thank you for the great dinner!

qDHYbf0NiR2F8TgPwy6U9Q.text: Gorgeous restaurant the food was great but  you may want to eat before you go though for the price You don't get much food but what you get is incredible in a beautiful atmosphere.  Even though I left hungry I will definitely go back and highly recommend!

mD7OK0st7CItJJJb8nV0Pg.text: $1 Oysters on Tuesdays!!!!!!! That's what brought me there but I was pleased with so much more.  The place has a really relaxing vibe to begin with so that was a great start. Service was prompt. We had a couple of happy hour items along with the oysters before having the Chicken Picatta yum!!! I liked that it didn't come with pasta but I could have added it (and the carbs!) if I wanted to. I'll be back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters fresh from Washington State!

eCUXw8QvgbHb41MHoem-kA.text: Bottiglia delivers on all fronts. Rarely do restaurants live up to the beauty the photos on yelp represent. Walking into the restaurant transports you out of the dated Green Valley Ranch and into a chic and colorful world. The high chairs are a bit hard at first to get in, but once you're seated they promise an elevated dining experience.  I could tell our server had in-depth knowledge of the food and drink menus, although he was young I was impressed. It's rare to see proper bottle service at a Henderson restaurant. We went with a classic Brunello Montecino. Absolutely delightful. Our server Kobe even decanted the wine without us asking.  I chose a a meat dish , as did the rest of my group. Veal Parmesans and also some chicken dish I can't seem to recall the name of. They were wonderful, and the squash side is a must! That's Italian  for you though.

fSt_h5XDb0cFwkS_sBRqew.text: We made a reservation for 7pm for 2 on a Saturday. I made the reservation through yelp and had no issues when we arrived.  We were seated in a 4-too by the entrance to one of the private rooms in the back corner. This was annoying as the difference in air pressure kept a constant flow of air blowing out of the door cracks onto our seat, additionally, this was the only way in/out of the room for guests and staff. It was right next to my chair, not even in between two different tables... We ordered the chopped salad - delicious, the arancini - rice and cheese deep fried, but the Bolognese sauce with it was great, the Wild Mushroom Pasta was amazing but very rich, the Farro risotto was not that good, chicken picatta was decent. Portions were OK for pricing. It's in a resort and spa after all....

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Sxlqh3ENI6KRcj6nx-uygA.text: So I came here for drinks and hanging out and fell in love! All white classy elegant vibe with intricately detailed mixology intertwined with excellent food. I heart Monday's they have pasta special nights!:) I definitely recommend this spot as a date spot, romantic with a bit of an edge. Lots of open space and it's great for a summer day due to the outside patio or an evening in.

TvDB21PsFusPcYC7Y9_RKA.text: The food was delicious & the service was good. We waited a little while for our order of oysters, but neither of us minded considering I was distracted by watching the cooks work and my other half was watching the Monday night game. The manger took care of the oysters off our bill for the wait, I thought that was extremely nice considering we didn't even complain. Our overall experience was amazing.

9FFfJr3GnD8MHmeJFoeY_A.text: Walk in with no reservation,sat at the bar. Food was amazing,we had the Cesar salad to start and king crab bucatini. Bartenders were very knowledgeable with the menu. The manager stopped by mid way through dinner to check up on us. Service was amazing great place. The decor was beautiful. We will definitely be back.

at4Azcs8x3ODu2Cj7FvnFA.text: This place is great!! So beautiful inside! Food was amazing. I had the baked rigatoni (creamy with little meatballs) and my friend had the seabass special our terrific server suggested and loved every bite!!! Definitely will be back!

_ggvoDc0GF7neACFQcNnIg.text: Took my wife and friends here for lunch, the restaurant is very nice inside and we didn't wait very long for a table as we had a reservation. The reason I am writing the bad review is we all had the pasta and in all of the Italian restaurants we have ever been to we have never had such terrible pasta. This restaurant served us a big bowl of sauce with a few rigatoni noodles in it, the noodles were over cooked and the meatballs that we added to the dish were disgusting. By far the worst Italian dinner I have had in 47 years. We wont go back. Don't waste your time or money!

apqw5fM3k8ZFjfRyjlyjQA.text: Great place food is excellent, they could extend the menu options a little but still great taste. Staff is wonderful and attentive. They share their knowledge and engage in helpful conversations , very personable  they treat you like family! I wiuld definitely recommend Bottiglia !!!    ....

iSc6acmpDOSNzgDlTtwsVQ.text: Let me say- been here a few times lately and the food never disappoints.  Went for Sunday Brunch and the blueberry pancakes were so fluffy and good.   The zucchini flowers are to die for.   The atmosphere is also good on a Friday evening with some type of live music.  It's a new favorite place to bring out of town guests to.

FZ9niuqZNKRTQzrYZHDAhw.text: This restaurant is such a refreshing surprise in ambiance in comparison to the rest of the Green Valley Ranch casino. It is beautiful and a style I hope to model my own home after one day. The food was also good too, I tried the octopus and man n' cheese and although mac n' cheese was good, the octopus took me on a wild flavor ride. Salty at first but with a smooth finish, amazing.   My only complaint was that the hostess were awful. They didn't acknowledge me at all when i walked in and when i was wondering through the restaurant searching for my family. And when trying to see what tables are available for other customers, they have no regard for seated guests and personal space. Luckily they're a very small part of the experience so I'll be returning for a date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus Appetizer

ngS8qRUCOcSv-xxwgapYzQ.text: Such a pretty restaurant inside Green Valley! Bottiglia's light colors and soft lighting are a nice retreat from the low lit, garish decor of many a casino restaurant in Las Vegas. Beyond the airy decor at first glance, diners sit at shabby chic tables/couches/chairs, which gives the overall vibe that you're at a friend's beach house.  Just like the restaurant vibe, menu offerings aren't heavy or overbearing. Rustic Italian cuisine tends to be not to sauce heavy and there's plenty of easy breezy beverage options too. Whether you order the squash blossoms, burratta, or pasta dish, it'll be a nice sized portion but not gut busting or overdoing it. Might I also note that the branzino comes out deboned and without the questionable? It's all about the pretty aesthetics at Bottiglia.  Dinner for five with wine, appetizers, mains, and dessert came out to about $400 total. Had I taken advantage of the Yelp Check In offers, it would've been significantly less. Dang it, forgot to tell our server. But that just means I'll be going back when in Vegas again?

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ibfcc6Zc9KMv0cGKdeqdKw.text: Ambience is romantic and beautiful. Servers are friendly and service is excellent. Food is (to be honest) just okay, not bad but not great either - but their price point is very reasonable so I think it evens out. Would I go again? Yes. The ambience alone really makes you feel like you are eating out for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

35du-tGN0GH5tnTf9yNg4A.text: I can't believe I've never dined here before! My cousin suggested to check out this place, after hearing about their November half off pasta deal, and I am so glad she made us the reservation.   Came here on a Tuesday, which was a double deal since they're oysters were only a dollar(which is every Tuesday btw). AND LET ME TELL YOU, one of the best oysters I've ever had! It didn't even need the extra sauces it came with on the side. Our group ordered a total of 26, and if we didn't have more food coming, I would've devoured another 26 all to myself! We also had the calamari, which was a little too salty, but I liked the crunchiness to the breading! And they also give you a platter of bread while you wait for your food, which i didn't care too much for since we had other, greater options, but I will say their butter is good! Very light and slightly melted, and a lemony taste.   I had the king crab pasta and my boyfriend had the short rib with spaghetti pasta.  And yet another "let me tell you moment".. LET ME TELL YOU, their pasta is AMAZING - more especially the king crab one! Probably the best pasta I've had. Had the perfect texture, the perfect flavor (a light lemon flavor - which wasn't overpowering at all, and the perfect amount crab! The short rib was inferior out of the two, but still delicious. The short rib was very tender, and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, but I didn't like the sauce all too much, which was tomato based.   Service was good! Our waters were constantly filled, our server was friendly, the hostesses were friendly and took great photos of us when asked!  The only thing that knocked off a star was the wait?  We were sat about 12 minutes after our reservation time, which isn't long but I promise you, it makes the wait worth it if you just be a little honest with not having the table ready on time.  I will definitely come back for their oysters! Oh! And checking in gives you a free glass of wine,  cheers!

QjQaYaMlojBCb3_6S1TW7w.text: This is an excellent Italian restaurant, with some minor flaws. Definitely among the highest quality in the area. Quality chic decor. Have dined here 7 times, and it has been fairly consistent in terms of food. Not everything on the menu is outstanding, but the dishes that are outstanding really make up for the mediocre ones.  Antipasti Misti Platter - 5/5 Excellent assortment of high quality meats, cheese, and olives.  Wild Mushroom Tagliatelle - 5/5 A delicious, flavorful dish. The best italian cream sauce I've ever had.  Chicken Parmigiana - 2/5 A disappointingly average dish. The tomato sauce was fairly bland. It was topped with excessive amounts of low quality parmesan. Not recommended.  Rigatoni with Bolognese - 3.5/5 An acceptable quality meat sauce, the pasta was cooked correctly.  Food 4.5/5 Service 3.5/5 Decor 4/5

Lo1WO6lPiez_936rXYZ9eQ.text: I went here for brunch a few weeks ago with some friends. They had a brunch special for $35 where you get a 3 course brunch menu, complimentary mimosa, spa full day pass, and a couple other things I forget. We also ended up getting bottomless mimosas for mentioning a fellow blogger that was there that day.  This place is a higher end restaurant located inside GVR. The decor is super cute for IG-worthy posts and our server (Forgot his name :(( ) was excellent. They had a nice outdoor seating area but it was too hot to sit outside. Anyways, I got the salad, pancakes (they ran out of french toast), and gnocchi that was on their brunch menu. Everything was delicious and the portions were just right. I can't wait to come back here when the weather gets cooler to sit in the patio area.

ojVbWiZOlXweghk8LgGT-g.text: Not impressed at all, we made reservations for a reason, we waited 15min after people were getting seated, and people that sat outside just walked in and got sitted first, I was sitting in the front and they didnt make reservations, WHAT'S THE POINT OF RESERVATIONS??? We were seated, 1st our waitress greeted us, we were looking at the appetizers, she didnt speak until we asked her what did she recommended, we got the caprese salad and the fried mozzarella, other tables we saw got free bread, me and my boyfriend looked at each other, oh good I can't wait to try it, never came,  I ordered a hot tea, I had to get up to ask for more hot water to the buser boy, finally I got up and asked for a different waitress, thank God we got rid of Jenna, our second waitress was AMAZING,  we automatically brought our bread, as our appetizers arrived, she brought fresh hot water, manager came over as we were eating our entrees, we just told her we liked the new waitress and didnt tell her it was bad service, but that's ok. WILL NEVER RETURN, she was next to us (Jenna) the CRAPPY waitress, it was awkward, we ordered desert-GOOD, our bill came our desert was free, but still from the moment we got there,  it wasnt welcoming, and the waitress was Bad, with Las Vegas being the best, and amazing Italian restaurants this was horrible, maybe she was having a bad day including the ladies in the front,  were not cheap nor I'm  looking for free desert,  I just want GOOD SERVICE,  and GREAT FOOD, this was Bad overall, and the service was worst enough and awkward for me never to return

tgNUb0PWH2lXWh6k-hBTOw.text: Was staying at the GVR, and decided to try this place. It's really good Italian food and he portions are HUGE. So beware. You can share almost everything. My friend and I shared the spinach lasagna and we couldn't finish it!  Also, the tuna carpaccio is a must here!

w1m3PU5Qg09yQn5vdDCk6w.text: Great little spot for dinner! I have to say I didn't expect the food to be as tasty as it was! I found it to be bit loud inside so if you want to have a quiet conversation this definitely isn't the place but they have good food and a nice comfortable atmosphere!

5ceYEsXEMXan9BNeDx0S0A.text: One of my absolute favorite places in the whole Las Vegas area. Service is always on point and the food is there to match. Went in last night and was personally greeted by one of the managers, Matt, who always makes sure to treat us like VIPs! Easily the best spot for a nice evening and great food. (Gotta try the grilled octopus!) Also love coming in on sundays for bruch and great bellinis!

AxEQXvPOt3Gl7dfcVNPw8Q.text: This place is amazing.  My boyfriend and i have came here twice and both times we received an amazing experience.  Not only were both servers Giorgio and Kelly knowledgeable about there product they also made sure we were well accommodated.   The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars Is because they ran out of oysters and that was the reason we went. Overall the food was amazing and we will be returning.

4il42WaAPAVS8wImYa2HSA.text: Our dining experience started with an amazing hostess.......Super friendly and efficient.  Our waitress was fantastic and the food was amazing.  Started with the calamari (Yum) then chop salad - super good with green olives and just a hint of salami.  Then on to the Halibut - perfectly cooked and seasoned and moist.  Definitely returning for another visit.

nVO229mJ1iB8Mqbx1yxztg.text: I've been dying to try this restaurant since I pass it every time I am the the GVR. Hands down, AMAZING.   The restaurant seating is a lot bigger than I was expecting it to be. They have indoor, outdoor, and bar seating making the place a pretty big spot. The waiter was amazing and went thru everything as it was my first time there.   They serve fresh bread with olive oil + vinegar complimentary. For an appetizer, we ordered the cheese board which was great! My meal I ordered the Wild Mushroom Pasta and oh my wow, one of the best pastas I've had in the green valley area! For dessert, we ordered the strawberry panacata which was good!  Will be making my way back to this place. Very cute and bright!

stC5znqSIGGF8FdNukLkKQ.text: The food is delectable! The spinach lasagna & eggplant parm were not greasy at all with just enough cheese & spinach to make them equally appetizing! The tiramisu was moist & not too sweet! The colors accompanying it were a great addition! The (4) star is because of the service not the food. The service was less than satisfactory. We were left waiting & even when attempting to leave the waiter did not bring around the bill until probably a 10-15 minute wait after we were done & asked for the bill. If it was not for the restaurant itself & the food the stars would be less. However the food is great!

Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

AGN2_yvCp8JBzvzMxG3FoQ.text: It's as if Chip and Joanna Gaines designed the whole place -- modern farmhouse, but with an added twist of floral chic. Definitely an airy and pleasing atmosphere.  I had my birthday dinner here back in November. My bf asked me where I wanted to eat (uhh loaded question, ladies you know what's up) I ended up choosing Bottiglia Enoteca located inside GVR. It was on my radar for quite some time. Plus I always seem to crave Italian food on my birthday. Age me and carb me up, per favore.  I have a thang for gnocchi and pesto, so I ordered that entree with chicken added. Honestly, it wasn't my favorite. Maybe it was the sauce, so I guess I don't like pistachio pesto. My bf's chicken parmigiana entree was leaps and bounds better. Our waitress prefaced that it doesn't come with pasta, but the chicken itself was sizable. So flavorful, I'd recommend that over my dish.  There was live music that night which added to the airy ambiance -- it was a solo act playing acoustic covers of popular songs. (Have you heard an Usher song with guitar?) We enjoyed it very much. To top off the night, our waitress surprised me with a birthday tiramisu. Decadent, loved it.

Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. gnocchi with chicken added, it was all right.

LnDa8CW6GzFt6mDtx5Ts2A.text: Came here for Thanksgiving dinner and we left here so full and satisfied!   Food: I shared the wild mushroom tagliatelle and the thanksgiving meal prime rib with my best friend. You can definitely taste the black truffle in the pasta! It was my favorite! The prime rib was pretty good too! We were happy that they offered that for Thanksgiving!   Service: everyone was really nice. We kind of laughed at the fact that the guy servers almost all looked the same lol   Ambiance: dark lit, romantic atmosphere but still good for family dinners.

q3mdqfGNEqzVojwCg9iIvg.text: Beautiful white clean decor.   Servers and food runners working seamlessly. Very efficient kitchen and got my food very quickly for such a busy place. I like that a lot.   Focaccia bread opener topped with charred onions and a evoo vinegar dip.  Got the pepparadelle that was packed with meat and thick red tomato sauce. Good to share.  The spinach lasagna was creamy rich and Mr Bland finished it. Its served in a ricotta round bowl.  Do a Yelp check in for a cup full of cheer!

YSZAY-tbZmcbTPDGyKJqoA.text: Bottiglia is a spot for more of a brunch setting, but is also a great location other personal events. The setting and outlay of the location was made beautifully, and really brings out a type of design that you rarely see in vegas, giving off a hamptons NY experience, especially with the music! I've had the eggs asparagus and some of the fruit plates. Both were well cooked. I highly recommend the penne pasta. Their alcohol drinks are also made quite well. The pricing is about average for the location and service you receive, and they do have bottomless mimosas. It seems to be a very Instagram-liked location especially with the elegant and clean outlay. You would never guess it's attached to a casino.

hlahAgA1AMybEDnAY2-MMg.text: Another great meal at Bottiglia! I love everything about this restaurant- atmosphere, service, consistent and incredibly delicious dishes, and a unique cocktail program with something for everyone.  We love their happy hour, served in the bar and dining room. I could order all of their small bite offerings without hesitation, but the arancini and fried zucchini blossoms are the hot tickets for me! They're a smaller portion than a full appetizer and great way to keep the tab a bit more reasonable, especially for a twosome.   Although we had a small issue with one of our entrees, it was handled promptly and appropriately. Mistakes happen; it's all about the response and bounce back from it!

01AcMCw0N0rXiY8BQYJP1w.text: What is there not to like about this place?! It's beautifully decorated, the food is amazing, the service is outstanding, and the parking is just so easy.  It's absolutely perfect for brunch and they're $12 all you can drink mimosas of all flavors was just awesome!  This is definitely going to be my new brunch spot!

b6mzANzCkUIyPjTV_c232g.text: Very solid food.  Great service, outstanding Bread, all pastas are fresh and flavorful.  Chicken parm & stuffed zucchini flowers were the big winner.

_yFNATbcc7Jz_lmCCPd8-Q.text: I am shocked I haven't reviewed here yet for how often we come.   On our latest trip in, I started with the mulo pazzo, their take on a Moscow mule, made with tequila instead of vodka and basil instead of mint. It was cool and refreshing.   For dinner, I decided to get an appetizer and a side of pasta as I'd been eyeballing the carbonara mac & cheese on the menu but never felt like I could finish an entree AND a side of pasta. The mac and cheese was wonderfully cheesy and was made complete with peas and guanciale (spiced, cured pork that tastes like really good ham). The appetizer I chose was the char grilled octopus which was perfectly cooked, tender and not rubbery. It was citrusy and the potatoes that the tentacles sat on were crispy and well seasoned.   Previously, I've also enjoyed their sangria rosso, chopped salad, meatballs, calamari, gnocchi, and spinach lasagna.   We really enjoy coming here when the weather is nice to sit outside on their lovely patio, and we've made reservations for 8 before and had great success having that many people together in the restaurant. I'd highly recommend giving this place a try because it is such a cute place and the food is really delicious.

WsFN8lSZcYlKQJTX6XlAsQ.text: I'm really disappointed by their lack of communication with me. I saw they had a private dining room and from the pictures, I really thought it would be perfect for my baby shower I'm planning. I reached out through Yelp first to get a quote for their room and received a response right away asking for my email to send me more information. I gave it to them, and after two days I still hadn't received anything. I decided to reach out again, and finally got an email. I gave my phone number so we could discuss more in detail what I wanted, and we agreed to speak on Friday. Well, today is Friday and after waiting all day for a phone call, I still have not heard from them. I will not chase after a business, so I'm disappointed but will have to have my party somewhere else. Attached are the messages sent back and forth so everyone knows this was not a fake review.

cAn1JndjYPKfpVggbtmqMQ.text: This place is SO cute (especially for being inside a casino), but it's overpriced and the service was meh.   We came for a friends brunch, so we had a nice table by the window. They weren't particularly busy for a Sunday at noon, which was nice.   I got to try a couple of items:  - COFFEE CARAMEL PECAN STICKY BUN: ($10) it'a basically a crunchy cinnamon roll with a layer of caramel pecan at the bottom and topped with a mascarpone icing. It was super sweet, but the crunchy aspect was a nice spin on a classic cinnamon roll. - 7/10 (a bit overly sweet. I could only do a bite or two).   - FRESH FRUIT WITH COCONUT CREME: ($7) ok this this is incredible SMALL. It should be on the menu as "cantaloupe topped with berry compote and coconut creme". It had a SLICE of cantaloupe (6 slices) as the base. Super overpriced for what I got. Tbh though the coconut creme was yummy. - 6/10 for the value of what it was.   - LOBSTER BENEDICT: ($32) for the price, this should have WOW'd us.... it did not. There was a good amount of lobster in it, but the eggs weren't cooked correctly for a Benedict (cooked medium vs a good runny poached egg you'd expect). The potatoes that came with it were waaaaay better than the actual Benedict. - 6/10 - I'd skip it for the price.   - ROSEMARY LEMONADE: ($6) just skip this. It tasted like carbonated lemonade that was way too sweet. There wasn't a taste of rosemary either. Whomp whomp. - 2/10  Our server also wasn't the most accommodating and every time I asked for something, it felt like I was annoying her.   This place has so much potentially, but I probably won't be back here.

Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Seasonal Fruit** - this was just a slice of cantaloupe with a couple of blueberries and strawberries. Not worth it.

-FrAcgv8BUcFEyriqTWEhw.text: Wow Bottiglia is AMAZING! alexis is the best server, so quick & on top of everything, as is mackenzie! matt is an amazing manger and made sure everything was going smoothly at the restaurant. food was AMAZING, every time i get something different and it's always sooooo good. definitely coming back, thank you matt & alexis

RZctZd4UJl1ctNno5l93iw.text: Yesterday was my favorite bartender Tony's last day at Bottiglia so I had to stop by for brunch. For sure one of the most professional and friendly guy ever. Will sure miss those bloody marys! I will still continue to stop by the food is outstanding and the staff always very friendly. I truly love how the managers and chefs check on tables to make sure everyone is happy and pleased with their experience. Keep up the great work guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini Vongole

VakXvVWQfdfEjnQhy9bJZg.text: Wow what an experience! I am so happy and love coming here!   Every time has been great but this time was over the top. We came here for brunch without a reservation and they were a bit busy. They told us they were able to seat us which I thought was very sweet since they were super busy.  Our waiter, Kelly, was the nicest waiter I have honestly ever had. He made amazing recommendations and helped us choose between a bottle of champagne and the bottomless mimosa. We ended up getting bottomless mimosas!  For brunch Kelly said the prosciutto eggs Benedict was his personal favorite so I ordered it and it was fabulous! He also recommended the pecan sticky bun with cream cheese icing and that was actual heaven on earth!  We also ordered the chicken panini and the burger with a side of truffle fries and those were so good!  I can't wait to come back again and always ask for Kelly now!!! He is the best!!!

Ed6RsBHAFFo-3W2x_acNjw.text: We had a lovely girls night dinner on the patio during our trip to Vegas. The food here is INCREDIBLE. The service was exceptional and ambiance was perfect.   I have a food restrictions and they were so accommodating to my diet which I appreciated so much.   We left feeling so full from good food and a good time! Also the desserts will knock your socks off. Thank you so much to the entire team. We look forward to coming back soon and encouraging others to as well.

cfATl15_U8prwRuV3ejKnw.text: This place is gorgeous, has great food and also great music certain nights. Its one of my top 5 favorite restaurants. Sometimes i just go for the butternut squash.  Great elegant bar vibe and great outdoor seating weather permitting.

FWWEltWA3qLNpiSTFuAKTQ.text: We came back again on 2/2/18. We had the crab pasta, chicken piccata, and the chicken Marsala.  Everything was excellent. Our server was Cody. He was awesome. Friday nights they have live music. We were seated very close to the little stage they had. I was worried the music would be too loud. It wasn't at all. We had a great time as we always do.  We will be back  4/5/19. Crowded Friday night. That's ok because we wanted to sit at the bar. I love that they have Pinot Grigio on tap, and I'm digging the Perroni draft. We love the meat and cheese app and ordered the large, thinking that it would be a meal. We were wrong. We took so much home. But was it good. Our bartender, Tony, was awesome. We'll see you next time (and order the medium app)

9MFke5019cEo-Q9A3UkM8g.text: I put in a reservation for 8 people here for my mom's 50th birthday. I called to see if they could take in a cake. They charge about $2 a slice but we didn't mind that so we went ahead and brought our own cake.   We got to the stand and the hostess took the cake immediately as it would be a surprise for my mom. We got seated right away. It was this cute little corner area that was blocked from the rest of the restaurant but you could still see the rest of the restaurant through book shelves. There were a small seating area as well around the table for photos and if you wanted to just hangout drink wine before the food arrives.   This restaurant is absolutely beautiful. It's clean and the decor is cute.   We ordered our food and came out perfectly. No complaints from our entire family. I got the linguini vongole which had garlic, white wine and clams. Sisters got their grilled salmon which had a quinoa salad, chick peas, and a lemon herb vinagraitte. Dad got the chicken marsala which had mushrooms, marsala wine and chicken jus. Mom had the wild mushroom tagliatelle with chicken which had black truffle cream, burrata and garlic crumbs. And brother in law had the wood grilled wagyu new york which had crispy artichokes and agrodolce steak sauce. I also got a side of the rosemary roasted potatoes.   Everything was delicious. The flavor of my entree was perfect. The linguini had the right amount of garlic that didnt over power the rest of the sauce. The clams were plentiful. The portions of these dishs were just right. It wasn't overwhelming. Everyone was pleased with their dishes.   At the end of dinner, they brough out my mom's cake with tons of candles on the cake. We sang happy birthday for my mom and bing bad a boom. DInner ended with perfection.   We enjoyed our experience here. Service was wonderful and the waiter did an incredible job at staying on top of everything. I wish I remembered his name because I'd definitely recommend being sat in his area!

G_IkzGz3MsEvDBiRfMynCw.text: In my 31 years in Las Vegas, this was the most incompetent bar/restaurant staff that I have ever encountered.  Not attentive, poor follow through on requests, had to ask for set ups/plates, etc.   Unacceptable.  There is a reason why most locals frequent Bella Vita in the District.  Family owned, professional, and friendly!

aSSvJsucSJHOAa7WEa2v-A.text: Gorgeous decor. Warm, welcoming home-kitchen atmosphere but fell short of my expectations. Went in two days ago, almost two weeks after they opened, for a late dinner.  Stepped in from the south entrance not the casino entrance and loved the patio seating.  They were not busy but it took a while for someone to acknowledge our presence until we flagged someone and finally we were sat in their patio.    Bathroom:  Beautiful inside the restaurant but you do share hand wash sinks with men so that caught me off guard but didn't bother me.  They do need a full body mirror in there.   Food: I was not to hungry so ordered light.  We had to ask for bread.   Once we got it - it was pretty good and the honey butter is wonderful touch.   Roasted Tomato Soup:   SUPER SALTY! Now, I love seasoning and am no stranger to savory salty dishes but I couldn't really eat it.  I had to water it down with water to make it a bit edible until I finally gave up on it.  It comes with a Panini grilled cheese and although ok in taste it hardens after a while.  Fail here.    Spaghetti Squash: This was ok as well. I would have preferred it with no tomato sauce as this softens the squash and then it seems more like a mashed spaghetti squash.  Flavor was okay but nothing amazing.  Also thought that for $9 the portion would be bigger.  Perhaps a call to your cousin chef Salute at Red Rock might help in learning how to improve this squash to perfection.   I had also asked for red pepper flakes and it wasn't till I was finished with them that the young waiter came with them saying they couldn't find them yet they were sprinkled all over my boyfriend's clam linguini (which I tasted and also was too salty).    I love the decor, food has potential but for the price, it surely needs to improve.  As a new Henderson resident, I prefer driving to Salute at Red Rock or around the corner to Ventano's for an Italian meal.  Hoping you improve it!

DBaEPXXDKm4NvBO2sq2FxA.text: Enjoyed an amazing Sunday brunch. Beside being extremely efficient, our server Michelle was super nice. She was sweet and accommodating. Will definitely request her when I come back!

yMjgAp7C84Cu3wQ1NKl6Gw.text: Michelle was awesome first of all. She was attentive and kept our bottomless mimosas full. We had a great time overall and the food was delicious and well priced. It's a pretty spot too, I'd recommend here for brunch! So awesome, thank you Michelle!

K-1V02vhZHLQNPCKutAnhw.text: My boyfriend and I make it a point to try a new restaurant a couple of times a month. Bottiglia was an unfortunate disappointment and not a place I would return to or recommend.   After taking our drink order, the waiter brought out bread. We proceeded to wait for about 10 minutes before catching one of the bussers and asking for butter, which they had forgotten to bring.  We started out our meal with the beef carpaccio and a cheese & salami board.  Rather than asking, the waiter and brought us the happy hour versions of the dishes.  The appetizers were minuscule (even for a happy hour menu), and had different preparations than that which were listed on the dinner menu. They left a less than positive impression on our palates.  Next, we had the Halibut and Bucatini with King Crab, which came highly recommended by our waiter.  My halibut was bland and the farro was overcooked. The flavors in the Bucatini were well balanced, but I needed a magnifying glass to find the king crab. For 32$, I would expect more than 1 table spoon of mediocre shredded crab meat lost in a pile of pasta.  At this point, we weren't going to take chances on desert and asked for our check.   After experiencing it for myself, I can honestly say I am shocked by the good reviews I have read. The only good things about Bottiglia were the decor and cocktails. If you are looking for delicious food or a lovely dining experience, there are far better choices in the area.

FVST8AVm-W636z2ajKdYLQ.text: Happy Hour Only (5-7PM):  Sitting in the outdoor patio is amazing in late spring / early summer. Food dishes, house wine, beer, and will drinks are $6. The arancini was amazing ! Highly recommend for happy hour !  Edit: Dishes took about 30 min in between. Check another 40 min..

SbUJsauLdprwbkGzZTBiLg.text: This place is absolutely amazing! You have to try the short rib and the veal raviolis they are to die for! We ended with the desert sampler which was a great ending to a fun filled night with our great a server Nick! Ask for him and enjoy this great venue!

r5M4_ohlHK4z7VRfu2IumQ.text: Tried to enter the building from the parking lot entrance since it was raining. Only to find the doors locked and the hostesses just looking at us get wet. Finally one came over and informed us that they were not open for ten more minutes. When asked if we could come in and sit at the bar for a cocktail while we wait out the ten minutes. We were informed that we could not do that.  So they lost two covers and since it would have been our first time. It will now never happen at all now.

9m0mJsk40WR4-gyVvswFKQ.text: Had a very pleasant experience. Food was delicious. Table settings was unique and classy. Ambiance was so great. We were not rushed at all got to enjoy our dinner very nicely even though it was a busy Sunday nite. Service won us over. Eye contact. Constantly cleaning table. Had good left over and without even asking it was wrapped fancy in foil dedicaba. We will be back. Thank you

GOOLLn96qfzABEbDUV9MZA.text: Took my family for grandmas bday.  Also I came for New Years. Great food and the waiters were always super nice. My new fave restaurant in Vegas.

lZINNHjjJ0Q3f918VBZxvg.text: Terrible service. Music too loud to have a conversation. The food was mediocre at best and definitely not worth the price.

ArMUF_UNBE5E5BBrsBwtTw.text: My wife and I really like this place. The appetizers were great, definitely try the arancini. The prices are reasonable and the decor is nice. The patio is  cool too. I recommend it for date night!

d6yl2u2G_PFa-0Gno3i3mw.text: Came in for date night last weekend and this place great! I work in food and beverage so we go out trying new places all the time..for me it's the service and hospitality that makes or breaks the experience. I have to say our server Christina was awesome! Everything she recommended was phenomenal! From the specialty cocktails she suggested to accommodating my husbands allergy with the menu really was above and beyond. We started with the tuna carpaccio (so yummy), caprese salad, and shared the halibut. We were on a time limit to make it to a movie, but will absolutely be back to check out dessert. Must try, and ask for Christina! She really made us feel at home. One of the best experience from a service stand point I've had in a long time.

p4ZDH8kXzbI-lXCOsGHyxQ.text: Amazing ambience and cool specials .. Oysters, meatballs, wine... Oh my! Don't forget ur greens! All on happy hour menu! Bottles of Wines are 50% off too! Great experience. I went for a local event. And will be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DJX-Ba_gOchPyfRVKms20Q.text: Came here a week after their grand opening for their happy hour from 5-7 pm.  Love their decor and ambiance.  We ordered all six of their happy hour items to try.   Arancini- my favorite. Deep fried risotto stuffed with cheese in a tomato sauce. We also dipped the bread into the sauce and cleaned the whole plate. Delicious  Caesar salad- nothing special. Chopped romaine tossed in Caesar dressing with shaved Parmesan and house made croutons   Squash blossoms- was not hot when we got it, and not as crispy as I would want. Filling was creamy and tasty  Cheese and salami plate-only came with two small pieces of cheese. Good quality salami and procuitto. Nobody came to explain what kind of jam or cheese we were having until we asked   Eggplant dip-a little too sweet for my taste and really creamy like a mousse.  Toast was perfectly crispy so we still ate it all  Meatballs- never made it to our table :(  They somehow misplaced our ticket halfway through our meal, so we sat through 2 hours of "where's our food?" and left without getting to try the meatballs that we ordered. We also had to ask for bread, which all the other tables had except us.  They were obviously down staffed that night and other customers around us were upset too. I hope the problems we ran into are just because the restaurant is new, so we'll revisit in a few weeks and try the dinner menu.

ixjudOJzYlAWny-gMDS4FQ.text: Excellent customer service, darling atmosphere and wonderful food and drinks.   Heidi, our server was so gracious and amazing.   The restaurant is managed by top notch people and it shows.   Everything about this place is great!

Cw6WjImsV_gUa5LpCc5rxw.text: Cute for a date night. Happy hour is well worth it and has great food and drink options.

OtD7SJIhSimiXlwZzLPnuw.text: Bottiglia is absolutely delicious! Great customer service and very nice environment. The moment you walk in, you know you are in a five star restaurant that definitely does not make you feel uncomfortable with an uppity attitude. I ordered the mushroom risotto and it was absolutely divine! We also had the red and white sangria, but the if I had to pick the red was my favorite. Not to heavy with the red wine and not too sweet either. Now to dessert, we had a medley of desserts, but the donuts and the glazes were delicious. Overall, it is definitely a place I would recommend and would come back to.

Q3RghH5OuLHThW2dGwajnA.text: Had a late lunch with friends at Bottiglia.  The place is so cute.   A great place to have a relaxing meal.  We ordered 3 entrees to share: California eggs Benedict, Baked Gnocchi and Wood Roasted NY Sirloin.   I can't pick a favorite as they were all good. We also had their bread pudding...so tasty!   For sure, I will go back to try the other entrees!!

yO7KL0QCon4GHe_ZOQEzvQ.text: This was my first visit to this restaurant and I loved it.  The bartenders Jenna and Sheena were super nice and very helpful in telling me which foods are good to try and made amazing drinks. They suggested different appetizers to try and the food is amazing. I love the bartenders personalities as well. They were amazing to talk to and super nice. I'm definitely  coming  back to this place again.
