_IxDGp0Xciu8nu_9dLn6Eg.text: Sitting on the front porch on opening night, and I'm IN LOVE with the place! The decor is so beautiful, the music has been consistently good, and the food...my husband and I split a huge order of amazing truffle fries, grilled asparagus, short ribs, and a bottle of Rioja (1/2 price bottles on Thursdays!).   Emily, who helped us with everything, has been exceptionally fabulous! I'll ask for her EVERYtime we come back. Happy hour starts next week with $6 drinks and apps.  Absolutely a great spot and a new gem.

o7IdmqfX0pogszCG-1OTJg.text: This place is perfect for: Brunches, Girlfriend dates, parties with girly themes (bachlorette, bridal showers, birthdays!  Service: Servers were always nice and attentive. I swear their servers match the decors =)   Atmosphere: LOVE the decor. It is very cutesy and bright!   Food: I've tried a few things on their menu. Most memorable ones were the french toast, lemon pancake (yum!!) and the buratta and caprese salad. The vinegrette they used was out of this world!    Price: Reasonable. Around $15 per entree. The bill will probably run you about $25 to $40 per person if you get a drink with some appetizers  Overall: Highly Recommend!

PGxAFQ-HR8hhVbwNGPXqGg.text: Tommy was an amazing server. Food was beyond expectations and such a friendly atmosphere, 10/10 recommend.

mmRPF5XGMXFobDOYhWniYw.text: Amazing staff, our server Thomas was amazing and super kind! Had a great brunch with the Greene St. Kitchen crew, can't wait to come back! Food amazing, service amazing, atmosphere amazing!

ckXxqkXXSLGr3FN4puXMcg.text: Not sure why I waited to take my Fiance here for date night. Just glad that we finally made it in to experience the $1 oyster Tuesday special. Craving satisfied! We also had their King Crab Bucatini and Spinach Lasagna, both delicious! Of course we saved some room for the Dessert Sampler (the only photo we took). Our server Kevin was just amazing and everything he recommended was spot on.  PS  Thanks for the insider secret on how to enjoy the dessert that much more Kev   The restaurant alone is just gorgeous. I look forward to catching live music on Fridays too.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h799uF-6fE0F2rOzBnNw7Q.text: If you like airy but florally white rustic aesthetic surroundings, clean-cut tall young lads for waiters, and just the right amount of Tuscan-style dishes, you'll take a fancy for Bottiglia Cucina & Enoteca.  Located within the walls of Green Valley Ranch resorts, its not so far from the entrance especially if you came from the movie theater front. Just hop on the escalators to the second floor casino and you'll see it on your left side past a few bustling restaurants and visual slot machines. Once you walk in, the hostess will happily greet you upon arrival. Don't hesitate to indulge or take a snap of the bright retro vespa near them though!   Service was as convivial as they are generous. Informative to the max, they left no hidden details of their happy hour of $1 oysters (we were just in time for it) and the fact that we came in for National Pasta Day was a definite plus (half off all the pasta selection of the menu)!  I ordered their veal marsala as my friend suggested I try something new for once instead of eyeballing a salmon at a fine dining restaurant all the time and not fear the idea that deer meat can be "stereotypically gamey" when in reality it can be quite delicious (oops). Our sides consisted of wood roasted cauliflower, brussel sprouts, carbonara mac and cheese and there were ample servings of it placed in cute sky blue Tuscan chinaware on top of thick wooden placemats. You are also given a complimentary bread appetizer in the beginning as a starter. As for cocktails, we asked for the most citrusy and fruity on the menu, and the waiter suggested the Endless Summer and Fresca Frizz. Needless to say I found them both satisfactory but leaned more towards Endless Summer since it tasted light on the alcohol and an easy drink to down rather than the Fresca Frizz (you can taste more of the vodka here).   My friends ordered the short rib and the halibut respectively. We all tried each others dishes and I was surprised on how juicy the veal was! I would definitely order this again whenever I have the chance to. Braised Short rib wasn't dry at all, but neither was it overpowering in seasoning so it was savory at best especially with the added spinach ricotta dumplings. The pan roasted halibut was buttery soft, and although the combination with the risotto was rather strange at first taste (perhaps it was the puree?) it worked out well in the end after a few more bites, even though my friend did not care for their peas, I didn't mind it.  We topped the best for last with desserts. The dessert sample was an assortment of the tiramisu, strawberry pannacotta, and lemon poppy seed donuts. Generously so, the waiter and chef was able to divide the desserts fit for three people! Neither of the sweets were high in the diabeetus level so that's always a plus. The sampler was surprisingly on the house thanks to their manager, since I mentioned prior to reservation that our dinner was a small birthday celebration for our friend. How nice of them to accommodate this confectionary for us! It definitely set the bar up for our birthday celebrant, candle lit desserts and all. I also ordered their pistachio cannoli but wished they had the cream inside of the cannoli as a pistachio ice cream instead of just powdered pistachio nuts on the side.  Would love to come back again for their daily happy hour menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6nOE_61PpUapIKKoyopFxQ.text: Great spot, beautiful dining area and bar. Quality service and food. Sunday brunch is brilliant too.

TqM43J1cwRcEK6CJCwa64w.text: I was just here for brunch today. I'll start and end on a good note. The restaurant is very but and cute, lots of florals and bright colors. Good location for a group. However, I was a little let down with the Yelp check in freebie. The glass of wine has restrictions, so I didn't even use it. Our service was very slow, took a hour for our food to arrive. Waited 30 minutes of checks. Because of this a few meals were comped and everyone received a discount. And Because of their hospitality, I will be back. Really seemed like they cared and wanted us return.

9PKp1zI_ANNArohtp0-ZXQ.text: Food:  Fried calamari - this was a little greasy and they include fried onions and fried zucchini  linguine with clams - this is good and I usually order this however, the linguine and clams at Bratalian is so much better. tiramisu - served in a glass jar. I actually did not like this presentation very much and prefer the traditional version. Too much chocolate curls or something. kids grilled cheese and tomato soup - my kid liked this  We've also been here for brunch and their menu is tiny. Not really my favorite for brunch due to the limited menu.  Ambiance: Really pretty, bright, white and pastel colors. Lovely outdoor seating option with flatscreen tv's. This is a nice place to take people visiting from out of town, in fact that is exactly what we have done on several occasions. I do feel that the ambiance is greater than the food. They need more food items and to punch up the flavor on the existing menu.  Service: We've always had great waiters here, very attentive and friendly.  Location: inside GVR. You can access through the parking lot closest to the restaurant and avoid walking through the casino.

bFFP7sfe5J7oD1LaxcfFdg.text: I'm really just here to evangelize about the Short Rib Cavatelli. SO good. I don't think there's a way or reason to complain about too much sauce, so I won't; just know that there is no shortage of short rib at Bottiglia, especially not in this pasta dish. Seems like the noodles were freshly made in-house as well, but if not, they surely had me fooled. 5/5  Sampled an edge of my neighbor's Butternut Squash Ravioli, and that was divine too. Just get all the pasta. lol  Dranks! I tried two and loved 'em both. The Apricot Sour and fall pear specialty cocktail were healthy on the alcohol pour and tasty x2. The servers are super knowledgeable about the extensive menu and offered some great suggestions and comparisons to make deciding easier.  Lastly, there's really no bad vantage point in this restaurant. Very open, pretty all over, and perfect for any occasion. A dose of the unexpected from Green Valley Ranch to be much applauded. Can't wait to go back for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apricot Sour
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasonal Pear Cocktail 5/5
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Cavatelli

UPFa7BzzUZV1P5Ew8uuE9w.text: What an experience! The food is amazing.. the staff is super friendly! The manager Diane came to our table and was very  Nice and accommodating.. I highly recommend brunch here at Bottiglia!

r_fmRBhi7X8jceQRhuOMmg.text: Hi went here on Presidents' Day and they had $1 mimosas. I know they do a bottomless offer for $18 but I only got to 13 so $5 cheaper even better. I had a chicken and waffle sandwich that was a great brunch. Been there for dinner but I would suggest the brunch speacial on sundays!

_B_n3s63_eblMjLk-BOuzg.text: One of the best happy hours in town! The decor is beautiful and the food is superb. Go on a Friday night to catch some of the best local musicians around! My favorites are Cameron Dettman and Matt Morgan.  These guys are amazing!

jq0jFbIQzJhFbTu_7rJcJw.text: I went back recently and service was horrible. It was Brunch and food was not as good. It was my son's birthday and we waited for 35 mins or so for the check. I disappointed my kids coz I bragged about it.

a2pJySiS0MUZsmmpocKRRQ.text: We have tried to come here for brunch 3 times now and each time we are turned away, today my family and I stopped by around 10am and I was told they couldnt seat us due to kids brunch. We decided to go somewhere else once again, its too bad because we enjoy going to GVR however we wont try to come back again.

Rz-VVpPaId_zAwedSIv8Ag.text: The goods: - half off bottle of wine after 8 pm on a Saturday night.  - the service was efficient, friendly and accommodating. - the fried calamari appetizer was perfect. i dipped it once in the tomato compote then after with the cream sauce. omg crunchy, savory heaven.  - my pasta dish was decent. i kinda wish my rigatoni was cooked more or was a fresh pasta but the sauce made up for what the pasta lacked.   The bad: - The live music was too loud for a classy restaurant. I'm not saying he was a bad singer, in fact we enjoyed him, however, he should've been playing at a lower decibel. It should be background music, not foreground. We switched our seating to outside so we can have an audible conversation with our company. - no bread. they ran out of bread on a Saturday night. this was my biggest disappointment. I just don't get how you are an Italian restaurant and run out of bread. It's like having no rice in an Asian restaurant. bad bad bad. - our company ordered the octopus appetizer and it was hard and not prepared right. he had to return it.

6k8osKMduUrT7uBJxvZ62w.text: I'm really surprised by all these great reviews on here because my experience I had does not live up to it at all. I decided to give this place a try and first impression the restaurant is really beautiful, the hostess and waiter was not very friendly, or welcoming. That's where I should of turned away. We got seated anyways and turns out the waiter who was in the front ended up waiting on us. She did change her attitude right away after she came back around to tell us she would be our waiter. I found that funny. Because she could have been nice and polite from the start. But like the rest of these reviews the place is ran by a bunch of younger ppl, & I feel that's a good reason of it. Lots to learn. Now to the food. I ordered the salmon and brussel sprouts, $45. The salmon was $36 and side $9. I don't mind the price but I do expect high standards when paying it. The salmon had no flavor at all. It was plated quiet nice but I'm all for the taste the looks is always a bonus. They definitely failed that, the portion of the plate is incredibly small. For $36 dollars you should at least get more food or good flavor. And to the brussel sprouts I feel that they could of been delicious but they were completely torched. All I could taste was the burnt flavor. I don't recommend this place. It may be fancy looking but I would much rather go somewhere that at least serves good food.

0OB3rrzNLia-xVuhbp93HA.text: Food was great, live music and wine was good too. The live music, all though was good. It was very loud.

50PkBVl24iQdHV8_TE8P7w.text: Vegan food and options.  Plant based items.  This places looks like an 80s/90s mansion with a modern vibe. They play random music, not fine dining music. Live music Saturday night. Good service. I didn't feel rushed or pressured. The server took his time with us which is good.

j-4fySrYTelk5O2HFMq1VA.text: Had such an amazing brunch here. We came on a Sunday and got sat right away.. lots of natural light and the football game was on so my boyfriend was happy! I had the salmon bagel and everything came on the side so I could create my own. Will be returning!

6QAxSb9J7vCA4OaLmEFYSA.text: This is my parents favorite place to dine every time we are in town. We had the seafood tower, Cioppino, spaghetti with meat balls. The quality-was great and so was the service! Michelle was so sweet!  Only criticism would to have a bit more soup in the cioppino.

Yj-1p17oKCKRgwK5q84MLQ.text: Best brunch spot in Henderson!  They have the cutest Instagram photo spots with a hedge wall, motorcycle and side car, and patio area as well.   They also have a great happy hour featuring $7 drinks and $7 appetizers. Plus Thursdays are half off bottles of wine! What more could you want?!

TZBSKX3nOwTSMDMEy_DsBg.text: Fantastic!!! I got a casino comp and figured ok, some Italian would be nice. I wasn't expecting anything more than the Olive garden and would have dressed up with at least a polo. The ambience was wonderful. Room lit to a dim candle light setting with a musician playing and signing acoustic jams. Very nice. The waitress and staff were all super attentive. I didn't get a "we'll get your waitress" vibe. Everyone was super nice. The presentation of the food was amazing. You get to see the food being cooked if in the right area and they wipe ur plate to make sure when you get to your table it is nothing short of perfection.   A little pricey but you truly pay for the wonderful experience and OMG their asparagus was my favorite!!!  My least favorite item was the calamari. It was a bit oversalted IMO. Also my plate had a chip in it. For presentation purposes I would not serve on a chipped plate. But those are such small miniscule items. I would come back and bring family to experience this wonderful restaurant on Fridays in the future.   I do hope you give it a shot. There is truly a reason they are 4.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu - do get it with their coffee. The roast is exquisite. The cake will melt in your mouth while you enjoy the dark roast.

un9oEFRLec5C6d9NMMcDvA.text: Visiting Vegas with family for a few days staying in the hotel here, and tonight was "Italian food" night. We arrived for a 5:00 reservation and were immediately seated.  It turns out that 5:00 to 7:00 on a weekday is happy hour, cool!  We made a meal of a bunch of different happy hour small plates, which was really cool because we got to taste a wide variety of different things.  Arancini, lemon-ricotta stuffed Zucchini flowers, Caesar salad, Meatballs, and (from the full menu) the most lovely steamed Octopus. Several had cocktails from the happy hour menu and those did not disappoint either.   Dessert was a sampler of 5 different cannolli which were all great. We especially loved the bright orange notes in the cream filling... Orangecello perhaps? They were amazing.   Everything was fantastic, flavorful, and worth the money. Our server, Eric, was attentive--service was just great.  So far, this has easily been the best restaurant we've eaten at here in the complex.

9--7jznwYyXCEH8uMRFn4Q.text: This place is fun! I'll start on a positive note. Excellent selection of wine! The Russian Valley Chardonnay is wonderful! This place is very upscale, but not stuffy. It appeared that the bar area was populated by young professionals. They were nicely dressed, but not over the top. I would say jeans and button down shirts were trending that night! lol! The band was excellent! 80s cover songs, but nicely done! Easy to listen to while dining.   Equally important; The food was excellent!!! We started with the calamari! Perfectly prepared. We moved on to a caesar salad! Excellent as well. We finished with a pasta dish, topped with crab! Wonderful!!! The sauce was a little buttery, but tasted amazing. I only noticed, because I try to stay away from the calories. If you're on the same track, make sure you eat healthy the entire week or do some intense cardio before and after! It appeared that the bartenders were struggling a to keep up with the crowd, but I assume that's good for them! They were all super cool, so no big deal!   Love the decor! White theme! Clean! Slightly modern! Comfortable! When you walk in, you'll see a vintage Vespa! Love it!!! Oh, a little pricey.   I was there with my beautiful girlfriend. We both said we'd go back. If you're a local or staying off the strip for some reason, check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A bit of wine

AOAx215nfHGi-oIFIqOdFw.text: This is one of my favorite Station Casino restaurants.  I like the atmosphere, the food, and the service has always been top notch.  My server was Jenna and she got my iced tea to start me out.  She also gave me a couple of suggestions including an entree special of scallops.  She sold me.  I started with some roasted tomato soup that was quite good.  During this time, a runner brought me some focaccia and a plate with olive oil and balsamic.  I used one of the pieces of bread to soak up the last bit of soup from the bowl.  The scallops were served on a bed of polenta with onions and spinach.  There was a very crispy piece of bacon between two of the scallops.  It was a great dish!  For dessert, I got the chocolate, coconut pudding.  Very good and a fine finish to the meal.  As always, service was great.  That and the food keep me coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate, coconut pudding—dark chocolate and coconut cream with hazelnut shortbread cookies.
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops were an entrée special that evening.
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread with oil and vinegar.

tusoyn31BJ_83CvmkAxHqw.text: There were 4 of us, us ladies ordered the Peach Belini.  We sent it back due to the brown color and taste.  The waiter did not charge us for it and we went for a bottle of Champagne instead! The seafood platter was ok...a little too much $$ for what you got.  My husband got the Veal, really really salty. My Cousin and her husband ordered the Halibut, which was very good, just small portions.  The ambiance is great, our waiter was great, just our opinion.

sHuyImLbuXttaNh1KNopGw.text: Wow! This place is beautiful! It is bright white inside, a lot of natural light is let in from the windows and there is a patio you can dine on as well. I noticed a floral decor motif and it gives it a clean, fresh atmosphere! On Sundays they have bottomless Mimosas! Note the orange juice is served in a separate carafe for you to pour in your champagne glass, and then the waiter will bring out the champagne. So funny, I poured it in my glass, took a sip, and was like, "there's no alcohol in here!"   I ordered the spinach lasagna. I know that probably wasn't the best choice to pair with a mimosa, but I haven't had spinach lasagna in so long, I had to order that! I'm so glad I did! It is actually a pretty big slice, and as much as I wanted to, I just couldn't manage to eat the whole piece.   The only thing that disappointed us was that there wasn't any bread available. Kind of odd since they serve pasta here. We went at 1:00 p.m.

c05GFA5TSRhnvzSBKN2yFg.text: This place blew me away! My girlfriends and I went to their "social brunch" it's every second Sunday of the month. THANK YOU Chelsea for inviting us to come in and celebrate my best friends 40 th birthday. It is hands down the best girl brunch in this town. From the delicate decor, to the femme DJ playing great music. Mackenzie was such a great server. It was like she invited us into her home and made our experience personal and fun! The food..... YESS!!! It was delicious and worth the value. Most brunches only offer bottomless mimosas. I went in early to talk to a server about that. Only because my mom loves a mimosa. However, after having cancer and going through treatment. She can not have too much citrus. After sitting and looking at the bottomless options. They had a "rose all day" For $15. It took away that awkward conversation of not having too much OJ in her glass. I do honestly feel like the staff here would have accommodated us in any way. Mackenzie went out of her way to make sure we had a great time, took as many pictures to capture our fun day. All I can say is THANK YOU FOR MAKING THIS DAY BEYOND SPECIAL!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mackenzie.... the sweetest server!!!
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another fun place to take pics! My Mom and I loving it!
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best fruit salad I&#39;ve ever had!

yOSn4OSG4HaGtgtUH6ZYTw.text: I went here for the first time tonight for my wine club. I reserved a table and had Alexis as a server. She was great-very attentive professional and friendly. We ordered calamari, black truffle pasta w chicken and the cheese/olives/meat plate ($16 small size). Everything was great. My truffle pasta was really good but I only ate 1/2. Im sad I left it in my friend's car accidentally. I told my friend he had to eat the rest. Cute Italian Restautant w/white background & pastel flowers all over. They had an outdoor patio w misters so that was another perk.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside bar
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside casino entrance signage
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3uR5N2msU6Af06zVHipiQQ.text: We were here on Thursday evening for dinner. Our server, Daniel, was great. The service was on point, he gave great descriptions of the items on the menu, specials  and the oysters.     We tried the Kumiai oysters, they were wonderful, fresh, and mignonette complimented them perfectly.    We also had the octopus, served with crispy potatoes, thinly sliced peppers and an amazing sauce.  The dish was well balanced and would recommend trying.    For main dishes bf had the Wagyu steak. The crispy artichokes served with the steak were a pleasant surprise and a nice change from a traditional potato. I had the vegetarian Mushroom Tagliatelle-- omg sinful. So delicious and the portion size wasn't too large. The creaminess of the sauce and the black truffle are a delightful match.    Compliments to the chef!  We were pleasantly surprised.  When we came here we were expecting a good dinner but we were swept off our feet by the service, the food, and ambiance.  Looking forward to trying more from his kitchen. Thank you Daniel for your friendly hospitality.    We will definitely be telling our friends of this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weekly specials 8/2019
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom tagliatelle with black truffle, vegetarian
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with artichoke crisps

ke-_DEX8c_FwWrTWGkJGZg.text: Came here again for a friend's birthday brunch. We had an amazing server (Matthew) made sure our massive party always had water, drinks, and our food was served correctly. For someone who is a server themselves, he was super knowledgeable, attentive, and very generous.   Mary took care of us and made sure it felt super special. All of our food was amazing. We got the caprese (a huge and good portion), Buffalo panini, chicken panini, pancakes, French toast, and $5 margs/bottomless mimosas. Everything came out in time, the drinks came out perfectly, everything went off without a hitch.   With a party that large, service was unbelievably amazing. It's very hard to find a restaurant that takes care of our party like Bottiglia can!  PS - pronounced Bo-tee-ya!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon coffee sticky bun

W1R-T3q3wM6qcVsm3F6-hA.text: What do you know? I returned here in the same month to attend a birthday brunch. Bottomless mimosas are $12: What a great deal! And, they bring you a bottle of champagne and a couple of mixers so you can pour to your preference: No need to hunt down your server for a refill! The paninis were decent (I more thoroughly enjoyed my Buffalo Mozzarella Panini than my spouse enjoyed their Chicken Panini).  Service was a little slow (we waited 45+ minutes for food) and one of our party's orders came out cold, but they offered us a free round of shots for the inconvenience.   DJ was spinning the tunes, a photographer was taking photos for the restaurant's social media accounts, and the overall atmosphere was very "grown and laid-back chic".  Another shout out to Kelly, who was my server (again)!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Panini
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Mozzarella Panini
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara Mac &amp; Cheese (Yes, peas in the mac &amp; cheese!)

GBtufmpcF9W2qw-5DqBQfg.text: So aesthetically pleasing to the eye! Worth the drive here with a bunch of your girlfriends to enjoy brunch - you could get so many cute pictures with all of the decor. Came for a birthday brunch and ordered the Prosciutto Eggs Benedict.  The dish was at best, average. Quite honestly it was a little disappointing. A properly cooked egg benedict is supposed to be poached and composed of a runny yolk when cut into, which is the BEST PART! However, this egg yolk was anything but. My excitement was quickly overcome with sadness when I cut open my egg to find a very firm yolk. The prosciutto was also very tough to chew. It just reminded me of thinly sliced ham that was extremely over cooked. That said, the charm of this restaurant is what made up for the amount of stars I gave because it is just THAT cute! Definitely wouldn't order the eggs benedict so if I ever find myself here again, I will definitely try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Sangria
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto Eggs Benedict

GEh3dYsAu-PW8_mq2bucIQ.text: Came here for a late Mother's Day dinner with my sister. Such a cute place!!! Aesthetically pleasing all around. Walking in, the immediate vibe that I got was a girls night out or hangout spot. Service was awesome! They were very attentive and always came around to check up on us. Food was great! We ordered a few items from the happy hour menu and they were filling and portion was just right. We also ordered pasta with clams from the regular menu and it was superb!! Nothing bad to say about this place. 5 star worthy and will definitely be back!

4ut3I6iB8qfmURoDq7ISFA.text: Wine lovers and foodies this is place for you! They have half off for wine bottle on Thursdays!! Place is very bright and happy looking.  Wine choices are good, mostly California but also Italian, Argentina ...  I had octopus and it was very tender and delicious also Brussels sprouts were very tasty!  There was little closed off separated area so it's a great place for private party. Lounge area is surprisingly large and nice! If you wanna good Italian food and good wine I recommend this place!

iKUh9Q3w1POymSJcukRrHw.text: I've eaten here a few times when they just opened, even eating on their private room a couple times. I've enjoyed the food but, my last experience there was one for the books.  A friend wanted to celebrate her birthday here and low and behold, it was during happy hour and during a Vegas Knights hockey game so, it was packed. PACKED. Especially by the bar!  Mind you, I brought my son (in his stroller) to the restaurant as my son is a heavy 7 month old. I more than expected to leave my stroller in the front with the receptionist but, she lead me to my table. As I walked through the HH crowd by the bar, I overheard one of the patrons say "babies don't belong in a restaurant." I let that comment slide cause maybe I was "just hearing things." But throughout dinner, I just couldn't get that comment out of my mind. Like, WHAT ASSHOLE would say that. Meanwhile during my meal, I saw kids at other tables so, yes this is a kid friendly establishment. Heck my son was quiet the whole meal, ironically, hooked on the Golden Knights hockey game playing behind my shoulder.  Outside of that dumb remark, our meal was fantastic. Highly recommend the meatballs, wild mushroom tagiatelle, and you must get the mozzarella. MUST get the mozzarella -- that breading was super yummy...and it was so simple.  Service was impeccable.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushroom tagliatelle *no flash*
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushroom tagliatelle

Nu3-5Q1i6FmflebHRIh9FQ.text: Every single time I try to suck it up and go to their happy hour with friends, we leave frustrated and mad at the service, which doesn't exist.   Pro: the lighting and theming  Con: every single time we've waited for our drinks, had servers never follow up for our next round, food has been slow. It's so frustrating.  I don't know why we've gone back the last two times, perhaps hoping it'd be better- but we've left three times now to finish our nights at Boracha.

bic0CEDqXMsgtgxlEqlJjg.text: Atmosphere and decor are great.  Service was slow and not very attentive but polite staff.  Roasted artichoke was so dried an practically not edible. Veal and eggplant was delicious but really tiny slices of veal.  Dessert were tasty and creative!

hCpxAbqbfJdbqMoaz0tWsQ.text: Should of been a 5 but my corn beef hash had more bell pepper in it than cornbeef,  it sucked. They should call it Bell Pepper Hash with cornbeef.  Everything else was great including the $1 oysters that were the bomb! Avocado toast was amazing. CB hash should never taste like that and I'm a CB hash whore. Lol  Also had activities for da kid on Sunday Sunday Brunch.  Well be back and pass on da hash and up date da review.

vgCda_uaVUJgCjdAPjEQ1Q.text: Two good things: 1) service is very friendly and 2) restaurant is very pretty and cozy. Well, I came here to eat so that needs to be the star review of this show! We came for breakfast brunch. I ordered the avocado toast with poached egg. It comes with tomatoes as well as pesto and is on toasted bread. I make avocado toast at home that is fantastic and it's generally great where ever I go. It is really hard to mess up avocado toast. This place messed it up! To begin with, their avocado toast is way too complicated. The simpler, the better. The pesto was so heavy and literally soaking into the bread, while the bread itself was hard as stone. The worst part is that there was some kind of vinegar added to either the avocado or the pesto that just wasn't right with the whole combination. It overpowered everything and was seriously awful. I could not eat the bread because of how hard it was and simply took some of the poached egg and tomatoes off of there but left everything else. I also ordered a salmon/lox and bagel platter. It comes with an everything bagel and there are two things I did not like: the first is that I had to ask for more cream cheese as there was such a minute amount. The second is that the cream cheese was hard in consistency and bordered on tasting like goat cheese. I have had many bagel and lox plates and this is one of the weakest. The biggest problem was the meal that my friend ordered. This is the meal offered for breakfast in pretty much any restaurant offering breakfast and should be 100% full proof for success. She ordered the eggs any style breakfast. She wanted two eggs sunny side up and ordered hashbrowns with it. She also ordered a side of bacon. The bacon was OK and edible as were the eggs, only after she had to send back the first serving of eggs because there was a hair in the first serving! The hashbrowns were unbelievably bad.  Burnt and crusty and just didn't look good as well as glistening with oil. Unfortunately, it tasted just as awful as it looked. My friend made me take a picture because the chewed part of the hash brown looked just like the part that was served to begin with. It absolutely looked like someone cooked it and left it there for a week. How does a chef serve this??? My friend even tried to put a lot of Ketchup on it and that did not help. I actually took a picture because you literally cannot see the chewed side from the untouched side. Seriously disgusting and to think that they offered the hashbrowns as a separate order for eight dollars. The coffee was OK and served in small cups which they are good at refilling if needed The total for this awful breakfast brunch was $63.87, and this does not include alcohol but simply coffee! Exorbitantly expensive for terrible food. There is no way we would come here again. From hair in the food to over greasy and over fried food that looks burnt and disgusting... The restaurant may look pretty but everything else is complete and utter trash.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash Browns
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash Browns

fMN9PNcme_5JnjMSRREtlw.text: Worst dining experience ever, I've had better at a cafe at a truck stop.  Terrible experience that ruined a special day for us.  Extremely loud , had to shove people out of the way to get to our table ... right next to the open kitchen... couldn't hear the person speaking next to me.. we had happy hour Arrancini... mediocre, bolognese, mediocre ... ordered chicken Marsala.. what came out was a joke... 1 pc of chicken beaten to death with a sauce that tasted scorched and maybe five pcs of shemiji mushrooms, no Marsala flavor, more of a watered down demi... extremely disappointed.. they also told my wife they were taking extra time to make sure her vegan gluten free food came out right and it came out covered in cheese... so I ordered a veal rage dish that came out like a salt lick, then my wife's pasta came out 10x worse so salty I spit it out ... obviously a kitchen that just doesn't care, what happened to tasting your food before it went out ?... best dish of the day was the bruschetta , but you have to try hard to screw that up... got my waste of a veal replaced by the saddest beet salad o have seen in my entire career.  Bland, 2 leave of arugula, and a flavorless yellow goop dotting the plate.. that was the breaking point for me. So far beyond extremely disappointed and will never come back... and thank you for ruining my mother in laws dinner and alll the dirty looks from your joke  of a chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini , happy hour portion...
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hKNjo043Q5bXqW-1A17M9Q.text: Bottiglia is one of kind. The restaurant itself looks great and really gave off the Italian vibe!   The service I was provided was wonderful and i was always met with a smile!   The servers were also very kind and met every request!   I would recommend to everyone!

BW5oenhVUi1o1gEqVWicIw.text: Wonderful evening!  Great food!  Great service!  Food was served hot.  Good wine list !  It is expensive but for a special evening I strongly recommend this restaurant in GVR.  Ask for Doug!

72H7J2chc1BcOm2okxQE-A.text: I had a great day @ GVR which concluded with a fabulous dinner.  A table dealer had recommended I try this place.  There was a slight wait due to the restaurant being crowded which is understandable for a Friday night in Vegas!  Once we were seated, the hostess presented us menus and within seconds our server Heidi came over.  She welcomed us and did the usual "Is this your 1st time"...& yes it is.....however her response was so warming when she responded "Well what took you so long, we have been waiting for you!"   She had recommended the nightly special which was a lamb pasta and bolognese & we decided to order that!  It was a fabulous warming meal as she suggested.  Very tasty!  After our meal ended, Heidi invited us back for brunch on Sunday!  Heidi was a great server and she really made us feel like she was a friend!!!  We will be back on Sunday for brunch!!!   BTW...the restaurant is beautiful!!!!

DqIEly9jFlD5Whunm5E-DA.text: This was the first time we had been here since it was remodeled and changed names I was hoping that everything about it had been changed, fortunately it had!   The interior design was open and friendly, the only negative to this is that it was a little on the noisier side.  It was incredibly busy for a Weds evening, our waiter was Shaay was excellent with the menu and catering to our needs,( we had many). The menu had many offerings and a good variety! Everything was excellent right down to the personalized birthday cake for my mother-inlaw!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome Birthday cakes!! Customized!!
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm!!

R4AA30c6Uw5Re1atJKyGaQ.text: Christina was such an amazing waitress. We will definitely be back! She was so sweet and such a patient server. Found us the perfect wine and all the best apps! Can't wait to go back!

q0DFpPm7AJ_Zkc5CjVZKsg.text: Ryan G. was such an attentive server and I experienced the best service I've ever had in Vegas. He knew everything about the menu and was absolutely amazing!!! If you come here definitely sit with him!!

UFCdQSnTm94tAowmE2ivRw.text: Kobee is amazing and meets all your needs! Best server and food is beyond delicious. Ambiance is spectacular and the food is amazing !! Love the arancini

Wmq0eCNVuJd1aOd1fwYbAw.text: Decor is cute, felt like I was eating dinner at my Grandmother's house.   Started off with a speciality cocktail, FRESCA FIZZ. It was light and refreshing which is just my style.   For apps our server Gerald suggested the CRUDO. AMAZING-It melted in your mouth. Also, ordered oysters and came with a sweet mignonette sauce.   For dinner I ordered the LOBSTER FRA DIAVOLO. I have been craving it since then. Huge piece of lobster and the sauce was creamy and flavorful.  Finished off our meal with STRAWBERRY LIMONCELLO PANNACOTTA. Their's had a nice touch with little pieces of crunchy pound cake on it.   Loved this place, can't wait to go back.

WMP_-ddmkn0R_wL8-EYbfg.text: Very good restaurant, was here for my birthday... but the service was to slow, they close at 10pm and I didn't finished my birthday cake :(

5R1DPntKI_UmcvSVf2P8TA.text: Alyssa was very attentive and always made sure our glass was full! Great happy hour super cheap and amazing authentic Italian food !

KzX77vY_-Xklh7hMfqXSRA.text: This place is absolutely amazing. Such a great atmosphere and the food is epic. I love the gnocchi the most but the lasagna is a very close second. Everything is just wonderful.

NtowuQbZ8xoFXrIIiNbkWA.text: The food here is FANTASTIC, as it should be for the price. What makes fine dining worth the price tag is the experience along with it. AKA great service. There are a million great restaurants in town. My husband and I are Chairmen with GVR.. We come here ALOT. We have been to Bottiglia at least 10 times.. Christina is ( Or was ) our favorite. She made us feel like royalty every single time we came in and we were so sad to find out she was no longer with you guys. I asked my husband if he still wanted to get dinner here and we were quickly cut off by a very rude woman ( looked like a manager but was seating guests at the hostess stand ) who informed us Christina was " let go " I asked Why?! She was our favorite and she said she had great servers who could help us.. Very uncomfortable and unprofessional. Owners/GM/regional's inform your staff it is not their place to air your restaurants dirty laundry. I hope this was a 1-off and your staff does not happily inform customers that staff was " let go ". For example, if a customer asks For an employee who is no longer with your company and they ask "why" a great response is: He/She left to pursue other opportunities. It is as simple as that.

hDfEB-VaEetuBRb1pkbX4Q.text: The interior of this restaurant is very beautiful. The menu is small, nothing too special or out of the ordinary to look at. The cavatelli was fresh which was nice, the food itself is decent. Im Italian my self and can make all this at home. They also have ridiculous charges, my father got a side of pasta and asked for linguine and was charged an extra $3. All in all the food was decent for the price ($125 for 4 people) our waitress was nice but I can get this type of food anywhere else and it wasn't anything special

CXh_sHVWPFqKdbbdhrpSaw.text: Food and service is phenomenal!! The Beef Carpaccio is probably the best thing I've eaten in a long time!!! Olive bread is delicious and every entree I've had has exceeded my expectations!! Try to get here at least once every 2 weeks and have never been disappointed!!!

sIydZMaD3fhbo-tKcLi4bg.text: Beautiful interior. Bright, light, airy. My hubby and I sat at the bar. Our bartender/server was Doug. He was great. Very professional and extremely knowledgeable. The back and forth banter made our visit a lot of fun. He made me a Candela - vodka, kahlua, a chocolate liqueur and espresso. Food: my hubby and I shared their charcuterie plate and a veal Marsala with a side of asparagus. All delish. You can see in the photo we devoured half of the Marsala before remembering to take a pic. Loved our experience, we will be back!

Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie plate
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Candela-vodka, espresso, kahlua, chocolate liqueur

LjcFwO-hjr9xW0b3frUBiw.text: Food was pretty good although I must admit I ordered something I normally would not like. Service however, was outstanding and I was surprised that the drinks were so reasonable in price.

tHgN9dKrTrB-ApHkKbwQqA.text: Checked in to get my free wine. Overall service was ok, waiter was kind of snooty. Short ribs were amazing. Calamari was good as well. Pasta is mediocre. You can tell this is not a classic Italian joint for a few reasons (1) they have no fruit dessert (2) they will not provide oil and vinegar for the table (3) they will not provide a spoon for pasta. The bread they do serve is spectacular. The portions of meat are grand. However they offer no side salad option. As an Italian woman, I am not so impressed with this hipster Italian joint, despite its pottery barn flare. Feels like home without the home feel, if you get it.

U_DIHoTpkxDnD_05AA0gng.text: Attended the first day of brunch at Bottiglia. Had a nice table in the middle of the dining room with 6 of my friends. The drinks were incredible! They may not have bottomless mimosas but you can order a mimosa with a carafe that you can order for yourself. Just as good! Our server Alyssa came by and was sure to pour our drinks from the carafe every time. I ordered the prosciutto eggs Benedict and wow that was to die for! Came with a large side of crispy potato wedges. Be sure to order the bread pudding that is a starter...comes with a side of caramel that you pour on. Such a delicious treat !

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hQbZU5czIQDTh7OziwzE0g.text: I think people are leaving reviews after having a bit too much to drink. This place is pretty, staff is pretty and so is the presentation of the food. Food was a bit bland, small portioned and way over priced.   If you are a wine drinker, I would give it a thumbs up. I would only recommend going there if you wanted to sit around and bs with someone leaning against a pillar swirling their wine glass around.

8ytciY-bQxrfteA-7tkVCQ.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. They have an amazing bar area and a great patio. The food is always amazing. The octopus is one of my favorites in town. I have to order it every visit. The piccata is my normal order with spaghetti squash which is fantastic. The bread is great as well. I have tried most of the menu and I really enjoy the eggplant app as well.

Yfi-2_ffr0SQkDMWPjtl8g.text: Gerald was spot on with his recommendations for the family dinner.   Gnocchi was a huge hit.  A little spicy but just enough heat to keep me sipping my wine!!  The chicken parm was great along with the mac and cheese.  We sat on the patio and the breeze was perfect and made the evening very comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake.  I ate the gnocchi too fast to get a pic!!!
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm and mac and cheese

q3_zHDQK0XyPAgnQxIVc0g.text: Great location and fantastic happy hour! Food is very good but service could be better. Great for special occasions, date night or just going with the family for a nice bottle of wine and great food. Ambiance is fresh and appalling and the food comes out fresh and tasty. Enjoy! Highly recommended.

66V4fvRA1TgV4zaVdqvD5w.text: Went here for my moms birthday dinner.. overall it was a good experience.. the staff was very friendly, attentive, and prompt. Everyone enjoyed their entrees and the eggplant with buffalo mozzarella was yummy! Side dishes.. cauliflower was less than mediocre and the artichoke was horrible.. it was completely dried out and inedible.. was surprised that the chef served it like that.. i sent it back and the server was nice about it. Desserts were really good but poppy seed donuts were perfection! We will definitely be back

xdQtNMvEgvSRW7DsmHXV5Q.text: First time dining here, and it was wonderful! There were nine of us out for Father's Day and we dined in a room separated from the main dining area by glass walls. Very nice! Our server, Zach, was excellent! The rest of the staff was very on-point with clearing away dishes and making sure water glasses were always refilled.  All of our food, appetizers through dessert, were very, very good! There wasn't one of us who was disappointed with our orders! Very happy with the quality and presentation of the food, and look forward to returning soon!  We have since dined here multiple times, including happy hour and brunch. This place is still fabulous! Always delicious food and ambience. Love!

YjPZK_8CC99_c_tcJ9BXtA.text: We got the halibut, Calamari, oysters and the zucchini flower. The halibut was a little bland and dry. The calamari was small and salty. The oysters were so minuscule I thought they were missing from the shell. The zucchini flower was not very flavorful and the lemon donuts were so sugary I think I developed diabetes. The food is very aesthetically pleasing but service was also very slow. Live music was okay. Sangria was tasty. Not too sweet.

Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So bland

m2t87Pindjs4diwHwUs7Qw.text: Let me start off by saying I'm giving this restaurant 3 stars solely for the aesthetics and two of the three plates we got.   The decor is pleasing to the eye and definitely makes you feel at home. I was with a larger group so they sat us in a private area and drew a curtain for privacy. The waiter knew we had a movie to catch and he was very prompt about getting drinks ordered.   A bread platter arrived shortly after we ordered appetizers. The butter is to die for! Sweet, creamy, and a slight lemon undertone, absolutely perfect.   Slowly appetizers started to arrive but not all at once. Some got theirs and about ten minutes later another... Odd but okay, about 30 minutes later the waiters began clearing appetizer and bread plates to prepare for the main course. Unfortunately, I had not gotten my beet salad yet. I mentioned it to the waiter and a few minutes later, it arrived. This was worth the wait. The beets were sweet and tender, the goat cheese added a nice sharp contrast, and the sauce was creamy and wrapped the whole dish together beautifully.   That was the last good thing that happened... The main course took an additional 40 minutes, and only one person's dish came out. Over the next 10 minutes, more dishes began flying out. I ordered the seared pork, which I am sad to say was not worth the wait. The flavors were mediocre at best but it was a large portion. I shared with my date so it filled us both pretty well.   The movie was at 8:45, dinner was fully served by 7:40. Empty water cups by 8:00 and our waiter flitters in and tells us he's getting our checks ready, 8:20 and some of our cards were charged incorrectly. My date and I left a little early for another event around 8:40...  Granted, maybe our large group of 15 played a role in the less than superb service but I've never had such horrible service or only had one waiter. Perhaps he should've asked for help or had manager help delegate tasks. I won't be back. My friends and I can get better food with better service elsewhere.

LcrjGjTc0kUPsV_F2YmFQQ.text: Ordered waiters suggested dish, the pan seared halibut with brussel sprouts instead 2 small brick (hard) dry fish and heaping amount of burnt crispy sprouts. Then decided for the chicken piccata and side of spaghetti squash. Chicken was ok, drowned in the sauce then charged extra for the squash wow. Won't dine here again. No one even ask if my second meal was ok. Terrible

djphUK2Nh9inkFj5lF9yBw.text: There are few times in my life that I become so disappointed with a restaurant because it doesn't match their potential.  Usually, I'm just disappointed due to a total lack of potential.  I was also conflicted with how to rate this restaurant.   If I were to rate the manager, or lack thereof, this restaurant would receive 1 star.  Thankfully the upbeat staff, sans direction from their leader have changed my mind to increase to 3 star.  I feel obligated to mention how disgusted I am of the manager.  A gentleman, let me correct, a man that focuses all of his attention, and feels that it is a priority to text in the middle of the dining room, chat and make out with who I assume is his girlfriend at the end of the bar.  More importantly he does this in the middle of service on a Friday night. Of the several times I have dined at this restaurant, I have witnessed at least one, if not all of these behaviors all three times. How does that beard even pass health code inspection? In such a beautiful restaurant, with such a welcoming atmosphere, why do we have bum wandering around pouring bottles of Krug (check your pour cost there boys!!) for a couple of 20-somethings that wouldn't know Krug from Cook's.

4cPtNYuX7wz-ZCW7FPyJ8Q.text: Food, atmosphere, great customer service, this place has it all.  We are foodies and I gotta say, this place should be packed.

JfrOmq4ajHfjuLLOhmgVug.text: Michelle is amazing. Me and my friends were a hot mess but she was patient and on point! Good job. We will be back

tmVNh-IY9yAMZV_yMIJ__w.text: Horrible food. The server was nice but the food that came out of the kitchen was very bad.   My husband ordered a scotch on the rocks and the scotch was watery????    We ordered appetizers and they were basic. The bruschetta was okay and the salmon thin slices was fresh. The main meal we ordered eggplant ... so bad! And meatballs were not cooked. I didn't order rare.   Needless to say we didn't eat it, just asked for the check.   .... the manager came (didn't make eye contact) just walked over super quickly and said ok we are going to take care of the bill. We told our server we would pay for the drinks but they insisted on no check.   .... now usually I would give them a couple stars for taking out complaint seriously, but we headed next door to eat (still hungry)  And started having s GREAT time! GREAT food service drinks!! .....THEN here comes the same manager (I guess these are owned by same people) he pointed at us and started talking to the manager of the place we were now happily eating at.  Whatever. We didn't even care about this place anymore. Go to the MExican place. Next door. Much better people and food.

RtX7_xRSUj14I1rsJhH25A.text: Beautiful atmosphere! Bright and clean. The food was delicious. My party all had breakfast. The staff was polite and accommodating with the toddler that dined with us.   The only downside was that it took 45+ minutes to get our checks/pay the bill. We let the waitress know ahead of time that we would be splitting the check (5 checks total). Something came up that needed the managers attention, but it took quite a while to get ahold of him.   All in all, great food, beautiful restaurant. They are still new so I hope they fix any difficulties they have now to keep them around in the future.

g1q9EJCU9yCAvXLrriPaiw.text: Came here for dinner on the patio a few nights ago. Our server was Kobee, he was absolutely fantastic. I ordered his recommendation the Wild Mushroom Risotto for my entree. It was so delicious!!! Not to heavy or to light and full of flavor .  My table shared a Charcuterie board with Prosciutto, Coppa, Pecorino, and Teahive. The board came with an Apricot Mustarda and a Truffle Honey. Okay, I never experienced such a great display and flavor profile.  Overall everything was just awesome. From the wine, service,atmosphere, and food Bottiglia is a 5 star place. Thank you Kobee for the excellent service. And also Devon who was his assistant.

55P2pT-1E_cadVOvjJcucA.text: Only thing wrong with this restaurant is the name. Botig...botlag...botalia? Whatever.   Food: excellent. Every dish was perfectly seasoned, well thought out and creative...but not too creative (in the best possible way).   Service: attentive, personable, but unobtrusive. I'd also like to point out the patience our server had with a nearby table who was being terribly rude to him. He also dealt with my obnoxious 11 month old daughter in stride.   Atmosphere: this is where botigglia (sp?) really shines. I felt comfortable, but there was an air of distinguishability...hautiness. But not in an annoying way. I felt like I could be dining at a restaurant on the coast of the Mediterranean.   Wonderful addition to the growing number of great restaurants in the area.

UuTobptun7fWRPao1YXkqg.text: One word to describe Bottiliglia, disaster.  To start off the disastrous experience, we called and made a reservation. When we arrived, the three hostesses could not find our reservation. However, they were still able to seat us. After we were seated it took a while for our waitress to bring our menus, it took longer for our waters to be delivered, it took even longer for our orders to be taken, and it took an eternity for our food to be delivered. Also, I tried to use the Yelp check in offer for a free glass of wine but my waitress did not honor it. Conveniently some tables that were seated after us received their food before us. One table also finished their meal before we received our food. After our food was delivered, precisely 65 minutes after first sitting down, we asked for our check. Of course to cap off a bad experience we are brought another table's check. After we got the right check, it was the check used to charge hotel guests who charge to their rooms so again we had to request another check. Horrible multi flawed dinner.  My party had the spinach lasagna, the pappardelle bolognese, and the clam linguini. The food itself is decent. Nothing special nor worth writing home about.   I will not be returning and cannot recommend dining here. If you do dine I suggest giving them several weeks to try working some of the many kinks out.   The restaurant itself is nicely renovated. The service is very flawed and needs major overhaul. We did dine on Friday the 13 so that may have been our downfall.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle bolognese
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D_3FeNawB1HlMx3Ze9_J9Q.text: After reading my previous review I was contacted by the manager. She was able to locate my check, confirm the discrepancies and correct them without me having to pack up my children and leave my home. She was exceptionally kind and understanding. Honestly, the best part is that after talking with me last night she even remembered who I was after a very brief encounter with me during brunch. She remembered me standing next to her secretly peeking through the window watching my son do his flower pot activity and she remembered that, that was a huge step for my family as my son has special needs and that was the first time he went off on his own to participate in an activity. It really touched my heart that in a restaurant full of patrons and after an entire shift and interactions with dozens if not hundreds of people after me, she remember little o'l us & she remembered how significant the experience was for our family. I think it takes someone really special to pay that kind of attention to customers & remember individuals and their stories in a professional environment with so many other responsibilities and so much on their plate. I felt very nervous and really embarrassed about my check that day & after talking with her I wish I hadn't been too insecure to talk to her while I was there in the restaurant. Diane, I'm not sure if you will see this one, but from the bottom of my heart, Thank You for everything. You were so kind to me and I was so nervous and so embarrassed about the entire situation. You made me feel comfortable and that means the world to me. You are appreciated.

_v3jNHle9x1MyZ4CUt6Zfg.text: We have eaten there twice over last 6 months. It is excellent,  but a little pricey for this old retiree to be more regular. Entrees run 20.00 to 47.00 to stay informational and evenhanded.  The last time, though, we went, was a 1/2 price entrees (go to green valley ranch site 4 more info). They fixed my pappardelle Bolognese,  subbing spaghetti as pasta.  My wife had the wild mushroom tagliatelle. She was VERY please by this rich tasty dish. Even has a kids menu. Something for the red meat'ers. and the vegan palate. Nothing I've had there was "ordinary ". All, so far, has been good to excellent. All the usual Italian suspects such as marsala, picatta , lasagna etc.  and generous portions.

HTomU5Y7l_6YODyuKdJ9Dg.text: Okay the cutest place in Vegas. Michelle was our Server, im requesting her everytime!!!!!!!!!! P.s. Bottomless mimosas are only $12!!!!

H0DxDFkZLOnO2wYrdiKkBg.text: Awesome experience! We had ZACH as our server and he was very kind. He was also with another huge party but still let us know he was paying attention to us keeping up on drinks and making sure we were ok. Made a reservation and waited maybe 5 minutes past it but we're all offered a free desert each (of our choice) to make up for it. Everyone was smiling and very friendly and open.   Only down side is you have to pay extra for sides and food took a little long, but it was a busy night so still wasn't too bad.   The Tiramisu desert! It is TO DIE FOR.   I'd go back again and definitely ask for ZACH

8BUOBTrLQCnMoDVSbcJL0A.text: Wait... This is INSIDE the casino? Bottiglia is BEAUTIFUL. I've never seen a restaurant fit so awkwardly into its surroundings. Walk through the zombies of Hendersonians playing slots in the dark, dreary casino and make your way to the brightly lit, Pinterest perfect Italian restaurant. There are comfy couches to sit with in-laws, a classy bar to sit with your hot date, cozy circular tables to snuggle up or a fun patio to sit with your coworkers. Bottiglia is perfect for everyone.  We started the night with the charcuterie board- 3 for $12 was almost too much for the two of us to split. The teahive from Utah had a sweet honey taste and I loved it. Meat, cheese, apricots, honey, chocolate bread on an adorable pig board. Yes, yes, YES. I can't wait to come back for happy hour ($6 wine?!?!?!) and order this again!  Linguini Vongole: SO MANY CLAMS. They brought out the bowl for our shells before they brought the meal and I was confused as to why the bowl was so big..... And then I saw why. The portions at Bottiglia are great. The pasta was perfect.  Veal Marsala: The meat was so tender and again, the portion was huge. Simple, but good. I have no objections on ordering it again, but I think I would try a different meat next time.  Yelp check in for a free glass of house wine! Bottiglia brought us out a beautiful  slice of chocolate cake with chocolate mousse and a candle when they heard it was my partner's birthday. THANK YOU GUYS- You made the night perfect!  Don't let the location (inside the GVR Casino?!) scare you away. Bottiglia could easily be a restaurant on the strip. This has to be the only restaurant in Henderson I've seen people dress nice in, haha. I can't wait to visit again when the weathers a little cooler and sit on your patio!

Dc0-7aXu-fvYu6fWBgpLdQ.text: So glad to finally have a great Italian place other than the strip.  The service is a tad slow, but I can totally forgive that minor indiscretion for the quality of the food. Wild mushroom risotto..... oh hell yeah!!! The best I've had in Vegas.

TdPbDQGugh0Px_kh8XtkfA.text: I really liked the atmosphere of the restaurant. It was very unique and beautiful. Our servers name was KOBEE and he was attentive and helpful. Mary the manager checked in and made sure every thank was perfect, which it was :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a must try Rose

Unw880EFOXuLjeZNcWdlQg.text: Best parts of my dinner were the tomato salad with pesto and the doughnuts for dessert.  The king crab buccatini was a big disappointment.  It was served with thick spaghetti noodles that were tough - def not al dente.  Service was good and so was the rose.  But the pasta was only slightly better than Olive Garden and it had so little crab, I could barely taste it.  At $32 or something like that, it felt like I was robbed.

fxIP5hgAN-j_BMzTcgM5JA.text: Tonight was my second time I've eaten here at Bottiglia, but this time I did Happy Hour. The staff was kind from The hostess stand, to the bartender, to the server for Happy Hour. Food came out promptly, but most importantly.... Our server was attentive and very kind. If my memory serves me correct, his name was Shay. I definitely recommend him. We also had a few other people clear our plates from our table and they were very sweet. The service team made us laugh and feel very welcome. I would recommend the chicken parm, the meatballs, oysters, and the chicken piccata. Also the AGM, Mary, stopped by our table and asked how everything was... Absolutely love her. Super sweet and made sure our table had an excellent evening! Thank you Bottiglia !!

06Q7YOJn_0CllH0jmuh45g.text: I've heard about this place few months ago. Checked the stats here and it had 3.5 stars and the industry rumors were about bad service.  We decide to check it out for brunch with party of 6.  We came few minutes late behind the original reservation, but surprisingly the place was almost empty at 12:30 on Sunday with great outdoor temp and few games going on on the tvs.  We asked for a table outside, after 10 mins the hostess had the table ready. The venue has nice patio amenities ( shades, mists etc) but the hostess decided to seat us on a table where mostly wasn't under the sun. We had to move to the other side of the restaurant where we found ourself perfect solid shaded patio.  Interior it's pretty impressive. Open concept, rustic design and very pretty pastel colors all over the venue ( my wife flower shoes were matching, she was excited)  Getting on the menu!  I didn't want to dig the menu before I get there I wanted to be surprised and wowed. Well I end up wowed with 6 brunch items. Noting impressive or mouth watering. Lox bagels, one Benedict option classic bacon with toast, yogurt and a cup of fruit! Yea cup of fruit as a main item on a brunch menu! Sad! Rest of the items were some pastas and dinner entrees. I saw end up getting carpaccio. It was ok, served with poached egg.  We tried most of the drinks. Blood orange mimosa and both sangrias. I think I got diabetes afterwards. Soo sweet and plain. No twist at all.   Our sever was slow in general. I don't know what was the reason for it, but we were waiting for drinks for a while, water glasses were empty most of the time.   After all I love the ambience, the location and the vibe at this place. Service and food quality need to be improved.
