OfDklB-yC3rxBMtfikTftQ.text: Go to date night in Henderson. Staff is always friendly, food is always solid. The baked mozzarella is awesome and you can't go wrong with any of the pasta. They also have a loyalty card for wine bottles, but I always forget it at home

ePRwRtX9OP29X3_ZtFQHVQ.text: Bottiglia is an awesome restaurant. The service is amazing and the food is incredible. Definitely will recommend to all my friends and family. The staff are amazing and make sure you are satisfied the entire time you are there. And bottomless mimosas on Sunday!!!!! Wohoooooo!

HirdBzcUcGMte8FFj-NGmw.text: **One of the most beautiful restaurants you will ever walk into**  My family and I had our Thanksgiving dinner at Bottiglia and could not have had a better evening.   It was convenient that some of the family was able to have a turkey dinner and the others could still order off the menu.   I had the Thanksgiving tasting menu. It was started off with a choice of soup or salad. I had the butternut squash soup with turkey meatballs. Some of the best turkey meatballs I have ever had. My dad went with the fall pear salad. It had prosciutto and a whipped mascarpone. Nice presentation.   Next course was the turkey dinner. Very flavorful dark meat underneath a few slices of white breast. Some type of cream truffle green beans that were so good and I do not care for truffle.. stuffing, mashed potatoes and a great cranberry sauce. Too filling.   For dessert there was vanilla gelato with pumpkin panacotta. Great way to end the meal with something lighter.   The meal was coursed perfectly and the staff was great. No one likes working on Thanksgiving but everyone had a smile and was friendly.   Thank you Bottiglia you know I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasting menu Thanksgiving dessert... Poundcake&amp;nut combo underneath pumpkin spice panacotta and vanilla gelato... Wow
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main course Thanksgiving

PMzyv6pkKtA7AWYSo4Ktjw.text: Honestly one of the best places in Vegas to have brunch service is always on top of things and food is bomb. Great for a group of your friends.

Nq0p67EeXWhKz7e6paab2w.text: Best mimosas and brunch ever! I had the California eggs Benedict and it was delicious!

TmKEBAlqrZF_2jiybGMvvg.text: We went there for happy hour last Friday and our waitress Michelle was fabulous!  She gave us the perfect recommendation for drinks and food. She was friendly and efficient on her job.

IhJsNDM_SsTYwO5v55bGkA.text: Beautiful interior and outside patio but terrible food and slow, rude,service. The waiter even said "so I will bring more water...when I get the chance". Mind you this is on a Monday evening. Ordered chicken picatta that was a la carte. The serving size was that of a child's order and cost $24. Also ordered burrata and it was not burrata but a scoop of white sloppy mess that was incredibly bland. I am well aware of what burrata is and what we were served is shameful.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is NOT burrata!

zk6tAekdywsO4LhAINbjfg.text: We had a wonderful experience here celebrating my parents' 57th wedding anniversary. The hostess, our wait staff, food, decor and atmosphere, and service were five star. We will return and try their Sunday brunch.

C5MTjJStnmb0pguW71yCaw.text: Must try the fried calamari, tender and crispy. Had the lobster fra diavolo for my entree. Ask for it extra spicy and with extra bread to sop up the sauce. 10/10 would recommend  UPDATE 1/4/18:  I wrote a positive review a while ago because my roommate, Colin, used to be a server. The food is still good but God, the service is fucking terrible. I came here for brunch for a friend's birthday and we were the ONLY large party. Barely any other tables, maybe like 2 other ones with 3 per. TOPS!  I drank ALL of this water before the server decided to refill my water and when she decided to, she asked "which one was yours?" and refills ONLY ONE!! WTF??? I DRANK ALL THIS WATER U THINK ONE IS GOING TO HOLD ME DOWN AFTER YOU TOOK ALMOST AN HOUR TO REFILL MY FIRST ONE??  Also, my friend who had work 2 hours after our reservation ordered a salad thinking she would be able to eat with us. Later to for us to find out that her salad was the LAST thing to come out and she was not able to eat with us and we had to ask for it to-go.  I don't usually write reviews and I never care to learn the server's name but I really wish I did learn her name because I saw her in plain sight flirting with another server so to that girl, if you're reading this, this is why you didn't get a tip on a $200ish tab.   To end this, shoutout to Derek and Tony and Zach. 10/10 would recommend for everything and anything. That is all

YF51aGLUQUlxgli8myFO8Q.text: Loved the atmosphere!  The overall look and feel of the restaurant was amazing.  Our waiter was friendly and seemed very experienced.  Food was great!  Get the donuts for dessert...AMAZING!!!   Loved that in was inside a locals hotel...We will definitely be back!  Update:  went to the kids Valentine's brunch today and loved it.. the kids had a blast and loved that our favorite server Kobee was there!  He's the best!!!

dgLwFyppR3YQs6Kq3IvjCg.text: Q and Tommy were amazing at the bar! Had the tomato soup they just added to the menu & it was so delicious. The perfect amount of creaminess. Love coming to this place! The manager Matt stopped by to check in, which is something you don't see to often. The decor is so beautiful. You really feel like you're sitting in a restaurant in the middle of Italy!

yNg4nam_B_90RB8DArPX-g.text: Great and awesome service! Went to Bottiglia for brunch and had the best endless mimosa of my life with different flavors to choose from. Finitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great time for Sunday brunch!

PCTECHIjc0nRJCitoToQhg.text: First off..... Nick, our server was absolutely fantastic, he was attentive, intelligent, insightful and efficient. He kept us up to date with when our food and drinks were coming out.... Next, the food was to die for, everything was prepared perfectly and came out of the kitchen in a timely manner. Overall our experience was great, we will be coming back again and definitely will be recommending it to all of our friend.   PS. Ask for Nick as your server, you won't be disappointed.

IQZr3AezDx9WKJewwtAEBA.text: Great atmosphere, we went there on a Friday and they have live music. The calamari and gnocchi pesto were delicious

2Eqfd8EPj7fHfjhSs6OQKQ.text: "Exceptional Service" The context of our night was "Valentines Day." Started with a mix up on reservation but the staff went out of their way to get us seated. While we waited we were offered a free cocktail of choice. Once seated our young waiter (all staff is young, genuine and personal) was exceptional. We enjoyed our filet mignon and gnocchis greatly. Very nice ambiance and enjoyed the excellent live music. Yackety yack, definitely coming back!

-5WZPUrTo_WJ_ot7DcGm5Q.text: Very good Caesar salad, good focaccia bread. The entrees however were just weird tasting. Nothing should be difficult about making a piccata sauce or a Marsala sauce, but these two dishes had some very different and weird tastes to them. Maybe they think adding " their own touch " to the dishes is creative but I call them disgusting. Also the chicken wasn't pounded enough and it was tough. Really disappointing. The prices are too high for such rookie, "beginning chef" mistakes.

FDdpMuG1Exs5_9hDZzGSnQ.text: Tony was great! I sat at the bar on half-off pasta night and was able to talk baseball with him almost the entire time. He was able to serve other customers while keeping up with our chat, which I know is not easy to do. The pasta was awesome and I will definitely be back!

NFyvoswV8QQjLixYvEjCAg.text: This place is really charming and perfect for a quick drink or dinner date. Reminds me of one of my favorite restaurants in L.A. We made a reservation same day via yelp and were seated at our table in less than an hour. They had live music the night we went and it really set the mood. Nothing too sleepy or jazzy but still familiar. Definitely plan on coming back.

HA1pAfHWkUmJO0ctmiEeNQ.text: the not so good: - sadly, this place has soooo much potential but management has decided to go too commercial - food flavors are ok and not exceptional  the good: - hmmmm, leme think about it...

5ePJXeKIxcghyyfAaWvgFg.text: This place Is amazing !  Food is great, atmosphere is great all the staff is polite and attentive! Ask for Jenna she was our server and she rocked! Mary the manager also came over and checked on us she was also very friendly and super nice to my son. Will definitely be coming back!

3T6LkUfwd-Q2LojwI7aOdA.text: This place was overpriced and had poor quality of food.  The $7 happy hour menu was a joke and had about five items on it.  We had calamari ($14), gnocchi ($22) (with added chicken $4), and veal masala ($32).  The gnocchi was the better of the items.  The marinara sauces that came with the calamari was watery and had little flavor.  The gnocchi was not too bad but the sauce was watered down and had little flavor.  I was disappointed with the veal because the sauce was thin and had little flavor.  It was also tough and almost as flatten as a quarter.  The veal was so lonely on the plate, because it did not come with any side.  For $32 they could have added a side salad and pasta.  Pasta is inexpensive enough to add to a dish.  This place was just cutting corners and being cheap!  I do not know what kind of place they are running but man the sure know how to stretch their sauces by watering them down.  The wait staff was friendly enough, but I felt very rushed.  We did not even finish our calamari and they were trying to clear the table.  They asked us twice if we were done with the dish even with food still in it.  We even had to ask for bread.  I would not go back to this place and would not recommend it to anyone.  The sad part was that my wife was so excited about going to this place and she was disappointed with the dinner.

xBuw5b3ZXSvv33jlvOKmtA.text: Had such an amazing meal and great servers!! Thank you to Michelle and Steven for their great service, definitely coming again when I visit Vegas.

U3AS-xcY8hB7cnTbnIZcCw.text: My boyfriend and I went to Bottiglia last week for a date night and were not disappointed. We had several appetizers that hit the spot and split the chicken parmesan and spinach lasagna for our entree. The service led by Jenna was great. Jenna was entertaining and always one step ahead of our needs. The manager, Mary, even took the time to stop by our table and make sure everything was to our liking. We will definitely be going back again!

lblE2TVtU6rlrtENgEB7xg.text: Great for drinks, appetizers and happy hour!  Food is NO BUONO. Been here twice for dinner and both times I was left with a "meh" impression when it came to food. Other Pros: Live music on Fridays.

n2vhHhGSkccQbV_9USwQJg.text: We had a great experience and service! Waiters were vere professinal, helpped alot to make choices. Dishes were made great, tasted great. Reservation took 1 min and we were waitibg to be seated fir 2-3min. Bravo. Atmosphere of restaurant is very cute, "out of Strip" feeling.  Just one note to rrstaurant owner and chef - desserts must be done on site. Such an amazing dinner and I had a craving for REAL ITALIAN CHEESECAKE! I would order it only if made on site and authentic!  Overall - very nice place for dressy or casual dining! Thank you.

MbmlW_qDKVDP1I6Htb-LHQ.text: Disappointing... we sat at the bar. Jennifer is cute but not a good server. She asked us if we wanted more wine but never offered to fill our water glasses. They changed the bread to house made focaccia. Dry and cold. We use to love the fried mozzarella but this time it was cold.  Jennifer didn't tell us if they had any specials and didn't suggest anything, even the cocktails. And I don't need to see your cleavage while dining. I'm sure men would be thrilled......

IpmtR93XHCDX5ylOGJ3XRg.text: I love this place., some of my friends don't agree, but I love it. The food the atmosphere and the wine. The bar feels like my kitchen counter and I am just having a glass with friends. The happy hour is awesome and the food is always improving. I like to jump in there on a evening with my fiancee and get a cheese board and a glass after the gym and before we call it a night. Only 4 stars because sometimes the service is average not at the bar.

5trQ-pVs6HHMjg_SHYehBA.text: I am extremely happy we found this beautiful place.  My daughter had her wedding reception here,  First Joy who was dedicated & gave my daughter options not to mention it was a 2 week noticed.   Joy went Above & Beyond I want  thank her for being there from the moment we met until the day of the reception. She is an amazing Event cordinator, very professional.  The staff (servers,assistant servers,bartenders,hostess, managers)were incredible they answer to our special request & paid attention to little details from suggesting & assisting our guest.    Food was extremely delicious, our guest were complimenting and left so happy, which it was very important to us since everyone came from different parts of California & out of State.  Words might not be enough to Thank each & everyone who made this possible. I strongly recommend "Bottiglia Cucina Enoteca"for your next event or even for dinner. I will stop by on out next visit to Vegas. Thank You!!!!

xC4TuU2hcl2ajOu3dEGsNg.text: By far one of my favorite places for brunch! I mean we have been here for dinner before too and it was delicious. But we came for brunch on Sunday and with the weather being so great lately and the natural light in the restaurant it's just a great atmosphere. The food is delicious. The mimosas are bottomless! And the staff is so friendly. I definitely recommend this place for brunch and dinner!

2Xfz9ayECO_XV541HBSeyg.text: This is by far the best restaurant in green valley ranch resort. We had an amazing server Adriana and one of the best dinning experiences. Because we had a larger party we were out into a secluded dinning area which made the whole experience even more wonderful. Thanks again to Adriana!!

3ABtj-GE9SE-IeeLRNXMiw.text: Love the decor of this restaurant. Unfortunately it is marred by the addition of televisions everywhere. One oil and vinegar dipping bowl for bread was very unappealing. Scallops over mushroom risotto was excellent and the vegan friend dining with us tried the bolognese made with chickpeas, ate every bite. One oil vinegar dipping bowl. Service was very good.

hE1t0vCe4qvHJ3MM_q0LKg.text: Made a reservation for our anniversary. Came dressed nicely for an outdoor seating reservation. Once we got there, the hostess says "I see you have an outdoor reservation which we can't do because of a private event". Um so you couldn't call until we got there? Now we are frustrated with trying to find a place to go. Not worth this mess, just go to the strip.

97ScuhoBcnlONiCHExt4RA.text: The food was phenomenal. The portions were huge. We over ordered for sure. The burrata appetizer I had could have had more burrata in relation to the amount of tomatoes but the ripeness of the tomatoes made up for it. The large cold antipasti was wayyyy too big for 5 people but we totally packed it to go. For my main I had a corn ravioli off of the specials menu. I could not believe how good it was. I almost ordered another 'to go'. If you go to one restaurant off of the strip, make this one it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aPdh_rs1Dc-Mk_fFkJPYgQ.text: I've been here a few times for various reasons and I think that these guys have done a pretty good job so far.  This is the second Italian restaurant in the Green Valley Ranch casino. The other is Pizza Rock which focuses more on pizzas. Bottiglia has more of a pasta menu which is pretty nice. Some of the pastas are even made in-house, so make sure to ask your server if you're into that kinda stuff.   The ambiance is really nice. It's more upscale than Pizza Rock and has a more elegant feel to it, without being too stuffy. I like how they did the interior.  The food is solid. There are some things that I really like, and some others that I didn't really care for. I've tried most of their pastas and thought they were good. They also have some really tasty apps like the squash blossoms.   Bottiglia has a real solid wine list and cocktail program. I tried the Italian Stallion cocktail and thought it had really great balance. Their house wines are decent as well.  I would recommend this place for anyone who wants a night out for some Italian food that is not pizza. They have some interesting entrees which sound appetizing.

vHi7ucIyhNFv6fnwCUF3nQ.text: I have been to Bottiglia Enoteca about half a dozen times now. Every time is fantastic. The food, service and ambiance is perfect. The hostess at front was friendly and brought us to our table promptly. Our server Alexis is AMAZING, we have had her a couple times now and definitely recommend that you request her if you want top notch service. Even the manager went over to Borracha to get a bottle of Grey Goose Le Poire (Pear) so that they could make me my favorite martini a Grey Good Pear Martini with a splash of St Germaine. We then ordered a dozen oysters (Tuesdays are $1 oyster nights) which were fresh and tasty and they serve it with cocktail sauce and a delicious mignonette. Split their burrata caprese salad (the pistachio pesto is a great addition) and an order of calamari (served with a simple marinara sauce and a separate aioli of some kind). Then ordered the wild mushroom tagliatelle and the king crab buccatini. Both were delicious and I would definitely recommend the wild mushroom tagliatelle to anyone, it is AMAZING. The king crab buccatini was good, however the lemon was a little too overpowering and I believe the dish would be better with a different pasta, a lighter angel hair perhaps. Overall you will experience a great meal and service when you visit Bottiglia. Visit their website to see what special deals they have going on. I know they have happy hour M-F 5-7p, Tuesdays are dollar oysters, and Sunday they have brunch with all you can drink mimosas and bellinis. Every once and a while they will even have a day where all the pastas are half off. Check it out!

XelSGOvN3URZfBxSg9A-sw.text: My friends and I went to Bottiglia for brunch one Sunday. Never having been for brunch we weren't really sure what to expect.  Let's talk about bottomless mimosas (a ton of flavors), and really delicious food (that came with reeeeeeally delicious jam). The staff was kind and very good looking (which is always a plus).  The manager was on top of it at all times.  I've been in the service industry for a long time so you start to notice these things.  He came by multiple times to make sure everything was going good, that everything was cooked and made to our liking and just to ask how our weekends were going. Talk about customer service.   The peach mimosa was by far my favorite (but they were all really good) and the jam you get with your toast was unbelievable.  I could eat it on it's own.  Every meal that came to our table was devoured and every mimosa was finished as we were ready for the next flavor to try.   I HIGHLY recommend going to Bottiglia, you will not regret it.  The environment is awesome and is decorated so uniquely. It's super refreshing and you can't help but feel comfortable and inspired all at once.

jhK5Dg1rY4XwUNC4uPsqJw.text: Gorgeous restaurant inside of GVR casino!  We love coming here when they have live music.  Drinks are always spot on. I love ordering the Bellini. Service is always fantastic. The food is okay though nothing to rave over. It's nice to have a semi casual restaurant option in our neighborhood though!

7T3pL2zx96HPz6GH5xeeVg.text: Went for my birthday and had an amazing time. Amazing staff, great food and drinks. The place is so beautiful inside and outside... never seen a place like this one before. I will definitely be bringing friends and family here.

dioCC0vy0Xp9rFx7AQJhJw.text: Bottiglia has a southern chic vibe, once inside you would never guess you were in a casino in Las Vegas because it didn't feel over the top like most Vegas restaurants. I appreciated that they had a live musician singing and playing guitar throughout dinner, and service was prompt and friendly.   The best part of dinner was the complimentary basket of bread. Fresh and delicious, loved the crispy Parmesan cracker. The rest of the food was mediocre: caesar salad, gnocchi, and eggplant.   I would order the eggplant again but skip on the rest. Perhaps we ordered the wrong thing...

Pmw1qhE8ZCf9sApsbs3MGg.text: The California  Eggs Benedict was fantastic. My bed was tomatoes not a bun. The flavors  came together very well. Eggs were pouched perfectly. The  tender side potatoes were seasoned delicately  but very flavorful. Great choice for a celiac client.

I_c8qUqciwYtcQXskaWpNg.text: Love the food, atmosphere and happy hour, plus it's so close to home. Staff is nice and very accommodating.  Best Tequila Moscow ever!

Vxe04L8n25b22K6snRgW9Q.text: Sea bass was delish ~ great atmosphere and fantastic ambiance!   Even the live music was just perfect!

s1S6Y9XlqQoSsigBqan94w.text: I have been to the fine Italian restaurant a few times and I have always been impressed with the presentation, quality and uniqueness of the food. On my last visit I had the Wild Mushroom Tagliatelle and it was off the hook. I always seek something with meat but this pasta dish just blew me away. I also tried the grilled octopus as an appetizer but it was a bit different from what I expected. I suggest you always ask tour server to briefly describe how the dish is made or just dig into the yelp photos for details. A must have I discovered on my last visit is the Panna Cotta dessert. Oh and did I mention the staff is super friendly and accommodative :) Having dinner with a 2 and 4 year old worked out just fine!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kp4_wM6B6-3wnPNDdJscEw.text: Went to Bottiglia a couple of times now and service was spectacular...great service, great management team, great ambiance, great food... We tried the following: King crab bucatini - creamy, meaty...quite pricey but quality is there. Linguini Vongole - light, yet so satisfying.  The clams were fresh and plump. Dessert platter - strawberry panna cotta, tiramisu, lemon poppy seed donuts, all delicious! Oysters - On a Tuesday, these oysters from Washington was at $1/each (regularly priced at $3).  Fresh and delightful...I can finish 2 dozens on my own.  Currently in November, they are offering 50% off pasta from Mon-Thurs.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8YA9WfiR7XGdsbb9aMfDhQ.text: This place is so cute and chic inside. Love the decors from the entrance up to the inside. Some tables have marble table tops (which I love). Our server greeted us as soon as we got in. He offered many wine selections and was very knowledgeable with the menu. He made great recommendations and informed us about the $1 oyster special of the day. Also, if you check in with yelp.. you'll get a free glass of wine (you're welcome).   Came here because of the 50% off all pasta during the month of November.   What I ordered:  Krab lemon pasta (it was delicious!)   Lots of oysters! ($1 on tuesdays)  Pinot Grigio (free w/ check in)   The lemon pasta was so good and filling. It had just the right hint of lemon and cream taste to it. Light and yet satisfying. I highly recommend it.  Oysters tasted so fresh, I just wanted to keep eating more of it hehe Overall, our experience was great. Our server was so attentive and our water was always refilled.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kDq_PGIQIL2yAwEPSthk4w.text: Food was okay here. The music was really off! This restaurant is beautifully decorated and chic. There is a little disconnect though with the vibe. It's located at one side of a casino. There is our door seating but it was too windy when we went.  We'll go back there but there wasn't anything really stand out on the menu, nothing memorable. Cute though with decent service. Good happy hour option!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PT2e33Z3vs4dYZCcxHwC6g.text: First time coming and we had such a great experience. Tommy was our server and he was awesome. Amazing food and cute little restaurant that makes you feel like you're away from the casino life

rzL-exwSQXkr_tfW4QDnMA.text: I've been to Bottiglia twice and my most recent visit really impressed! Service from Zack was great, the patio is gorgeous for the weather we're having, and most of the food was delicious. Add in that they have a free glass of wine with Yelp check in, dollar oysters on Tuesday, and a decent HH menu, and I am down to return regularly!  First visit was for a networking happy hour event and the small bites didn't impress but the space was gorgeous. Yelp reviews were mixed, I had no urgency to return until I saw their National Pasta Day promo for half-off pasta dishes. Made reservations with two friends and spent a couple hours sipping and noshing.  The apps are solid, from the bread plate with a sweet honey butter to the gorgeous charcuterie plate we got (burrata with double bresaola and truffle honey FTW!). The oysters were super fresh, too. The meatballs from the HH menu were the only thing that underwhelmed, great texture but not as much flavor in the meat or sauce, but they have strong competition next door for this dish.  Moving on to the pastas! Don't sleep on the side of Carbonara Mac & Cheese, which was a hit at our table. The creamy cheese sauce sticks to the trumpet-shaped campanelle pasta well, and the guanciale-bacon combo packs a punch of flavor. If you choose to go with a meat/seafood main, this still lets you get your carb fix. As for the pasta entrees, the Shrimp Puttanesca was decent and meaty with a hearty sauce, a touch of heat, and tons of shrimp. Unfortunately, the veal ravioli was extremely bland and the sauce was broken. Per menu description, there was allegedly truffle cream involved and ricotta inside, but our trio detected none of those flavors. Zack helpfully asked to switch out this dish, but we declined.  Overall, I was pleased with this redeeming visit, but the various discounts and promotions surely helped. Looking forward to a revisit for the pappardelle bolognese and the octopus app.  TIP: If you missed out on National Pasta Day, they're running similar discounts in early November!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papardelle bolognese
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab bucatini
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio,  $7 @HH

-6GVGH8zYo0kEVaSNsNElA.text: Wow! Can you say fancy and fine-dining! This place exceeded expectations. We came here for a date night and loved how cute the place was. I wish the weather was nice enough to sit out on the patio. Prices were on the high end but the food was definitely worth it! I had the wild Mushroom Tagliatelle, which I have to say was he best Italian dish I've personally had-so flavorful and rich! The portions are fairly reasonable too. My boyfriend had the Linguini Vongole, which came with plentiful clams. Good service, casual romantic setting, and top notch food! I've already recommended a few couples to check it out when they come to visit. I love that they also have a few vegetarian and Vegan options. Will definitely be planning to come back.

Dx_-Bc_CIzTJJ10G8cdRBw.text: I'll admit that it's easier to give five stars after experiencing a trifecta of special pricing, but I can't say that I've had better Italian food recently if ever.  Bottiglia Cucina & Enoteca is an Italian restaurant that opened last year on the Paseo Verde side of Green Valley Ranch. Except for Sunday brunch, they're only open for dinner. Reservations are taken and seem to be necessary on special occasions, but we were able to get bar seating for 3 despite being told that it'd take over 2.5 hours to get a table.  Today was National Pasta Day, and they had a 50% off deal that surely drew crowds all night long. It also happened to be Oyster Tuesday, with fresh shucked oysters available for $1. They're (intentionally) on the smaller side, and a few pieces were quite miniscule, but they were sweet and went will with any of the accompaniments: the standard cocktail sauce, the alternative that somewhat resembled fish sauce, or just a small squeeze of lemon. Only fault was the presence of broken shell pieces in several bites.  Complimentary bread was enjoyable, especially the crispy cheese cracker. The crunchy thin "breadstick" was okay, and the two baguette end pieces were good. The real star was the honey butter, which had a hint of citrus and was so addictive that I almost completely forgot that the Italian take on this app usually comes with an olive oil and balsamic sauce. Oh well. I preferred the honey butter anyway.  It was also happy hour (5-7pm on weekdays), so I got the happy hour meatballs ($7 for 2 pc.). Assuming that Yelp photos of regular menu meatballs ($14 for 3 pc.) are correct, then I actually did get a decent discount, although my first thought was that these had better be the best meatballs that I've ever had for $3.50 a pop. Turns out that this was exactly the case, with a moist and soft yet thoroughly delicious ground meat playing well against the balanced tomato "gravy."  We each ordered a pasta to take advantage of the special. I settled on the Spinach Lasagna ($22 regular price), a simple preparation with ricotta, mozzarella, and a tomato sauce. It was surprisingly fantastic, and I wouldn't have longed for meat at all even if I'd not ordered the meatballs. Also, neither this nor the other pastas would be filling enough alone for a dinner.  I also tried two other entrees. The King Crab Bucatini ($32) is one of those dishes where I'd probably always long for more protein, but my one bite had al dente pasta, great cream sauce, a piece of delicious roasted tomato, and fresh crab. The Pappardelle Bolognese ($26) had a plentiful amount of yet another balanced sauce, as well as an al dente preparation of the only pasta on the menu that's actually made in-house. If I suddenly developed some sort of cheese allergy, then I could be happy with either of these.  We decided to split dessert, a sampler ($15) which included small portions of three treats made in-house (I think; check with Michael K. in case he paid more attention). The strawberry panna cotta was smooth and not too sweet. The tiramisu had that rum flavor which so many preparations lack, although maybe the espresso was lost in favor of the chocolate shavings. The lemon poppyseed donuts (3 pc.) were much closer to muffins in density, but are enjoyable regardless, whether alone, with a dollop of the mixed berry compote, or with a pour of the other, fruit-based sauce (guava and strawberry, perhaps).  Decor was bright with light colors, or at least we had plenty of lighting until they dimmed the lights at dusk. It still wasn't too dark at that point. TVs adorn each side of the bar and at least one of the other interior walls, and national broadcasts of both hockey and basketball were airing (although everything was reportedly switched to baseball playoffs later - sigh). The patio could be interesting, but I don't typically care for outdoor seating, and I was quite happy with the frequent and attentive bar seating service. Pacing and speed of food was great too.  Bottiglia does feel like a Strip-priced restaurant, but the quality of the food was commensurate. I certainly don't have the budget to visit often, but I'd return for a special occasion or if I wanted to be assured of having great pasta.

xrxLwK5sJUgSQyhxLty2eQ.text: Yummy in your tummy. Yummy in my tummy. Simply very yummy!!Greatest  Best hot dog we've ever had. The French fries were large and crispy.

hLG3D0FBk8EXdbvtpRuGYg.text: Food is amazing staff is friendly! I highly recommend the shellfish tower it is a great deal!

qnJ22AMuSUwou7SfMAB-0g.text: While visiting Las Vegas on our wedding anniversary (and our 5yr old), I needed a restaurant nice enough for our anniversary dinner. I needed to get this one right this time; since previous years have not been good. Well... I hit the jackpot  (no pun intended). Let's just say that Friday night worked out great! Food was excellent, musician played acoustic 90s alternative and dedicated a song to us, and our service was good! We ended up playing some slots while the kid had a great time for an hour at the kiddie korner indoor play center onsite! We had a perfect night! Wish we won money...

aHxNFsgAJfcKpiKT9hf4vg.text: Honestly I'm not a fan.  The prices were ridiculous and the food wasn't anything special tasting.  I ordered French toast ($15.00) for breakfast, the server asked if I preferred sausage or bacon, thinking that it was included in the price I choose sausage . . . UGH it was $8.00 for a apple sausage link that probably came from a package which can be bought for about that price!  I wasn't happy about that, when there is a additional charge servers should state that!   My friend I was with ordered the lobster eggs benedict, while he said it was good however the price was also ridiculous at $32.00.    I can say I've eaten here, but never will again.  I can't justify the price for a simple meal that can be purchased elsewhere for a lot less that taste just as good, or maybe even better.

23oZUJ-gYAHeVzrwXyeJ6g.text: Love oysters so I particularly love Tuesdays at Bottiglia. One of my favorite Italian places in town! Plus their cocktail menu and staff are awesome!

BLmKMXVsct_-l3I-l3wrNQ.text: Very busy Italian restaurant..for good reasons. 1) Great location 2) Good Menu 3) Good food 4) Decent wine selection. I suggest reservations.outdoor. Weather permitting. Enjoy

wBy9br3Kq7SBvdkaI67XsQ.text: Love this place...one of our favorite date nights.  My husband loves the $1 oyster specials on Tuesday's and all the happy hour specials.  Decor is super cute and service is always great!

JTg7CBimPdSrp7uo_S3TlA.text: Great, fun adventurous place to dine! The food is amazing and the service is superb! I've been here twice and both times has been tremendous! I love that the owners are around and have stories to tell you about the dishes on their menu!! Bravo can't wait to go back and try Sunday brunch

H97lO9vN8_s_0alcFlMvpw.text: Used the private dining area and patio for a brunch event last Sunday. The food was fantastic, as well as the two Sangrias (white & red). Started with seafood platter: cracked king crab, jumbo shrimp, oysters, shelled lobster tails, then moved onto yogurt parfaits. The main course was French toast, egg white scramble with asparagus and avocado, and the outstanding prosciutto eggs Benedict which were all accompanied by bacon and potatoes. The service was amazing, the ambiance was spectacular and the patrons in the main dining room also all seemed very pleased. Highly recommended brunch here.

5-L66SQylJ1jljln8N4TjQ.text: Love the ambiance and the food was even better! I had the Bucatini and it was "OMG" good. King crab, zucchini, roasted tomatoes and bucatini in a perfect meyer lemon cream. It's all about this sauce!!! For my cocktail I had the Mulo Pazzo which I loved. Avion Reposado Tequila, lime, basil, ginger beer. I need to come back again soon so I can try the other food menu items. Everything looks delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucatini. This dish is absolute perfection.
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_k960PUJguyj5P7noUCGMg.text: I really like the place. Good food, good drinks, and awesome atmosphere. The outside patio is super European -like and coming from Europe it is always super relaxing and pleasant to eat or enjoy a drink outside. The inside is nicely decorated too, so I never really mind if we end up I side. A big plus is that there is a separate room with a big table that is good for larger reservations for special occasions.  Their drinks are awesome and there's a large selection of cocktails. The food is good too. Another plus is the location - it's inside the gvr which is close to my house and there is plenty of stuff to do after dinner.

UvfFrOeIzFNJSxIhKKsRUg.text: My girlfriend lives on the south end of Las Vegas. We have previously dined there but apparently the menu has changed very recently. We decided to go based off of the menu change and the mood for Italian food.  We were NOT disappointed. I had a cocktail called Off to the Races and started w a prosciutto carpaccio appetizer that was outstanding. Balsamic/arugula/prosciutto ratio was perfect.  My entree was veal ossobuco. Very tender, perfectly cooked and great polenta. My lady ordered risotto frutti di mare (seafood risotto) which may have stolen the whole show. Risotto is so often undercooked or mishandled. This one was cooked perfectly and had that seafood flavor that was spot on. The quality of the calamari and shrimp along with the flavor of red sauce made the dish.   What stood out the most was the service from our waiter Nick. Honesty when recommending dishes when we couldn't decide and just overall consideration were exceptional, even for Vegas restaurant service.  I've been here 5 times over the past few years and this experience tonight was by far my favorite.  Highly recommended if you're craving Italian food, good cocktails, and awesome service.

OGfoggrR-1bv1IaY7s-ntg.text: Absolutely amazing dinner, service was impeccable. As we immediately walked in Alexis was ready to seat us, the atmosphere was exquisite. We love to eat, my boyfriend is a die hard Italian food lover and it's incredibly hard to find places that I get No complaints. Bottiglia seemed to be one of those places with well made food, fresh ingredients. Fast service! And what topped our experience off even more is Kevin our server table touched just the right amount of times. He was pleasant and helped make our experience. Upon leaving Alexis was sooooo knowledgeable about the restaurant , the specials , and did a phenomenal job of ensuring we would come back. Someone is doing it right! Cheers to good food, good wine, good company!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato burrata
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy, perfectly cooked, amazing sauces
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FRESH FRESH FRESH (they also have $1 oysters on Tuesdays)

WBzImBYWMjlbaSRGX_Lu3A.text: Wow! What an atomsphere! Beautiful Decor that will leave your group feeling intimate and sexy. The food was amazing with incredible presentation value!  I love their food! Their brunch and dinner have some incredible vegetarian options that truly allow you to taste variety in thier menu. You have to try thier french toast! Perfect treat to Sunday Brunch.  On a side note, Bottiglia is a very slow paced environment so this is not the best place for groups in a rush to eat or that come Bottiglia ravenous. It seems that their goal is to provide an environment that will get you talking and engaged with your party. However, not knowing this upfront could completely create a misconception about dining here so make sure you have time to sit down and really take in the atmosphere they create for you.  Bottiglia is perfect for Sunday Brunch, and Group get togethers, Networking Dinners,  Bachelorette Partys, Baby Showers, & Bridal Showers. A total must see!

d3wZPhkbTLXrjrabEn3XhA.text: our server mackenzie was amazing! food was delicious and our other two waiters (both named john) were also so amazing and funny! loved this place will definitely be coming back :)

nrnF8K1gpVrNSiUj7vNmPA.text: Bottiglia is me and my hubby's go-to spot for date nights. Perfect ambiance with low lighting and awesome live music (acoustic guitarist usually). Their food is amazing, especially the meatballs!  I also am a big fan of their brunch, especially the California eggs Benedict and bottomless mimosas.

64lVjwCIRuAMXknZoHnTJQ.text: Don't bother spending your time or money at Bottiglia. I will give the service 3 stars, but regarding the food, it was nothing short of terrible. We ordered the tuna tartar and it tasted like straight lemon from the guacamole to start. My sausage pasta entree was under cooked, not al dente, but hard as a rock and the sauce was bitter. Sadly, we will go to any other restaurant in GVR before visiting Bottiglia ever again.

bQ0Rchd02qLQFQjsKUbkyQ.text: I've never been here before and I was afraid of the food at first, but our server Kelly made me and my date feel comfortable to experience new foods by offering different options and describing the contents! The pasta with mushrooms was delicious and I would have never tried it without him! I can tell he is a very experienced server and I'll be coming back to this restaurant just for him! Thanks Kelly!

Mz0cVuhVduHMf6RQH48DMA.text: Re: Brunch Nice looking place, sat at the bar. We waited about 30 minutes for some black coffee. The food arrived quickly, but the eggs were cold. We told the waiter, he took the plate back and returned the same plate about 2 minutes later. *No offer to take the coffee or eggs off the bill. The $14 French Toast was OK. In the end, they weren't sure which bill to give us. Maybe we'll try it again, but not at the bar? Still, very nice looking place.

wk6yF11W92eyEnZVnic4vQ.text: We are frequent diners of Hearthstone. They had recommended if we were in the Henderson area to give their sister restaurant a try.  Bottiglia is great! We ate around 5:30 and the lighting inside was beautiful. Really well decorated place. I have lots of experience in the food and beverage industry and wow am I impressed! My wife and I try to stay away from unhealthy foods like fatty pastas the majority of the time so we were pleased to see the menu featured plates with more healthy options. Our server , Coby, gave a personal recommendation of the grilled salmon to my wife. She was considering the chop salad with shrimp added but she was so please to have the delicious quinoa salad that paired nicely with the salmon. I myself enjoyed the tuna tartare and spaghetti squash as entrees.  We will certainly visit again on a Thursday to enjoy wine.

fsEJ4skjv4aJKvjaHLOeYQ.text: It's been about 14 months since we have been there so we decided to have dinner at the bar. While I still can't stand  the multi gender bathroom, the food and service have improved nicely. Monday night and it was packed. While I still think that there are at least 3 better Italian restaurants very close by,if you are at the casino to play and want a quick bit or a nice dinner, it would be perfect. Caution,some  drinks ( non happy hour) are way over priced. The menu is also pricy for certain entrees. Ciao

_Wa8xtbRyyoiNThybB7O7A.text: Bottiglia is warm and welcoming, greeting costumers with a smile and offering excellent service. Not only do they have good costumer interaction, but they also have amazing food choices that are great to share amongst big groups.  Diane was very helpful had made our experience enriching, would come back again 10/10

rsjvJBKyuPXM5DtqSXLyYw.text: I literally cannot get enough of the food here. The service is absolutly fantastic. Everybody from the Hostess to the waiter to the busser was super kind & very attentive. I'm proud to call Bottiglia one of THE finest resturants in Henderson as well as one of the finest resturants I have EVER been to.

5Ez9KXDxMyo1iFE4_Cv2UA.text: We all know this place is new however there is No excuse for the Terrible service. This is my second time here and the food is not bad but the poor service is ridiculous. It took 15 minutes to get a menu and another 15 minutes to get a waiter.

Z8kWuhkQ7wjKBAAFtUN3Qw.text: Celeste was super awesome, sweet, and even created our cocktail for us! It was a pleasure having her as our bartender. Would absolutely recommend! Her knowledge and skill are unmatched. My friend and I have worked for Light Group and feel she exceeds the LG standard. Great local spot!

1iF-A9K3H2mP4JAKfDUcCA.text: Great food and even better service. If you're looking for variety and quality Italian cuisine this is the place. From the salads to appetizers to entrees and desserts this restaurant has so much to offer. My favorites are the chopped salad, wild mushroom risotto, paperdelle bolognese , and the veal marsala. Will not disappoint!

-Gck_r23NckMzehwGyvhVg.text: Went to Bottiglia for the first time last night to celebrate a birthday. The decor is just beautiful. They were pretty busy for it being a Wednesday night but our server Raul was very attentive to our needs and helped make the birthday girl feel very special! Chef Josh even came out to wish her a happy bday and cut the cake! I had Caesar salad, calamari and bucatini. All were amazing but the Caesar salad was my favorite, the flavor is incredible. Can't wait to try their $1 oysters on Tuesdays.

a9L24Z0dOEm4c5bc834X9g.text: We have tried Bottiglia three times.  The first time things were a bit crazy but it was opening week.  The second and third times, we couldn't have been happier with our meals and service.  Gerard was our server and he was awesome.  Also the bartender was very friendly.  The food is delicious and they have some amazing specials and happy hours so check that out too.  The decor is light and airy--something different for an Italian restaurant.   We will be regulars!

D0SSmFZqMfmG7a9G246SAg.text: Had my birthday brunch here this past Sunday. We had a giant group (28 people) and I was ridiculously impressed with the food, service and management. Great gluten free options too! My favorite was the California Benedict (comes on a grilled tomato instead of an English Muffin).

BXK4fGm7cSt0_ohK4izTRA.text: Amazing food and atmosphere! Great service. The brunch is also amazing! My recommendation- the corned beef hash or the shirt rib!

YhxNlfr_YeMXZJyA3JrmHA.text: My spouse and I were here twice with other couples. The decor is very pleasant and bright. The staff though is spotty. At times very attentive and at times they can't be found. I found both times if you don't ask for bead you are not going to get any. The food is very good but I found the portions to be hit or miss. I ordered chicken parm the first time and it was very good and a more than adequate portion. I ordered a different chicken dish a second time and it looked like an appetizer. Everything is alla cart so you'll need to order side dishes. All in all the atmosphere and the food offset the negatives

Nbu6jUSGxGLsg4fmTfSMbg.text: My husband and I have diner here twice now and have loved it both times! The food is fantastic! We have the arrancini every time. We tried the octopus this time. Fantastic! The short rib pasta was also a winner. This is a great place to have a delicious dinner in a beautiful atmosphere. The service is top notch. We dined with Derek this evening and he was fantastic. We will be returning weekly I'm sure!

X3khyTvaAzGP70s0AROwRg.text: If you love Italian food you have to go to this place. I recommend the short rib or the lobbster Diablo. Whoa. Charcuterie is a no brainer. Service and staff was phenomenal. I didn't save room for dessert but I would assume its top notch.

yFKLLRFA1xscFvBLOucmvQ.text: The steak could have been cooked more but otherwise was good. The chicken Parmesan was mediocre. For sides the spaghetti squash was delicious, cauliflower was good, pasta carbonara was so salty we couldn't eat it. Most of the staff was friendly and professional.

QzVRP6Zm8jscAy1oHtiCcw.text: The atmosphere and decor is amazing. Food is fantastic, love the presentation. The service was perfect. Drinks constantly filled and all needs were met. Highly recommend this place.

D3BnlqxDcFhPLL2p0Vc9pw.text: I love this restaurant! We had Raul as our server and he was amazing! He was very knowledgeable about the menu and very friendly. The decor is beautiful and the atmosphere is amazing. I would highly recommend to anyone.

lbcPlIsZbLt7im85uiWxig.text: Great food, great service! Thanks Ryan :) brunch was incredible! Def coming back very soon!

65qEwEVqYSBZ490Y6wWCYQ.text: Really great service and good food. Derek was our server and he was great. Beet salad was my favorite.

7Y_7nlyg85UoHHsXIVIrHQ.text: It's our third trip to the restaurant and hands down the best Italian restaurant especially the service. Brian is extremely knowledgable and wasn't lying when he said their tiramisu is the best in town.

xmc1-78cpdk9hoYTRMoRTQ.text: First off let me just say wow. What a good job they do here at bottiglia with making sure all your needs are met! Food I ordered: half a dozen diamond point oysters, eggplant parm with buffalo mozz (which is to die for by the way, swear I could eat a hotel pan full!) Linguine vongole extra spicy and new York cheesecake with warm cherries. A glass of brancott to accompany the meal was the perfect touch. If you get the chance ask to speak to Mary one of the managers here and she can help out with anything you need to improve your experience. Definitely has a feel as if I'm dining with family! Chef Ben too! If he isn't too busy he won't hesitate to drop by the table and answer any questions or say hello! I'll definitely be back. Thanks to all the staff that helped me out tonight. Couldn't have had a better experience.

JjF_Cj5J4W9-cha8iYIpwA.text: Great food! Very cute place. But I took away one star bc I felt like the menu didn't have enough variety.

N3z3s_IYIrdyLRRwqARuhg.text: The restaurant is beautiful in the Green Valley Ranch. The food is very good. Maybe because we are spoiled with other exceptional Italian restaurants in Henderson and the noise level (loud), I couldn't give it the 5th star. Worth going there for a romantic dinner.

lkQNIIMCoQfpWqUbjuUdOQ.text: For a new restaurant, the service was pretty good but there is definitely room for improvement. We made a reso for a large party of 15 people, and only had one server. The reso was made with a time constraint, and we weren't finished in time. Most restaurants will have two servers to a table if the party is large. I think the service would have been much smoother and quicker with two servers. The food runners weren't very sure of their seat numbers so food was being given to the wrong customers. I could tell our server was stressed out, however, he was polite the whole time. This restaurant needs more practice with larger parties. The food was very impressive and I truly enjoyed the calarmi, octopus, chicken piccata, macaroni and cheese, tomato soup, etc. It was all very good. We came for a birthday and one of the food runners (Isaiah) sang for us in Italian and it was such a special moment for our friend. The servers really seem to enjoy what they do and it was much appreciated. I would recommend this to anyone wanting a nice dinner with a beautiful environment. I will be coming back.

VKLEkUsYahkuomspKij8vg.text: I only came here for drinks but I love it still!  The restaurant is amazingly gorgeous and I can sit in there or at the bar all day.  They have wine specials on Thursdays and a night with live music.  My friend ordered a grilled cheese and tomato soup which I was lucky enough to try and it was amazing.  I can't wait to come here for an actual meal because I suspect it will be fantastic.  They do brunch as well so maybe I'll try that as well!

ckFIGqa7okB046q00UNZig.text: Wow! If I could give this place 6 stars... I would! I absolutely loved the interior decor and lounge area (not to mention there's also a killer patio)   We sat in the lounge and ordered several items off the happy hour and regular menus. During happy hour they offer 6$ glasses of house red and white wines and they're actually pretty decent! Not your usual happy hour crap!  Appetizers we tried: The Charcuterie plate, zucchini flowers, meatballs, heirloom tomato bruschetta and the arancini- they were all top notch.   Based of off my servers recommendation, for my entree, I had the pappardelle with short rib bolognese.  Pasta was extremely fresh and cooked perfectly. The bolognese sauce had large pieces of rich short rib wasn't too fatty or salty, it was perfect.   The manager, Javier was very kind and you can tell he really cares about the restaurant and customers. All that to say, Bottiglia is still new but they've got their food, vibe and management dialed in! I will definitely be back

mfPl-jerZNMR87yaWshNdQ.text: 3.5 service, 4 star food ,but atmosphere is 5+...sorry to say but everything else is not so impressed at all.. Hostess were not as friendly either.  Waiters were little too unhappy face..  Well, I don't think would go back there soon!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iLWfJUVOczgjjEXqqH6img.text: Absolutely love this place. The Stuffed Zucchini Flower, Lobster Diavolo, and the white sangria are a few of the items on the menu that I dream about.   I call the Stuffed Zucchini Flower, zucchini flower bomb! It's filled with some kind of cream cheese concoction, breaded and deep fried. The flavors and texture of this is just superb!  The Lobster Diavolo is my ultimate favorite item on the menu. You get large bite size chunks of lobster in the pasta dish, plus the head of the lobster which is very tasty. The burst of flavors from the lobster and perfectly al dente pasta is what will keep me coming back.  Wait, I take that back. The white sangria will also keep me coming back. Get a pitcher, because it is too delicious to have just one glass. It tastes as pretty as it smells. The floral scent in this sangria will keep you mesmerized.  Definitely a new fave spot in Henderson.  One thing I do wish they had: a kid's menu. I'd love to come here with my family, and that includes 3 small children.

I9iwWNCGJxkdcvotScMa2Q.text: Love eating here. The food is always delicious. Our server, Michelle, provided great service. Was able to get gluten free pasta pomodoro. It was tasty and had a nice kick.

Q2z33momcXLXFEA49FiDzg.text: Very bright restaurant with that summer house on the beach feel to it...  Down to the most important thing on the review...the food. We started off with:  Zucchini Flowers - Wasn't really feeling the lemon with the ricotta with the zucchini flower...ok dish app at best...  Arancini - Good....almost if not better than Nora's Arancini  Charcuterie - Is there really such a thing as a bad charcuterie plate?  Baked Gnocchi Arrabbiata - Sauce on this is fire with a little kick to it...the consistency of the Gnocchi may not be for everyone but basically it is similar to Japanese Mochi...fire  Sausage & Rapini - Spicy sausage over pasta which is fiarly good  Pan Roasted Halibut - This is a highly recommended dish...doesn't even taste like fish, seared well with a lot of flavor...excellente  NY Style Cheesecake - Done very well, big portion for sure  Donuts - Donut holes but far from the best ones I ever had...at this point in the meal it was too difficult to eat  Overall between the atmosphere and food this place is pretty good and a great addition to Green Valley's emerging roster as one of the best restaurant offerings in a local property.

GLr9AveeRyzPVDIi5jOdow.text: I must say that I rarely give 5* to restaurants as very few are near or exactly perfect. This restaurant was near perfect and deserves the top rating.  The service was impeccable; not annoyingly frequent but she was present when needed. The wine list, albeit not very extensive, it was decent and the Pinot Noire glass I had was very good.  For appetizer, I had the tomato soup; it was excellent. For entree, I had the Gnocchi Arrabbiata. It was spicy and the amount of heat was just perfect.  I cannot rate dessert as I was stuffed and had no room for it.  Very good restaurant.

x13ztoGcMya4EQ44nHs-Og.text: Sat at the bar, bartender was a sweetheart, very friendly and interactive with us. Food was very flavorful and nice selection of drinks.  Main courses do not come with sides those are extra but they do have a decent selections of sides and from what seen at other tables they are enough two people couple share.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara Mac &amp; Cheese (so yummy)
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Ravioli

oqCM-RcZulWmybDPOy_c0Q.text: Terribly disappointed in the food and service. I chose this restaurant for Valentine's dinner based on many great reviews from friends.   Our waitress brought us menus after we'd been seated for over 10 minutes. She explained everything and left without taking our drink order. She returned to fill water glasses and still didn't take our drink order. 13 minutes later we saw her point at us as if she totally forgot she was our waitress. We ordered drinks, apps, and entrees. We received the appetizers before we got our drinks, which we had to ask the server who brought the apps for because she clearly forgot.   The crispy calamari sat on a bed of what looked like fryer scraps. Calamari is not supposed to be served like that. It also did not come with a lemon garnish. I've never been served calamari without lemon to squeeze on it. The Brussels Sprouts were yummy, although she said they came with pine nuts and ours did not.  I ordered the halibut. They were two very small pieces compared to the 3 photos in Yelp. It was by far the driest halibut I've ever had. The risotto it sat on was room temperature, not the slightest bit warm. The carrot and pea puree were tasty.   We decided to have dessert elsewhere since our experience/food were not pleasant.   Also, we found it a bit odd that the servers did not have more professional attire. Black slacks would look so much nicer than jeans. And the waitress with her phone hanging out of her back pocket was extremely distasteful. We will not be back!

pRAY5gRqb0q5gZGM9wkNYA.text: This place. Has blown my socks off haha! We came to celebrate a friends birthday and we made no reservations and were sat immediately. Prices are very reasonable. The ambiance is upscale with a casual feel though. We were brought warm bread and crispy parm as soon as we ordered our drinks. For appetizers, we shared the beef and prosciutto carpaccio  and the wood roasted cauliflower. Both which were spectacular. For my main entree I had the King Crab Bucatini. This dish was so tasty that I didn't want to eat it on the basis that I did not want the dish to come to an end! The rest of the table also ordered spinach lasagna, and the baked gnocchi arribbiata. Both again, such great dishes! (At least, the only ones I was able to try without getting reprimanded by the others, so tasty!!) I also ordered the 2013 Napa Valley Annabella bottle of Cabernet which tied the experience together in such a refined way. To end our meal, we ordered every desert on the menu. Including the sampler so we got to enjoy every tasty dessert available. From cannolis, to doughnuts, to cheesecake, to everything haha.  Inside the GVR, this is a hidden gem! Such a nice place to relax and enjoy the company of your friends and/or family!

5RmhwrnTkQ3PbgFT2jYtKA.text: We recently visited Bottiglia for the first time. We pleasantly surprised with the brightness of their interior and decor. There are TV's throughout and they have outdoor seating with misters. The staff was very friendly and we were checked on often by them and the management. Their menu is not pricey and have some nice food & wine selections. We had the Halibut & Risotto and Chicken Parmigiana. The halibut was moist and flakey, risotto was perfect and the chicken was moist and flavorful, not dry like some other places we've patronized. Dessert was a tasty Tiramisu with Cookie. A very good dining experience and we look forward to returning again.

Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmigiana
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut and Risotto

E8ez5fK06jV9k4VHnBibFg.text: Dined at Bottiglia this evening.  Food was delicious, serving staff excellent, and the interior decor very inviting, light, and bright.  BUT, the music is so LOUD, that the three of us at a small table had to lean in to hear each other.  It is beyond me why restaurants need to blast music.  People come to restaurants to enjoy the food and converse.  We had considered having our "girls night out" at this restaurant, but know that with 6 to 7 at a table, we wouldn't be able to hear each other. Please turn the music down so diners can hear each other!

2U04TgaZh2a7rFgiKZ88ng.text: The cutest place! Great for brunch! Lemon sherbet prosecco Delish!  Good vibes and chill jams!

-628G4jRAot6233pBjdKkg.text: My grandparents love this place and when we visited they had to take us here. The decorations inside are very cute, it didn't even feel like we were in a casino. There were TVs all over the place, though, which killed the mood of the cute wine bar feel. It caused a weird clash and seemed like the focus was on sports instead of company. The table came with assorted breads. Nobody complained about them but nobody ate much. Everyone got drinks, wine or beer. My husband was not impressed by the beer but I had a red wine and it was pretty good.  The menu was rather small. And the food was small, too! I ordered the beet salad and it turned out to be half of a beet cut up and garnished with lettuce. It tasted good, although for the price I would have expected 'great', but there was just so little of it that it was disappointing. Almost everyone else got steak or a pot roast and mashed potatoes. Their meal size was also pretty small. I could have very easily eaten 3 of those meals and I'm not even a giant eater. My family passed me pieces of their plates as they pitied my itty bitty salad. I tried almost everyone's meat and it tasted pretty yummy.  Overall we were not impressed and we left hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Single Beer
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread for the table
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet salad

6zD7Q09JpnPaWVcxYVmooQ.text: Food and  service was excellent.  They paid close attention to when then they felt we were ready for more drinks or for our main course.  Such a great deal on their happy hour half off pasta and drink specials.  Dinner, desert , and drinks all reasonable.  The desserts were delightful.  Hats off to the chefs and  staff.  We will be back especially for the crab bucatini.

Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bottiglia Enoteca - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FJDmO37YruW4oMCMUZDzcw.text: Food wasn't as great as I thought it was gonna be for dinner. The atmosphere isn't for a long intimate date night due to the televisions in sight of the dinning areas. The place is good for brunch and sitting at the bar at night. Our server and was just ok. Bartenders were better.

286mfM1AG_hgZ5QdTNq0dA.text: We have really given this restaurant a fair try.  Have been there 5 times and each time, there were issues.  Will start on a positive note for our last visit.  The server and staff were actually very good.  In the past, we have had everything from inattentive staff to one who told us a history of their mental issues.  Our waiter got the order correct.  In the past, always had wrong or missing dishes.  The temperature of the restaurant was actually appropriate.  In the past, it was so cold we actually asked for additional table candles to warm our hands.  Now for the issues.  The hot food is never hot.  Aside from the cold seafood and salads, most dishes we have tried have not been very good.  This time pasta and eggplant were terrible.  We always seem to have an issue with at least one of our main courses.  And it's not an issue of price, as always free thanks to a comp.  But even for free, still a pass.

1WKm139ijw6EWhItxWcazQ.text: Lovely restaurant with accommodating and knowledgeable waitstaff. Food is good and wine list just enough moderate to high priced choices.

fF6pZLA2l4XrPnfABrpfGw.text: Amazing staff, pretty amazing happy hour and Thursdays are half off wine bottles! Our server Nick was fantastic!

aLh1NKTvsMCEAbebOxR3EA.text: I went to the happy there  yesterday which is from 5 to 7 PM. Was wondering why it was so empty, I found my reason afterwards. They've changed the menu for the happy hour and raised the prices. For seven dollars they have a limited amount of appetizers you can order from. I ordered the meatball slider thinking I would get two or three for seven dollars. It was so tiny I received one and barely got two bites out of it. I would've been embarrassed to serve it. It wasn't even good. I will not return for happy hour, they are  not a good choice.

1SF2JO0q0mpAQON15oIxCQ.text: Our server wasn't very friendly or attentive, however the bussers and food runners that came by were great. I loved the food and atmosphere! It was probably one of the best carpaccios I've ever had, and the gnocchi was excellent. I will definitely be back to try their brunch soon.

v6b6LcFG7SWTTEJKn3I_xQ.text: I ate here tonight with my girlfriend and Michelle was our server. The bread service was immediate and the water was filled the moment we were sat which was also a small wait nothing more than 3 minutes which was great. We ordered the calamari, which was great and crispy. For entrees we ordered the chicken piccata and gnocchi arrabiatta which was great and the sauces went great with the bread to add some amazing flavors. For dessert we ordered the dessert sampler which was a great deal for the amount of desserts you get it came with the lemon curd donuts, strawberry panna cotta which with the strawberry sauce was amazing, by far my favorite. The last dessert was the tiramisu which was also a great dessert and my girlfriends favorite for sure. Definitely a place I would revisit and recommend to others for good service and a great dinner.

WLOZ3YyDfmTo8infGDUsnQ.text: Hosted a birthday dinner for 22 year old daughter.  Food rates 4.5 stars but the staff needs more training.  Took too long to take drink and food orders, forgot bread, tried several times to removes plates before done, and forgot to honor the birthday girl, among other snafus.  The staff was nice enough but not trained enough.  Perhaps the A team was on vacation the night before Thanksgiving.  Pork chops plump and tasty.  Rabe perfectly spicy.  Shortribs flavorful and tender.  Tomatoes in caprese sweet. Garlic Lavosh crisp.  Bottom line, would like owner to reply with commitment to improve flow of service before I return.  Has potential that was not displayed on Nov 23.

LmjIekbUpc0baZ2AU4e1tA.text: Fantastic venue, very classy, perfect for having lunch on the patio on a nice cool day, food was amazing and the customer service was terrific as well.

3SWAjIcwi9fJVP0O5nlJag.text: Loved the Lobster Fra Diablo!!!  And get the scroppino cocktail.....it's delish!!  Love the vibe and the decor! Fabulous!!  Loved the pannacotta!! And free wine with a check-in!!  :)

28PaV1L50XQcelFZDOqZMA.text: I can't express in words how AMAZING my experiences have been at this restaurant!  Not only is the food just DIVINE, the staff, from the hostess to the servers, the management.... they are all so polite, welcoming and on top of their job!!  The restaurant has a fresh vibe which I love. Can't stop thinking of the FOOD! It's all SO GOOD!!!

x45Ed9q2zMp60liibDAL0w.text: We came in response to a large advertisement for 1/2 price Senior Citizen entrees on Sundays from 5:00 - 7:00.  We planned our day around it and arrived right on time.  My husband asked for a table.  The two hostesses sneered at him and said we'd have to sit outside--in 110-degree heat!  We declined, of course, but we were both just aghast.  If they don't want senior citizens in there, they shouldn't buy advertising aimed at us.

k9AeT6LX2alNW3V7LEEnuw.text: Love the atmosphere, food and decor. Amazing vibe here. We have been needing more places like this in the District. It transports you to a chic beach restaurant. Food so yum. Make sure to order the zucchini flower appetizer. You won't regret it. Make sure to make a reservation. They have tvs strategically placed so you can take your love on a romantic date but still watch the game. Put the kids in kids quest and you have a winner!

RLwcGsvAWU1MbezHNUKY_w.text: Love every about this restaurants vibe.. The Decour is a breath of fresh air and high energy. The food is delicious with their own unique twist to common dishes. The service staff is on top of it and are very welcoming and friendly. I can now see what all the hype is about in the Henderson., green valley and anthem area. I feel Bottigila with out a doubt be my favorite new spot to go..

J-1JLbfpha8kP3bPDLWyBQ.text: My girlfriend and I came here to have my birthday dinner and what an amazing experience it was. The food and drink selection is excellent as is the service. We didn't know exactly what we wanted  and our server Michelle was superb on recommendations and menu knowledge. The manager Mary, was also extremely kind and gave us a complementary dessert for my birthday while consistently making sure we were happy with our experience. I will most certainly be back to enjoy another evening dining here very soon.

6Ud5z_TmYnjvkMdH3DMT2A.text: Great food . Talented bartenders provide better entertainment than the city! Highly recommend.

wxA9stCgfNzUC55Ybodv2g.text: I had an amazing time at Bottiglia! From the second you walk in till you leave, you feel very welcomed and the atmosphere of the restaurant sets the mood for a nice dinner. Our server was fantastic very knowledgable about the menu and the wine list! I had the Lobster Fra Diavolo it was fantastic! I loved how they used parts of the tail and the claw in the dish which made it more authentic for me! I will be returning maybe for some cocktails at the bar this time!

l370A8FHufeMHPf0eeE-AQ.text: For a restaurant that has only been open a very short time this one seems to have gained quite a following.  At 6 PM on Tuesday the place was absolutely packed-not a seat available.  Three friends and I had dinner here tonight and have to say this is a winner with one exception. Friend number one had halibut and it was very dry and overdone. Halibut is a delicate fish and there's a fine line between perfect and overdone this one definitely crossed the line. The rest of us had Veal Marsala which we all really liked.  Oddly enough they used enoki mushrooms instead of button or cremini mushrooms but the veal  was tender and the sauce was excellent. We ordered pasta side dishes, I ordered pappardelle with Bolognese sauce expecting to get a very small side order since everything is a la carte but side order was very generous. Sadly the Bolognese was not True Bolognese sauce which is made with the addition of milk-this one wasn't but was still a very good sauce.  Caesar salads  were very fresh and the dressing was excellent. Olive bread and sourdough bread basket could have been heated but was served cold although it was very fresh. The addition  of lemon flavored butter was a real taste treat.  I wish I could remember the name of our server - he was a young black man who really knew his way around serving. Very personable, brought our orders out immediately and checked on us to make sure everything was OK. We're going to look for him again the next time we return.  The Decor is white and pastels-very pretty but the patio is a real knockout. If it weren't so hot we would have eaten out there for sure. Definitely next time because we will be back Oh one more thing: the red sangria is out of this world but a little too pricey.

BvUznDcw6CphV8j5pY4suw.text: Fantastic service! Hands down, the best chicken parm I have ever had and my grandma is 100% Italian. Everything was super fresh including the oysters. The manager Javier is attentive and took a few minutes to talk with my wife and I. We have our new Italian spot!

bvbjNg828PNlyI-d0yvEQg.text: Beautiful room! I went there for dollar oyster Tuesday's! Oysters were amazing! What other place do you know that does dollar oysters?! They also do half priced bottles of wine up to $100 on Thursdays! Easily some of the best deals in Vegas! It is definitely Worth the journey across town and I will definitely be back!

NkxGDrjWuIArb0isUHJsBw.text: I had the spaghetti and meatballs it was really good I also ordered Fried Chicken with mashed potatoes it was so great  can't explain it I really love it here the food is amazing the employees are really friendly the hospitality is great I will definitely come here again for sure with my whole family one of the best restaurant I ever ate in.

Hu2ImgKBVNOHxaYEFiqmPQ.text: A very good and consistent restaurant. If you enjoy good ambiance you'll love this place. It is possibly the most inviting restaurant I've been to. The food is very good and we have tried several different entrees and appetizers and have loved most everything we have tried. It's a tad pricey but our overall experiences have been worth the price. The food comes out fresh and fast....

H8heMRJcGqwFQFbvRsXAbg.text: I ordered the prosciutto eggs Benedict and it was amazing. The bacon on the side was a great addition to the meal. The potatoes that came standard with the meal were delicious. The poached egg was cooked to perfection, bursting with yolk when you cut into it. I came with friends so I got to try other dishes as well. The bread pudding was not too sweet and very fresh and a nice twist on a classic dish. The asparagus were great as a side as well. The buffalo mozzarella panni my girlfriend ordered was a delicious surprise, and would definitely try out next time. This was their first brunch and the service was exceptional

R9vEDNJjD-NvJ_FFWvSeCw.text: Great food for a fair price, and the portions for the entrees are actually enough to satisfy and then some.

dIqhp3j5jh1n4VtscXd5Ww.text: Such a wonderful experience ! The food was delicious and the dessert... extraordinarily!! Bryan was such a sweet person. Definitely a must to come here
